original: 90 /'byung ba nyi ma zla ba'i grangs ni mi yi bdag po phyed bcas zla ba dag dang lo gsum mo //
analyzed: 90 /'byung ba nyi ma zla ba'i grangs ni mi yi bdag po phyed bcas zla ba dag dang lo gsum mo //
translated: The number of the lunar mansions in the course of a year is the number of days in three years and a half, O King.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba dor nas thub mchog rnams kyis bcad pa dag ni dus kyi 'khor lor 'gyur //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba dor nas thub mchog rnams kyis bcad pa dag ni dus kyi 'khor lor 'gyur //
translated: Subtracting half a month, the divisions of the supreme sages are the wheel of time.

original: zla bar bsre ba gza' gcig dang ni mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod tshogs la gnyis dang rkang pa mda' //
analyzed: zla bar bsre ba gza' gcig dang ni mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod tshogs la gnyis dang rkang pa mda' //
translated: In the lunar mansions, one planet, two in the pairs of hours, two in the groups of hours, and the feet are the arrows.

original: 'khor lo dag las nges par lha mo drug cu rnams kyis rnam par phye  bdag ni gzar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'khor lo dag las nges par lha mo drug cu rnams kyis rnam par phye  bdag ni gzar 'gyur ro /
translated: From the wheels, the planets are certainly distinguished by the sixty goddesses.

original: 91 / sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis kyang chu tshod thub pa nor gyis bsgyur ba'i lha mo rnams las tshogs la gnyis //
analyzed: 91 / sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis kyang chu tshod thub pa nor gyis bsgyur ba'i lha mo rnams las tshogs la gnyis //
translated: And by the thirty-two, the pairs of hours are from the goddesses multiplied by the wealth of the sages.

original: sbyin dor sbyin pa dag dang ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang po lnga ste 'dir ni drug gis so //
analyzed: sbyin dor sbyin pa dag dang ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang po lnga ste 'dir ni drug gis so //
translated: The feet of the first five, the feet of the hare, are subtracted from the gifts. Here, it is by six.

original: zla ba'i phyogs gsum nyin zhag rnams ni sum 'gyur dag kyang nyi ma'i longs spyod la ni rab tu grags //
analyzed: zla ba'i phyogs gsum nyin zhag rnams ni sum 'gyur dag kyang nyi ma'i longs spyod la ni rab tu grags //
translated: The three lunar fortnights and the days, tripled, are well known to be the enjoyment of the sun.

original: drug cus phye ba'i skar ma gnyis dang nyi ma'i nyin zhag dang por spyod ldan dbang phyug chu tshod do /
analyzed: drug cus phye ba'i skar ma gnyis dang nyi ma'i nyin zhag dang por spyod ldan dbang phyug chu tshod do /
translated: The two stars of the two lunar mansions, and the first day of the sun, are the two periods of the lord of the zodiac.

original: 92 / dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo gza' yi tshogs dang bcas pa 'di dag phyi dang lus la dbyer med par //
analyzed: 92 / dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo gza' yi tshogs dang bcas pa 'di dag phyi dang lus la dbyer med par //
translated: These glorious Wheel of Time deities, together with the hosts of planets, are inseparable from the outer and the body.

original: bsdu ba dang ni spro ba'i slad du srid pa gsum gyi gnas su nyi ma dus kyi gzugs dang ni //
analyzed: bsdu ba dang ni spro ba'i slad du srid pa gsum gyi gnas su nyi ma dus kyi gzugs dang ni //
translated: In order to gather and emanate, the forms of the sun and the time of the three worlds

original: shes rab thabs kyi rab dbye dang ni mnyam dang mi mnyam rigs dang myur 'khyog la sogs rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rab dbye dang ni mnyam dang mi mnyam rigs dang myur 'khyog la sogs rgyu ba ste //
translated: are the divisions of wisdom and method, the even and uneven types, and the movements of swift and slow, and so on.

original: chags bral dang ni thub mchog rigs dang tshangs dang drag po la sogs lha rnams kyis ni shes ma yin /
analyzed: chags bral dang ni thub mchog rigs dang tshangs dang drag po la sogs lha rnams kyis ni shes ma yin /
translated: They are not known by the gods, such as Brahma, Rudra, and so on, who are free from attachment and are of the supreme sage caste.

original: 93 / aa sogs lnga yis dbyangs gang dang po'i tshes grangs dbang gis dga' ba la sogs lnga dang ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: 93 / aa sogs lnga yis dbyangs gang dang po'i tshes grangs dbang gis dga' ba la sogs lnga dang ldan gyur pa //
translated: The vowels, beginning with a, are endowed with the five joys, beginning with joy, by the power of the first lunar day.

original: de dag 'dir ni 'char byed mi bdag gal te de las skyes la sogs gza' dag ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dir ni 'char byed mi bdag gal te de las skyes la sogs gza' dag ma gyur na'o //
translated: If the planets, beginning with Mercury, do not arise from them, then the king who causes them to arise here

original: sa skyes mi shis shar bar gyur cing gal te slar yang smin drug dag dang ldan pa nyid gyur pa //
analyzed: sa skyes mi shis shar bar gyur cing gal te slar yang smin drug dag dang ldan pa nyid gyur pa //
translated: If the inauspicious [planet] has arisen in the ascendant, and if it is again endowed with the [sign of the] Scorpion,

original: de la gal te g-yul dang nad du gyur na mi rnams 'chi bar 'gyur te dang po'i dbyangs kyi'o /
analyzed: de la gal te g-yul dang nad du gyur na mi rnams 'chi bar 'gyur te dang po'i dbyangs kyi'o /
translated: if it is in a battle or disease, people will die. This is the first [kind of] death.

original: 94 @11b bzang po zla skyes dag gi gza' 'di la ni gal te mchu nyid ldan na gnyis pa 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 94 @11b bzang po zla skyes dag gi gza' 'di la ni gal te mchu nyid ldan na gnyis pa 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: If this planet, which is born in the good month of Åšravaá¹‡a, is endowed with the [sign of the] Scorpion, the second [kind of] death will occur.

original: rgyal ba bla ma dag la gal te skag tu gyur na gsum  pa dag ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rgyal ba bla ma dag la gal te skag tu gyur na gsum  pa dag ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: If it is in the [sign of the] AÅ›vinÄ«, which is the teacher of the victors, the third [kind of] death will occur.

original: stong pa'i tshes dang pa sangs dag la gal te mon grur gyur na bzhi pa dag ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'i tshes dang pa sangs dag la gal te mon grur gyur na bzhi pa dag ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is in the [sign of the] MaghÄ, which is the first of the empty [signs], the fourth [kind of] death will occur.

original: rdzogs pa spen pa dag dang lhan cig tu ni bra nye gyur na lnga pa 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: rdzogs pa spen pa dag dang lhan cig tu ni bra nye gyur na lnga pa 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If it is in the [sign of the] Má¹›gaÅ›ira, which is together with the full [sign of the] PÅ«rvÄá¹£Äá¸hÄ, the fifth [kind of] death will occur.

original: 95 / nyi ma dag la dga' ba 'char ba rnams kyis rmar yang 'gyur te gzir ba rnams ni nyon mongs nyid //
analyzed: 95 / nyi ma dag la dga' ba 'char ba rnams kyis rmar yang 'gyur te gzir ba rnams ni nyon mongs nyid //
translated: If the rising sign is Cancer, the planets that rise in the good [signs] will be afflicted, and the afflicted [planets] will be tormented.

original: zla ba la ni bzang po 'char ba rnams kyis nges par g-yul dang nad  dag la yang de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: zla ba la ni bzang po 'char ba rnams kyis nges par g-yul dang nad  dag la yang de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: The good [planets] rising in the moon will certainly bring victory in battle and health.

original: bden par 'char ba lnga po rnams kyi 'bras bu mang por 'chi ba'i sbyor bas dman pa dag la 'gyur //
analyzed: bden par 'char ba lnga po rnams kyi 'bras bu mang por 'chi ba'i sbyor bas dman pa dag la 'gyur //
translated: The results of the five true risings are many, but they are weak in the application of death.

original: nad dang g-yul dang yul du bgrod dang bag ma dag la dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu shes par bya /
analyzed: nad dang g-yul dang yul du bgrod dang bag ma dag la dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu shes par bya /
translated: One should know the results, good and bad, in illness, battle, travel to a country, and in marriage.

original: 96 / de ltar rgyu skar gza' ste dbyangs tshogs tshes rnams dag ni de nyid lnga yi rab tu dbye ba yis //
analyzed: 96 / de ltar rgyu skar gza' ste dbyangs tshogs tshes rnams dag ni de nyid lnga yi rab tu dbye ba yis //
translated: Thus the stars, planets, vowels, and lunar days are distinguished by their five realities.

original: phyogs dang zla ba bgrod pa dag dang lo dang drug cu'i lo rnams la yang 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs dang zla ba bgrod pa dag dang lo dang drug cu'i lo rnams la yang 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur //
translated: They rise in the directions, in the moonâ€™s movement, in the year, and in the sixty-year cycle.

original: nag pa sogs la 'dir ni yan lag bcu gnyis dag gis 'char 'gyur phyogs kyi dbye ba de nyid do //
analyzed: nag pa sogs la 'dir ni yan lag bcu gnyis dag gis 'char 'gyur phyogs kyi dbye ba de nyid do //
translated: The same reality is distinguished by the directions in which the twelve branches, beginning with Ká¹›ttikÄ, rise.

original: nyin zhag dbyangs rnams bdun cu rtsa gnyis dag gis 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur te zla ba'i dbye ba la'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag dbyangs rnams bdun cu rtsa gnyis dag gis 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur te zla ba'i dbye ba la'o //
translated: The vowels rise in the day, in the seventy-two [parts], in the moonâ€™s division.

original: 97 / zla ba drug gis bgrod pa'i yan lag dag ste rab byung la sogs bcu gnyis lo rnams dag gis lo //
analyzed: 97 / zla ba drug gis bgrod pa'i yan lag dag ste rab byung la sogs bcu gnyis lo rnams dag gis lo //
translated: The six months of the northern course are the twelve years, beginning with the year of the monk, etc.

original: de ltar dbyangs ni lnga po rnams dag 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur te de ni phyi nas nub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbyangs ni lnga po rnams dag 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur te de ni phyi nas nub pa'o //
translated: Thus the five vowels arise here, and then they set.

original: dang po la ni dbyangs rnams byis pa rang tshes yon tan dbang gis dpal ldan gzhon nu gnyis pa la //
analyzed: dang po la ni dbyangs rnams byis pa rang tshes yon tan dbang gis dpal ldan gzhon nu gnyis pa la //
translated: In the first, the vowels are children, by the power of the qualities, glorious youths in the second,

original: dar bab rgan po rim pas me dang chu gter nyin zhag la ste lnga pa la ni nub par 'gyur /
analyzed: dar bab rgan po rim pas me dang chu gter nyin zhag la ste lnga pa la ni nub par 'gyur /
translated: middle-aged in the third, old in the fourth, and in the fifth they set, in the days of fire, water, treasure.

original: 98 / aa sogs dbyangs lnga gang dag nges par yon tan gyis bsgyur de dag rnams ni rnams gnyis sum cu nyid //
analyzed: 98 / aa sogs dbyangs lnga gang dag nges par yon tan gyis bsgyur de dag rnams ni rnams gnyis sum cu nyid //
translated: The five vowels, A, etc., are definitely transformed by the qualities, and they are the thirty in two groups.

original: ka sogs sde  pa'i yi ge rnams la rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis mtha' dag sbyar bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: ka sogs sde  pa'i yi ge rnams la rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis mtha' dag sbyar bar bya ba ste //
translated: The letters of the KA group are all to be applied by the power of the qualities of their nature.

original: thung ngu rnams ni 'dir yang dkar po'i phyogs la 'char bar 'gyur te de nyid lnga yi dbye bas so //
analyzed: thung ngu rnams ni 'dir yang dkar po'i phyogs la 'char bar 'gyur te de nyid lnga yi dbye bas so //
translated: The short ones arise here in the bright half, and they set in the dark half, by the division into five.

original: @12a * // ring po rnams ni nag po'i phyogs la shin tu nges par 'gyur te spro dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas so /
analyzed: @12a * // ring po rnams ni nag po'i phyogs la shin tu nges par 'gyur te spro dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas so /
translated: The long ones are very certain in the dark half, by the application of expansion and contraction.

original: 99 / nyi shu rtsa bdun rgyu skar de la gsal bar mda' yi chu tshod nyi ma'i dus sbyor cha dgu pa //
analyzed: 99 / nyi shu rtsa bdun rgyu skar de la gsal bar mda' yi chu tshod nyi ma'i dus sbyor cha dgu pa //
translated: The twenty-seven constellations are clear there, in the nine parts of the solar periods, in the periods of the lunar mansions.

original: lug gi dus sbyor la sogs 'di dag rnams kyang 'dir ni rang bzhin gsum ste brtan g-yo shin tu mnyam //
analyzed: lug gi dus sbyor la sogs 'di dag rnams kyang 'dir ni rang bzhin gsum ste brtan g-yo shin tu mnyam //
translated: These periods of Aries and so forth are here of three natures, stable, moving, and very balanced.

original: lug dang ka rka ta srang chu srin 'dir ni g-yo ba dag ste de las gnyis pa brtan pa'o //
analyzed: lug dang ka rka ta srang chu srin 'dir ni g-yo ba dag ste de las gnyis pa brtan pa'o //
translated: Aries, Cancer, Libra, and Capricorn are moving; the second of these is stable.

original: lhag ma gzhan ni gnyis kyi rang bzhin de dag nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su rtag pa nyid du 'char /
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan ni gnyis kyi rang bzhin de dag nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su rtag pa nyid du 'char /
translated: The remaining others are of both natures. They always rise in the periods of day and night.

original: 100 / de la yud tsam sum cu rnams dang nyin zhag dus la chu tshod dag kyang drug cu kho na ste //
analyzed: 100 / de la yud tsam sum cu rnams dang nyin zhag dus la chu tshod dag kyang drug cu kho na ste //
translated: There, in thirty periods, in the periods of the day, there are also sixty periods of sixty minutes.

original: dang por sum cu'i dbyangs rnams 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur ba nyid de yud tsam yud tsam dag la'o //
analyzed: dang por sum cu'i dbyangs rnams 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur ba nyid de yud tsam yud tsam dag la'o //
translated: Here, the first thirty vowels rise in the periods of the minutes.

original: sde pa'i yi ge sum cu chu tshod rnams la rab tu 'gyur te thung dang ring po rab dbye bas //
analyzed: sde pa'i yi ge sum cu chu tshod rnams la rab tu 'gyur te thung dang ring po rab dbye bas //
translated: The thirty letters of the class are the hours, divided into short and long.

original: zla ba'i dbus su tshes kyi cha la 'char bar brjod de de dag nub pa dag kyang de nyid la'o /
analyzed: zla ba'i dbus su tshes kyi cha la 'char bar brjod de de dag nub pa dag kyang de nyid la'o /
translated: The moon rises in the middle of the month, and it sets there too.

original: 101 / stong pa rlung me chu dang sa rnams dag kyang aa la sogs par dbyangs ni lnga po rnams kyi rigs //
analyzed: 101 / stong pa rlung me chu dang sa rnams dag kyang aa la sogs par dbyangs ni lnga po rnams kyi rigs //
translated: The five vowels, A and so forth, are the families of the void, wind, fire, water, and earth.

original: sgra gcan me dang zla nyi zla skyes mig dmar pa sangs bla ma mjug rings spen pa 'dir lhag lha //
analyzed: sgra gcan me dang zla nyi zla skyes mig dmar pa sangs bla ma mjug rings spen pa 'dir lhag lha //
translated: Rahu, Mars, the moon, the sun, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Ketu, and Puá¹£ya are the planets.

original: sngar brjod dus sbyor re re de la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dbang gis chu tshod rnams ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: sngar brjod dus sbyor re re de la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dbang gis chu tshod rnams ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: In each of the above-mentioned periods, the hours are determined by the day and the night.

original: de yi dbus su dbyangs gang byung ba'i gza' zhes bya ba stobs ldan de yis dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: de yi dbus su dbyangs gang byung ba'i gza' zhes bya ba stobs ldan de yis dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya /
translated: The planet that arises in the middle of that period is the powerful planet that accomplishes the maá¹‡á¸ala.

original: 102 / g-yon pa dag nas thung ngu'i dbyangs rnams 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur te g-yas pa nas kyang gzhan dag go //
analyzed: 102 / g-yon pa dag nas thung ngu'i dbyangs rnams 'dir ni 'char bar 'gyur te g-yas pa nas kyang gzhan dag go //
translated: The short vowels arise from the left here, and the others from the right.

original: g-yon la stong pa la sogs de nyid dag dang gza' tshogs rgyu ba sgra gcan la sogs mtha' dag ste //
analyzed: g-yon la stong pa la sogs de nyid dag dang gza' tshogs rgyu ba sgra gcan la sogs mtha' dag ste //
translated: In the left [house], the void [sign] and so on, the true [signs], the planets, and RÄhu and so on, in their entirety.

original: g-yas la de nyid 'dzin ma sogs dang gza' yi  tshogs ni  nges par nyi ma'i bu la sogs pa nyid //
analyzed: g-yas la de nyid 'dzin ma sogs dang gza' yi  tshogs ni  nges par nyi ma'i bu la sogs pa nyid //
translated: In the right [house], the true [signs] beginning with the virgin [Virgo], the planets, and the sons of the sun [the seven planets] and so on, for certain.

original: phyi rol tu yangs dus kyi chu tshod gza' yi gnas dang mnyam pa dbyangs bcas dag ni bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: phyi rol tu yangs dus kyi chu tshod gza' yi gnas dang mnyam pa dbyangs bcas dag ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: Outside, the twelve signs, the houses of the planets, and the lunar mansions, together with the vowels, are to be accomplished in the twelve two-hour periods of the day.

original: 103 / dris na g-yul gyi slad du 'chi bar 'gyur te stong pa la ni dus dag shar bar gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: 103 / dris na g-yul gyi slad du 'chi bar 'gyur te stong pa la ni dus dag shar bar gyur pa na'o //
translated: If asked, [the querent] will die in battle when the void [sign] rises in its time.

original: rlung du nyi ma dag la 'pham zhing me la sa skyes shar ba dag la rma ru 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rlung du nyi ma dag la 'pham zhing me la sa skyes shar ba dag la rma ru 'gyur ba yin //
translated: In the wind [house], the sun [sign] is defeated; in the fire [house], the rising of the earth [sign] is a wound.

original: chu dang bla ma la ni 'dum @12b par 'gyur te sa la spen pa shar la 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu dang bla ma la ni 'dum @12b par 'gyur te sa la spen pa shar la 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the water [house] and the guru [house], there is peace; in the earth [house], the rising of Saturn [sign] is not a quarrel.

original: 'chi dang nyon mongs rmar 'gyur  bde ba dag dang mnyam pa nyid ni 'dri byed nad pa rnams kyi'o /
analyzed: 'chi dang nyon mongs rmar 'gyur  bde ba dag dang mnyam pa nyid ni 'dri byed nad pa rnams kyi'o /
translated: Death, affliction, and a wound are equal to happiness for the sick who ask.

original: 104 / g-yul du dgra ni nges par rab tu nyams par 'gyur te sgra gcan stong pa dag la shar na yang //
analyzed: 104 / g-yul du dgra ni nges par rab tu nyams par 'gyur te sgra gcan stong pa dag la shar na yang //
translated: In battle, the enemy is sure to be defeated, if RÄhu is in the east, but the moon is void.

original: rlung dang zla ba dag la 'pham dang g-yul du rma yang zla skyes me la shar ba dag la'o //ğŸ”½chu la pa sangs la ni don rnyed sa la mjug rings shar ba dag la dgra yang dbang du 'gyur //
analyzed: rlung dang zla ba dag la 'pham dang g-yul du rma yang zla skyes me la shar ba dag la'o // chu la pa sangs la ni don rnyed sa la mjug rings shar ba dag la dgra yang dbang du 'gyur //
translated: If the moon is in the west, and Mars in the east, there is defeat and wounds in battle.ğŸ”½If Mercury is in the south, and Ketu in the north, the enemy is overcome.

original: de bzhin bgrod pa bag ma dag la g-yon gyi lam la gza' rnams kyis ni dge ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur ;
analyzed: de bzhin bgrod pa bag ma dag la g-yon gyi lam la gza' rnams kyis ni dge ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur ;
translated: If the planets are in the left path in the horoscopes of women, the result is good.

original: 105 / pho nyas brjod pa'i dbyangs rnams gang dag nges par bcu yis bsgyur te khyim gyi 'khor lo dag gis bsre //
analyzed: 105 / pho nyas brjod pa'i dbyangs rnams gang dag nges par bcu yis bsgyur te khyim gyi 'khor lo dag gis bsre //
translated: The tones described by the messenger are definitely multiplied by ten and mixed with the zodiac.

original: slar yang de dag 'byung bas bsnun te nye ba'i skye bo dang ldan bdun gyi cha yi lhag ma ni //
analyzed: slar yang de dag 'byung bas bsnun te nye ba'i skye bo dang ldan bdun gyi cha yi lhag ma ni //
translated: Again, they are struck by the ascendant, and the remainder of the seventh part is endowed with relatives.

original: zla me mda' dang ri bo mi mnyam gnas su gyur na mi rnams la ni rnyed pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: zla me mda' dang ri bo mi mnyam gnas su gyur na mi rnams la ni rnyed pa yod ma yin //
translated: If the moon, Mars, Mercury, and Venus are in uneven signs, there is no gain for men.

original: mig dang rig byed ro ste shin tu mnyam pa'i gnas su gyur na bya ba dag kyang 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig dang rig byed ro ste shin tu mnyam pa'i gnas su gyur na bya ba dag kyang 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: When the eye, the Veda, and the tongue are in a state of perfect equality, then the actions are accomplished.

original: 106 / lo dang zla ba phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo 'dus ni dus sbyor dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: 106 / lo dang zla ba phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo 'dus ni dus sbyor dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ste //
translated: The year, the month, the half-fortnight, the day, and the night, when they are combined, are the muhÅ«rta, which enters the center.

original: dus sbyor gcig ni lnga yi dbye bas gza' tshogs dang ldan dbyangs dang bcas pa'i de nyid tha dad do //
analyzed: dus sbyor gcig ni lnga yi dbye bas gza' tshogs dang ldan dbyangs dang bcas pa'i de nyid tha dad do //
translated: One muhÅ«rta is divided into five parts, which are the groups of planets, along with the vowels, the different realities.

original: de nyid gcig ni dbugs rnams drug cu mngon lhag yon tan brgya yi dus kyi chu tshod dag la gnas //
analyzed: de nyid gcig ni dbugs rnams drug cu mngon lhag yon tan brgya yi dus kyi chu tshod dag la gnas //
translated: One of those realities is the sixty breaths, which is the time of the hundred qualities.

original: chu tshod cha shas chu srang drug cu de yi cha shas shes pa dbugs drug rnams so mi yi dbang /
analyzed: chu tshod cha shas chu srang drug cu de yi cha shas shes pa dbugs drug rnams so mi yi dbang /
translated: The sixty breaths are the sixty parts of the muhÅ«rta, which are the parts of the sixty breaths, O Lord of Men.

original: 107 / dbugs 'byung 'jug pa'i dbus su mi dge dge ba'i 'bras bu dag kyang rnal 'byor ldan pas shes par byed //
analyzed: 107 / dbugs 'byung 'jug pa'i dbus su mi dge dge ba'i 'bras bu dag kyang rnal 'byor ldan pas shes par byed //
translated: The yogi should know the results of the unwholesome and wholesome in the middle of the exhalation and inhalation of the breath.

original: lha shes rnams kyis nyin zhag 'das pa'i dbang gis nyi ma zla ba bsgrubs nas dus kyi chu tshod do //
analyzed: lha shes rnams kyis nyin zhag 'das pa'i dbang gis nyi ma zla ba bsgrubs nas dus kyi chu tshod do //
translated: The gods, knowing the deities, having accomplished the sun and moon by the passing of the day and night, are the time muhÅ«rtas.

original: da ltar byung ba shes pa min par dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu 'jig rten 'dir ni gang brjod pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba shes pa min par dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu 'jig rten 'dir ni gang brjod pa //
translated: The results of good and bad actions, which are said to be in this world, are not known to exist in the present.ğŸ”½The blind, holding on to the blind, enter the thick forest filled with lions and elephants.

original: de ni long ba yis kyang long ba bzung nas glang chen seng ges gtams pa'i thib por rab tu 'jug 108 / phra mo'i rnal 'byor mi shes pa la gza' yi stobs dang bcas pa'i dus sbyor sbyor ba sbyin pa ni //
analyzed: de ni long ba yis kyang long ba bzung nas glang chen seng ges gtams pa'i thib por rab tu 'jug 108 / phra mo'i rnal 'byor mi shes pa la gza' yi stobs dang bcas pa'i dus sbyor sbyor ba sbyin pa ni //
translated: The conjunctions, along with the strength of the planets, are given to those who do not know the subtle yoga.

original: skye dang bdun par gnas pa'i khyim @13a * //
analyzed: skye dang bdun par gnas pa'i khyim @13a * //
translated: In the house of the seventh birth,

original: la dus me nyi ma sa skyes nyin mor byed pa'i bu rnams kyis //
analyzed: la dus me nyi ma sa skyes nyin mor byed pa'i bu rnams kyis //
translated: the sons of the sun, born from the earth, the sun, and the moon,

original: de la 'chi dang nad dang rma dang nges par mtha' dag nor ni rnam par nyams pa dag kyang byed //
analyzed: de la 'chi dang nad dang rma dang nges par mtha' dag nor ni rnam par nyams pa dag kyang byed //
translated: cause death, sickness, wounds, and complete loss of wealth.

original: de phyir spang bar bya ste nges par bdag gi tshig gis dus sbyor gzhan ni rab tu sbyin par bya /
analyzed: de phyir spang bar bya ste nges par bdag gi tshig gis dus sbyor gzhan ni rab tu sbyin par bya /
translated: Therefore, they should be abandoned, and by my words, another conjunction should be given.

original: 109 / skyes dang bdun par gnas pa'i khyim la sgra gcan zla ba zla skyes bla ma pa sangs dang bcas pas //
analyzed: 109 / skyes dang bdun par gnas pa'i khyim la sgra gcan zla ba zla skyes bla ma pa sangs dang bcas pas //
translated: In the house of the seventh birth, Rahu, the moon, and the moon-born, along with the elders,

original: dgra nyams rang nyid rgyas shing g-yul du rnam par rgyal te dga' ma dang bcas nor dag thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: dgra nyams rang nyid rgyas shing g-yul du rnam par rgyal te dga' ma dang bcas nor dag thob par 'gyur //
translated: The enemy is weakened, one prospers, and one is victorious in battle, and one obtains wealth together with a beloved.

original: yang dag dus sbyor thams cad kyis te slar yang gal te rang lus g-yon gyi rtsa las gyur pa na //
analyzed: yang dag dus sbyor thams cad kyis te slar yang gal te rang lus g-yon gyi rtsa las gyur pa na //
translated: Again, if the body is formed from the left channel in all the right trines,

original: des par don ni thams cad 'grub ste mtha' dag sa yi steng du dag pa'i gza' dang tshes la'o /
analyzed: des par don ni thams cad 'grub ste mtha' dag sa yi steng du dag pa'i gza' dang tshes la'o /
translated: one will certainly accomplish all aims, on all the earth, in the pure lunar mansions and dates.

original: 110 / rgyu skar rnams ni dgu dang dgu dang dgu yis cha gsum byas te skyes pa'i rgyu skar dang po las //
analyzed: 110 / rgyu skar rnams ni dgu dang dgu dang dgu yis cha gsum byas te skyes pa'i rgyu skar dang po las //
translated: The lunar mansions are divided into three groups of nine, beginning with the lunar mansion in which one was born.

original: gdug pa rnams ni zla ba dag dang lhan cig mi mnyam gnas gyur nad pa rnams ni 'chi ba nyid //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams ni zla ba dag dang lhan cig mi mnyam gnas gyur nad pa rnams ni 'chi ba nyid //
translated: The malefics are in conjunction with the moon, and the sick are in an uneven state, and they die.

original: tha skar la sogs rnams kyis rtsa gsum sbrul yang spras par gyur pa nam gru nyid kyi bar du ste //
analyzed: tha skar la sogs rnams kyis rtsa gsum sbrul yang spras par gyur pa nam gru nyid kyi bar du ste //
translated: The three channels are adorned with the nine lunar mansions beginning with AÅ›vinÄ« up to RevatÄ«.

original: sdig zla skyes pa'i rgyu skar gal te rtsa gcig dag la gyur na mi rnams dag ni rnam par nyams /
analyzed: sdig zla skyes pa'i rgyu skar gal te rtsa gcig dag la gyur na mi rnams dag ni rnam par nyams /
translated: If the lunar mansion of oneâ€™s birth is in one channel, people are ruined.

translated: The six, the eight, the ten, the twelve, the fourteen, the sixteen, the eighteen, the twenty, the twenty-two, the twenty-four, the twenty-six, the twenty-eight, the thirtieth, the thirty-second, the thirty-fourth, the thirty-sixth, the thirty-eighth, the fortieth, the forty-second, the forty-fourth, the forty-sixth, the forty-eighth, the fiftieth, the fifty-second, the fifty-fourth, the fifty-sixth, the fifty-eighth, the sixtieth, the sixty-second, the sixty-fourth, the sixty-sixth, the sixty-eighth, the seventieth, the seventy-second, the seventy-fourth, the seventy-sixth, the seventy-eighth, the eightieth, the eighty-second, the eighty-fourth, the eighty-sixth, the eighty-eighth, the ninetieth, the ninety-second, the ninety-fourth, the ninety-sixth, the ninety-eighth, and the hundredth are the good years.ğŸ”½The sun, moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, RÄhu, and Ketu, respectively, govern the above years.ğŸ”½The eight houses are also in the same order in the inner [astrological] situation.ğŸ”½

original: de bzhin srid pa la sogs thams cad yan lag bcu gnyis bar du rim pa dag gis yongs su 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin srid pa la sogs thams cad yan lag bcu gnyis bar du rim pa dag gis yongs su 'gyur //
translated: Likewise, all things, such as existence, are transformed in stages into the twelve members.

original: de nas me dang chu gter  mnga' ste chu srin bgrod pa'i dbang gis res 'ga' yan lag drug pa'o /
analyzed: de nas me dang chu gter  mnga' ste chu srin bgrod pa'i dbang gis res 'ga' yan lag drug pa'o /
translated: Then, by the power of the movement of the crocodile, which is the lord of the fire and water treasures, sometimes there are six members.

original: 115 / tshes zhes bya ba'i gza' yis phyogs te nyi ma rgyu ba'i dbang gis res 'ga' yan lag bcu drug gis //
analyzed: 115 / tshes zhes bya ba'i gza' yis phyogs te nyi ma rgyu ba'i dbang gis res 'ga' yan lag bcu drug gis //
translated: By the power of the movement of the sun, which is the planet called â€œthe moon,â€ sometimes there are sixteen members.

original: 'du byed mchu yi mtshams dag tu ste bum par nyi ma son pa de la 'du byed kho na'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mchu yi mtshams dag tu ste bum par nyi ma son pa de la 'du byed kho na'o //
translated: In the interval of the beak of formation, when the sun enters the jar, there is formation alone.

original: de nas gnyis pa la ni rnam par shes par 'gyur te nyin zhag gsum pa la ni ming dang gzugs //
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa la ni rnam par shes par 'gyur te nyin zhag gsum pa la ni ming dang gzugs //
translated: Then, in the second, there is consciousness; in the third day, name and form.

original: de ltar zla ba gnyis la yan lag tu 'gyur nyi ma'i dbang gis spro dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas so /
analyzed: de ltar zla ba gnyis la yan lag tu 'gyur nyi ma'i dbang gis spro dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas so /
translated: Thus, in two months, there are members by the power of the sun, through the process of expansion and contraction.

original: 116 / de la ma rig la sogs yan lag mi mnyam pa yang bya ba kun la dge bar 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: 116 / de la ma rig la sogs yan lag mi mnyam pa yang bya ba kun la dge bar 'gyur ba ste //
translated: There, the members such as ignorance are not equal, but all actions are virtuous.

original: gang zhig 'du byed la sogs mnyam pa dag kyang rtag tu dbang bgrod bag ma dag la dge ba min //
analyzed: gang zhig 'du byed la sogs mnyam pa dag kyang rtag tu dbang bgrod bag ma dag la dge ba min //
translated: If the moon is in the same sign as the ascendant, it will always be malefic to the bride.

original: de bzhin phyogs kyi dbye ba dag la ri bong can gyis bgrod pa'i dbang gis yan lag bcu gnyis gang //
analyzed: de bzhin phyogs kyi dbye ba dag la ri bong can gyis bgrod pa'i dbang gis yan lag bcu gnyis gang //
translated: Similarly, if the moon is in the same sign as the ascendant of the twelve houses, it will be malefic.

original: dkar dang nag po'i phyogs la dang po'i tshes grangs dbang gis  spyo dang bsdu ba'i sbyor ba dag gis so /
analyzed: dkar dang nag po'i phyogs la dang po'i tshes grangs dbang gis  spyo dang bsdu ba'i sbyor ba dag gis so /
translated: The moon in the white or black part of the sky, by the power of the first lunar day, will be malefic by the method of expansion and contraction.

original: 117 / nyi ma mig dmar mjug rings spen pa g-yas sam rgyab tu yang dag gnas pas dgra ni 'chi bar byed //
analyzed: 117 / nyi ma mig dmar mjug rings spen pa g-yas sam rgyab tu yang dag gnas pas dgra ni 'chi bar byed //
translated: The sun, Mars, Saturn and RÄhu, if they are to the right or behind, will kill the enemy.

original: g-yon dang mdun du zhi ba'i rang bzhin gza' tshogs mtha' dag g-yul gyi sar ni de bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang mdun du zhi ba'i rang bzhin gza' tshogs mtha' dag g-yul gyi sar ni de bzhin kho na'o //
translated: All the planets, which are of a peaceful nature, to the left and in front, are the same on the battlefield.

original: rnal 'byor ma dang bi shti drag po rlung dang bcas pa g-yas dang rgyab tu bde ba sbyin pa ste //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang bi shti drag po rlung dang bcas pa g-yas dang rgyab tu bde ba sbyin pa ste //
translated: YoginÄ«, Viá¹£á¹‡u and RÄhu, together with the wind, to the right and behind, give happiness.

original: g-yon dang mdun du 'chi ba'i rang bzhin mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pas gnyis ka'i dpung ni 'joms par 'gyur /
analyzed: g-yon dang mdun du 'chi ba'i rang bzhin mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pas gnyis ka'i dpung ni 'joms par 'gyur /
translated: To the left and in front, they are of a deadly nature, and by being even or uneven, they destroy both armies.

original: 118 / tshangs ma drag mo gzhon nu ma dang mkha' 'gro'i bdag gis @14a * //ğŸ”½'gro ma phag mo rdo rje lag ma dang // ts'a mu nd'a nyid dpal mo dag ni nor gyi tshes la 'gyur te dang po'i tshes dang dgu pa la //
analyzed: 118 / tshangs ma drag mo gzhon nu ma dang mkha' 'gro'i bdag gis @14a * // 'gro ma phag mo rdo rje lag ma dang // ts'a mu nd'a nyid dpal mo dag ni nor gyi tshes la 'gyur te dang po'i tshes dang dgu pa la //
translated: Brahma, Rudra, Kumari, and Dakini are the mistresses of the directions.ğŸ”½Vajravarahi, Vajrapadmini, and Chamunda are the glorious goddesses of the lunar days.

original: brgya byin du ste gnod sbyin me zur lha min gshin rje chu lha rlung dang dbang ldan sa la'o //
analyzed: brgya byin du ste gnod sbyin me zur lha min gshin rje chu lha rlung dang dbang ldan sa la'o //
translated: Indra is on the first and ninth days, the yaksha on the second, the asura on the third, Yama on the fourth, Varuna on the fifth, Vayu on the sixth, Kubera on the seventh, and Brahma on the eighth.

original: 'di ni 'char ba dag tu byed de slar yang tshes rnams la ni brgyad gnyis dbye bas tha dad do /
analyzed: 'di ni 'char ba dag tu byed de slar yang tshes rnams la ni brgyad gnyis dbye bas tha dad do /
translated: This is the rising order. Again, the lunar days are divided into two groups of eight.

original: 119 / bi shti rnams ni dkar po'i phyogs la brgya byin gshin rje chu dang gnod sbyin du yang 'dir 'char 'gyur //
analyzed: 119 / bi shti rnams ni dkar po'i phyogs la brgya byin gshin rje chu dang gnod sbyin du yang 'dir 'char 'gyur //
translated: The Vishvadevas rise in the bright fortnight on the days of Indra, Yama, Varuna, and Kubera.

original: slar yang nag po'i phyogs la rtse mo can dang lha min rlung dang dbang ldan zur du rim pas so //
analyzed: slar yang nag po'i phyogs la rtse mo can dang lha min rlung dang dbang ldan zur du rim pas so //
translated: Again, in the dark fortnight, they rise on the days of Ishana, Asura, Vayu, and Kubera, respectively.

original: drag po shar nas gzhan phyed du 'gro nyin zhag dbang gis byang du yang ste byang gi nyi ma la'o //
analyzed: drag po shar nas gzhan phyed du 'gro nyin zhag dbang gis byang du yang ste byang gi nyi ma la'o //
translated: Rudra moves from the east to the other half, by the power of the day, also to the north, in the northern solstice.

original: chu nas me ldan dag tu de ni nges par 'gro ste lho ru lho yi nyi ma dag la'o //
analyzed: chu nas me ldan dag tu de ni nges par 'gro ste lho ru lho yi nyi ma dag la'o //
translated: It certainly moves from water to fire, in the south, in the southern course of the sun.

original: 120 / shar nas thun phyed dag la rlung du rab tu 'jug ste de bzhin du ni lho ru 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: 120 / shar nas thun phyed dag la rlung du rab tu 'jug ste de bzhin du ni lho ru 'gro bar byed //
translated: From the east, it enters the wind in half a watch; in the same way, it goes to the south.

original: dbang ldan chu dang me dang gnod sbyin lha min grong khyer du 'gro rlung du nyi ma nub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang ldan chu dang me dang gnod sbyin lha min grong khyer du 'gro rlung du nyi ma nub par 'gyur //
translated: In the northeast, it goes to water, fire, and the city of the Yaksas and Asuras; in the west, the sun sets.

original: dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan dor nas rlung dag las kyang rnam par rgyal 'gyur 'gran pa'i 'thab mo dang // 'khrug pa dag la rtsa ba'i sgra gcan gyis ni dgra yi stobs 'joms de dang mtshungs pa gzhan yod min /
analyzed: dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan dor nas rlung dag las kyang rnam par rgyal 'gyur 'gran pa'i 'thab mo dang // 'khrug pa dag la rtsa ba'i sgra gcan gyis ni dgra yi stobs 'joms de dang mtshungs pa gzhan yod min /
translated: Having abandoned the glorious RÄhu, the root, it triumphs over the winds; in a battle of rivalry, in a quarrel, the root RÄhu destroys the power of the enemy; there is no other like it.

original: 121 / dbyangs dman 'thab mo pa ni mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul la lhag pa dag gis 'joms par byed pa ste //
analyzed: 121 / dbyangs dman 'thab mo pa ni mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul la lhag pa dag gis 'joms par byed pa ste //
translated: The inferior-sounding fighter is destroyed in battle, whether equal or unequal, by the superior.

original: dbugs la gnyis kyi ming gang snying la rab tu 'jug na de ni 'khrug pa dag las rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbugs la gnyis kyi ming gang snying la rab tu 'jug na de ni 'khrug pa dag las rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: When the name of the two breaths enters the heart, it triumphs over quarrels.

original: pho nyas brjod pa dang po'i ming de rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te phyis kyi ming ni 'pham par 'gyur //
analyzed: pho nyas brjod pa dang po'i ming de rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te phyis kyi ming ni 'pham par 'gyur //
translated: The name of the first messenger will be victorious, the name of the second will be defeated.

original: 'du ba kha dog dbyangs la sogs pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras med ston pa nyid /
analyzed: 'du ba kha dog dbyangs la sogs pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras med ston pa nyid /
translated: The results of the conjunctions of the planets, the colors, the vowels, and so on, are shown to be fruitless.

original: 122 / dus ni 'thab mo'i sa la mi bdag rnams kyi g-yas dang gal te g-yas min dag la mun can gyur //
analyzed: 122 / dus ni 'thab mo'i sa la mi bdag rnams kyi g-yas dang gal te g-yas min dag la mun can gyur //
translated: Time is the battleground. The kings are on the right and the left. If it is dark,

original: g-yul du lha yi mgon po dag ni 'phrog byed drag po dang bcas mi rnams kyis kyang 'joms par 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yul du lha yi mgon po dag ni 'phrog byed drag po dang bcas mi rnams kyis kyang 'joms par 'gyur //
translated: the gods and the demons are defeated in battle.

original: de phyir dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan 'khyog po drag po lha min rnams las srid gsum rnam rgyal ba //
analyzed: de phyir dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan 'khyog po drag po lha min rnams las srid gsum rnam rgyal ba //
translated: Therefore, the glorious RÄhu, the crooked one, is victorious over the three worlds, over the demons.

original: g-yul gyi dus su sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas shes par bya ste gzhan du dgra ni nyams pa med /
analyzed: g-yul gyi dus su sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas shes par bya ste gzhan du dgra ni nyams pa med /
translated: He should be known to be on the surface of the earth at the time of battle. Otherwise, the enemy is not defeated.

original: 123 / sa la @14b rgyu skar byas nas thub pa dus kyis bsgyur ba dbang po gnod sbyin chu dang gshin rjer ni //
analyzed: 123 / sa la @14b rgyu skar byas nas thub pa dus kyis bsgyur ba dbang po gnod sbyin chu dang gshin rjer ni //
translated: The moon is on the earth. The sages are transformed by time. Indra, the yaká¹£as, the water, and Yama are

original: de yi 'khor lo 'khor bar byed de nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis mtha' dag rnams ni rig par bya //
analyzed: de yi 'khor lo 'khor bar byed de nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis mtha' dag rnams ni rig par bya //
translated: The wheel of that [planet] causes revolution, and all [the houses] should be known by the power of the daily motion.

original: rgyu skar gang la dus dang mun can du yang rab gyur lta ba lhung na gnyis po dag la yang /ğŸ”½g-yul du sgra yi sde rnams dag ni 'phral la nges par lhung ste lto yi dbus su rgyal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu skar gang la dus dang mun can du yang rab gyur lta ba lhung na gnyis po dag la yang / g-yul du sgra yi sde rnams dag ni 'phral la nges par lhung ste lto yi dbus su rgyal bar 'gyur /
translated: If the view falls on any naká¹£atra that is also a time or a RÄhu,ğŸ”½the troops of the sound [class] will immediately fall in battle, and [the army] will be victorious in the middle of the belly.

original: 124 / sgra gcan dus la gnas pa rnams ni 'chi dang bcas par 'gyur zhing dpung rnams mnyam du ltung ba ni //
analyzed: 124 / sgra gcan dus la gnas pa rnams ni 'chi dang bcas par 'gyur zhing dpung rnams mnyam du ltung ba ni //
translated: Those abiding in the time of RÄhu will be killed, and the troops will fall together.

original: lta ba'i cha la nges song rnams te brang 'gro 'gro ba'i dbang gis der ni sde rnams bcom par gyur //
analyzed: lta ba'i cha la nges song rnams te brang 'gro 'gro ba'i dbang gis der ni sde rnams bcom par gyur //
translated: Those who have definitely gone to the part of the view, by the power of going to the chest, the troops will be destroyed there.

original: lta ba'i cha ni spangs pa rnams dag rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te lto bar zhugs la gnyis po yang //
analyzed: lta ba'i cha ni spangs pa rnams dag rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te lto bar zhugs la gnyis po yang //
translated: Those who have abandoned the part of the view will be victorious. Both [the armies] will enter the belly.

original: de ltar dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan bla ma'i gsung la gnas pa dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya /
analyzed: de ltar dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan bla ma'i gsung la gnas pa dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya /
translated: Thus, one should know the glorious root RÄhu abiding in the speech of the guru in the KÄlacakra.

original: 125 / rnal 'byor ma dang bi shti drag po gza' tshogs dang bcas dbyangs ni 'char ba dag dang bcas gyur pa //
analyzed: 125 / rnal 'byor ma dang bi shti drag po gza' tshogs dang bcas dbyangs ni 'char ba dag dang bcas gyur pa //
translated: The yoginis, the Vishkambha, the fierce planets with their hosts, and the rising tones,

original: de dag thams cad btang nas rgyal rigs rnams kyis srid gsum rnam rgyal gcig pu gzung bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: de dag thams cad btang nas rgyal rigs rnams kyis srid gsum rnam rgyal gcig pu gzung bar bya ba ste //
translated: all of these are abandoned, and the victorious ones of the three worlds are to be taken up alone by the royal class.

original: gang gis zla ba nyi ma za zhing skabs gsum pa dag 'jigs byed drag po'i gzugs can mig sman mdog /
analyzed: gang gis zla ba nyi ma za zhing skabs gsum pa dag 'jigs byed drag po'i gzugs can mig sman mdog /
translated: He who devours the moon and sun, the one who is terrible in form, the third one, the coppery-eyed,

analyzed: sa la gang zhig nyin dang mtshan mor shar dang nub dang lho dang byang du yang ni 'khor ba'o /
translated: who moves in the east, west, south, and north during the day and night on the earth.

original: 126 / g-yul du 'pham pa'i dgra bo dag ni gal te 'phral la rdzong gi nang du zhugs par gyur pa na //
analyzed: 126 / g-yul du 'pham pa'i dgra bo dag ni gal te 'phral la rdzong gi nang du zhugs par gyur pa na //
translated: If the defeated enemies enter the fort immediately in the battle,

analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'khrul 'khor bya ste rgyun chad med par rdo dang me mda' rab tu 'bab pa dang / ral gri la sogs gcod pa'i 'khrul 'khor dag dang sa gzhi'i gnas la gur dang cog ni dbye ba yis //
translated: the outer machine should be set in motion, with stones and arrows falling continuously, and with the machine of cutting with swords and so on, and with the ground area divided into compartments with tents and platforms.

analyzed: de yi rdzong ni phye mar byas te nyin zhag nyung zad dag gis gdug pa de ni bsgrub par bya /
translated: The fortress of that one is to be reduced to dust in a few days and nights.

original: 127 / ka ba bzhi ni brgyad gnyis khru ldan mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas nas gnas brgyad du ni phug gyur pa //
analyzed: 127 / ka ba bzhi ni brgyad gnyis khru ldan mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas nas gnas brgyad du ni phug gyur pa //
translated: The four pillars are eight cubits, two cubits, and equal, and the eight places are pierced from the uneven.

original: tha dad rnams ni sdong bu chu gter dus dang dus rnams kyis te rgyab tu yang ni gcig gis so //
analyzed: tha dad rnams ni sdong bu chu gter dus dang dus rnams kyis te rgyab tu yang ni gcig gis so //
translated: The different ones are the trunk, the ocean, the time, and the times, and also one behind.

original: rtsa bar 'khrul 'khor tshad ni lag pa bcu ru 'gyur te steng gi cha dag la ni de yi phyed //ğŸ”½sgyogs mda' khru gnyis dag gis dman par 'gyur te ao log bcu @15a * //

translated: The measure of the machine at the root is ten cubits, and the upper part is half of that.

original: yi steng gi cha ni lhag pa'o /
analyzed: yi steng gi cha ni lhag pa'o /

analyzed: 128 / zlum por phyed bcas khru gnyis dag ste sor mo thub pa ma nur nges pa'i bug pa gcig tu ni //

analyzed: khru gang dor nas sgyogs mda' rab tu gzhug ste ao log bcu yi rgyab kyi cha la gzer gyis gdab //
translated: Having lowered one cubit, the catapult is inserted, and the bolt is driven into the back part of ten oá¹ƒs.

analyzed: mgo bor aa long dag la theg pa lnga bcu gdags par bya ste steng gi tshad ni zlum po phyed //
translated: On the head, on the two ear-rings, one should place the fifty vehicles, the measure of the upper being half a circle.

original: sgyogs mda'i mthar ni mdzub mo dang bcas rab tu 'jug ste gnya' non zlum po dag ni mtho gang ngo /
analyzed: sgyogs mda'i mthar ni mdzub mo dang bcas rab tu 'jug ste gnya' non zlum po dag ni mtho gang ngo /

analyzed: 129 / sgyogs mda'i mdzub mo la ni 'ur mthil thag par bcas pa dag las nges par khru gsum dag tu 'gyur /

analyzed: mtha' dag phye mar byas nas sa yi 'og tu 'gro ste rdo rje 'bab pa ji lta ba nyid bzhin /

original: 132 / ka ba  dbung pa drug drug dag gis gnyi ga'i nang ni mnyam pa khru ni zung gi bar dag la //
analyzed: 132 / ka ba  dbung pa drug drug dag gis gnyi ga'i nang ni mnyam pa khru ni zung gi bar dag la //
translated: The two sides are equal, each being the distance between two cubits, and each having six pillars and six beams.

original: snying po re re nyi ma'i khru ru 'gyur te gnyi ga nang ni mnyam pa lhag chad med pa nyid //
analyzed: snying po re re nyi ma'i khru ru 'gyur te gnyi ga nang ni mnyam pa lhag chad med pa nyid //
translated: Each of the two sides is a cubit of the sun, and the two sides are equal, without excess or deficiency.

original: so so'i re mig kun la spang leb dag dang pags pa spra tshil gos rnams kyis kyang g-yogs pa ste //
analyzed: so so'i re mig kun la spang leb dag dang pags pa spra tshil gos rnams kyis kyang g-yogs pa ste //
translated: Each square is covered with a wooden board, skin, lacquer, and cloth.

original: snying po dus dang brgyad dang skyon @15b dang sum 'gyur nyin byed kyis kyang 'khrul 'khor gcig ni rab tu bya /
analyzed: snying po dus dang brgyad dang skyon @15b dang sum 'gyur nyin byed kyis kyang 'khrul 'khor gcig ni rab tu bya /
translated: One machine is made with the eight times of the essence and the faults of the sun, and with the three times.

original: 133 / gnyis gnyis snying po'i bar du 'khrul pa dag kyang dpung pa rnams kyis rgya yis btab pa'am kun nas so //
analyzed: 133 / gnyis gnyis snying po'i bar du 'khrul pa dag kyang dpung pa rnams kyis rgya yis btab pa'am kun nas so //
translated: The two sides are marked off by the two shoulders, or all around.

original: rgyab tu skye ba 'dzin pa drug ste mdun nas dpung pa gnyis ka mnyam pa 'khrul 'khor 'dren pa'am //
analyzed: rgyab tu skye ba 'dzin pa drug ste mdun nas dpung pa gnyis ka mnyam pa 'khrul 'khor 'dren pa'am //
translated: The six rear-born ones are held, and the two shoulders in front are equal, drawing the machine.

original: ka ba'i khung bur rab tu btsugs pa'i g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar rnams kyis ni rlung gis bskyod pa ste //
analyzed: ka ba'i khung bur rab tu btsugs pa'i g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar rnams kyis ni rlung gis bskyod pa ste //
translated: The moving banners of the wind are placed in the holes of the pillars, and are moved by the wind.

original: de la zhon pa rang gi sde ni chu yi rdzong dag nyams pa'i don du chu yi gter la 'gro /
analyzed: de la zhon pa rang gi sde ni chu yi rdzong dag nyams pa'i don du chu yi gter la 'gro /
translated: The army of the king who is mounted on it goes to the water treasure in order to destroy the water fortresses of the enemy.

original: 134 / chu gter zur ldan stegs bu gcig la g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar dang rgyal mtshan bcas pa ka bar gdags //
analyzed: 134 / chu gter zur ldan stegs bu gcig la g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar dang rgyal mtshan bcas pa ka bar gdags //
translated: The water treasure is placed on a single ramp with a flag and banner of moving wind fastened to a post.

original: rgyab kyi phyogs nas mi rnams dag gis drangs shing sa las thag pa dag gis steng du 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: rgyab kyi phyogs nas mi rnams dag gis drangs shing sa las thag pa dag gis steng du 'gro ba ni //
translated: It is drawn from behind by men and is pulled up by ropes from the ground.

original: rlung gis rab tu bskyod par gyur pa nges par brag gi rdzong gi steng du mkha' la 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: rlung gis rab tu bskyod par gyur pa nges par brag gi rdzong gi steng du mkha' la 'gro ba ste //
translated: It is definitely carried through the air above the rocky fortresses, being shaken by the wind.

original: de nas me yi 'bru mar 'phangs pas dgra yi dpung dang rdzong ni thams cad kun nas sreg par byed /
analyzed: de nas me yi 'bru mar 'phangs pas dgra yi dpung dang rdzong ni thams cad kun nas sreg par byed /
translated: Then, by throwing fire-oil, the entire army and fortresses of the enemy are burned.

original: 135 /'khor lo'i rtsa bar gnam gdan rtse gcig pa ni gzhug cing steng du yang ni 'khor lo dag la ni //
analyzed: 135 /'khor lo'i rtsa bar gnam gdan rtse gcig pa ni gzhug cing steng du yang ni 'khor lo dag la ni //
translated: The single-pointed sky-seat is placed at the base of the wheel and also above on the wheels.

original: sor mo gnyis gnyis bar du rtsibs su 'gyur te zlum po'i mtha' ma ma lus par ni dgod par bya //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis gnyis bar du rtsibs su 'gyur te zlum po'i mtha' ma ma lus par ni dgod par bya //
translated: Between two fingers there is a spoke, and the entire circumference is placed.

original: 'khor lo khru ni phyed dang gsum par 'gyur zhing gnam gdan steng du gzhan yang der ni srog shing ste //
analyzed: 'khor lo khru ni phyed dang gsum par 'gyur zhing gnam gdan steng du gzhan yang der ni srog shing ste //
translated: The wheel is one cubit and a half in diameter, and above the celestial globe is the axle.

original: srog shing steng du ral gri rnon po myur bar 'khor te 'khrul 'khor gyi ni rtsa ba 'khor bas so /
analyzed: srog shing steng du ral gri rnon po myur bar 'khor te 'khrul 'khor gyi ni rtsa ba 'khor bas so /
translated: Above the axle is a sharp sword, which revolves rapidly, because the base of the machine revolves.

original: 136 / thag pa yis ni rlung gi 'khrul 'khor nam mkha' dag la 'gro ste rang gi phyogs nas rim pas so //
analyzed: 136 / thag pa yis ni rlung gi 'khrul 'khor nam mkha' dag la 'gro ste rang gi phyogs nas rim pas so //
translated: The machine moves through the air by means of a rope, gradually from oneâ€™s own place.

original: rdzong gi steng dang dgra yi khyim du so sor 'gro bar nges pa nyid du thag pa drangs byas nas //
analyzed: rdzong gi steng dang dgra yi khyim du so sor 'gro bar nges pa nyid du thag pa drangs byas nas //
translated: Having drawn the rope, one should go to the top of the fortress and to the house of the enemy, with certainty.

original: sa la tshad kyang de yis brjod par 'gyur te dgra rnams kyi ni rdzong gi rtse mo 'byed pa yis //
analyzed: sa la tshad kyang de yis brjod par 'gyur te dgra rnams kyi ni rdzong gi rtse mo 'byed pa yis //
translated: The measure of the earth is also indicated by that, by the peak of the fortress of the enemy.

original: rtse la bkod de dgra yi khang pa'i gzhi dang 'dun sa dag la me ni rab tu sbyin par bya /
analyzed: rtse la bkod de dgra yi khang pa'i gzhi dang 'dun sa dag la me ni rab tu sbyin par bya /
translated: Having placed it on the peak, one should set fire to the house and the assembly hall of the enemy.

original: 137 /'khor lo rnams kyi steng gi cha la lcags dang shing rnams dag gis khang pa chen po bkod pa ni //
analyzed: 137 /'khor lo rnams kyi steng gi cha la lcags dang shing rnams dag gis khang pa chen po bkod pa ni //
translated: On the upper part of the wheels, a great house is constructed with iron and wood.

original: spang leb dang ni ma he'i pags pa rnams kyis kun nas g-yogs par gyur pa zlum po'i rnam pa ste //ğŸ”½mi rnams dag gis bskyod par gyur pa mnyam pa'i  sa @16a * //
analyzed: spang leb dang ni ma he'i pags pa rnams kyis kun nas g-yogs par gyur pa zlum po'i rnam pa ste // mi rnams dag gis bskyod par gyur pa mnyam pa'i  sa @16a * //
translated: The moat is covered with planks and buffalo hides, and is round in shape.

original: la 'obs ni ji srid nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: la 'obs ni ji srid nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: The moat is as wide as the level ground that people can walk on.

original: 'obs de bkang nas mkhar gyi rtsig pa dang ni lam  srang dag tu 'phral la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'obs de bkang nas mkhar gyi rtsig pa dang ni lam  srang dag tu 'phral la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: When the moat is full, the water overflows onto the walls and streets.

original: 138 / stegs bur phur pa gnyis la nges par rgyud dang bcas pa'i gzhu ni g-yo ba med par btags byas nas //
analyzed: 138 / stegs bur phur pa gnyis la nges par rgyud dang bcas pa'i gzhu ni g-yo ba med par btags byas nas //
translated: Two stakes are firmly planted in the ground on the bridge, and a bowstring is tied to them without moving.

original: rgyab tu lcags kyi phur pa gnyis la legs bkod 'khrul shing la ni sor mo lta bu phyed 'khyog rnams //
analyzed: rgyab tu lcags kyi phur pa gnyis la legs bkod 'khrul shing la ni sor mo lta bu phyed 'khyog rnams //
translated: Two iron stakes are well placed in the back, with half-bent fingers on the crossbar.

original: sor mo'i rtse mo dag la gzhu rgyud kyis ni mang zhing mnyam pa'i mda' 'am lcags mda' rnon po rnams //
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mo dag la gzhu rgyud kyis ni mang zhing mnyam pa'i mda' 'am lcags mda' rnon po rnams //
translated: Many even-sized sharp arrows or iron arrows are placed on the tips of the fingers with the bowstring.

original: g-yul gyi dus su 'phangs pas go cha dang bcas glang chen lus po phug nas rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: g-yul gyi dus su 'phangs pas go cha dang bcas glang chen lus po phug nas rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: When shot in battle, they pierce the armor and elephant bodies and go through.

original: 139 / ka ba gnyis ni sa yi nang du brtan par btsugs pa thag pa rnams kyis dkris par gyur pa ste //
analyzed: 139 / ka ba gnyis ni sa yi nang du brtan par btsugs pa thag pa rnams kyis dkris par gyur pa ste //
translated: Two pillars are firmly planted in the ground and bound together with ropes.

original: thag pa'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung tshud pa zlum po dang bcas bskor ba du mas bskor gyur pa //
analyzed: thag pa'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung tshud pa zlum po dang bcas bskor ba du mas bskor gyur pa //
translated: In the middle of the ropes is a handle of a sword, surrounded by a circle and many more circles.

original: de yi dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung nges par g-yo ba med par gzer gyis btab par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung nges par g-yo ba med par gzer gyis btab par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: In the middle of that, the handle of the sword is firmly fixed with a bolt, so that it does not move.

original: gzer dang thag par bcas pa g-yog par bya zhing ral gri'i so yi rtse mo'i cha yang mnan bar bya /
analyzed: gzer dang thag par bcas pa g-yog par bya zhing ral gri'i so yi rtse mo'i cha yang mnan bar bya /
translated: The bolt and the ropes are wrapped around, and the tip of the swordâ€™s edge is pressed down.

original: 140 / de yi steng du bug pa'i re kh'a can gyi spang leb las ni bskul bar 'gyur ba 'thon pa'o //
analyzed: 140 / de yi steng du bug pa'i re kh'a can gyi spang leb las ni bskul bar 'gyur ba 'thon pa'o //
translated: Above that, a board with a hole and a groove is placed, and a lever is inserted.

original: ral gri'i steng du zla ba'i dbus kyi chal lcags las byas pa chung ngu gcig kyang gzhag par bya //
analyzed: ral gri'i steng du zla ba'i dbus kyi chal lcags las byas pa chung ngu gcig kyang gzhag par bya //
translated: On top of the sword, a small piece of iron is placed in the middle of the moon.

original: zla ba'i steng du gang gi rkang pa gzhag pa de ni 'phral la ral gri yis kyang gcod par byed //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du gang gi rkang pa gzhag pa de ni 'phral la ral gri yis kyang gcod par byed //
translated: Whoever places his foot on the moon is immediately cut by the sword.

original: mkhar gyi sgo yi mtha' rnams dang ni mi yi bdag po'i khang par 'khrul 'khor kho na mtshon cha'o /
analyzed: mkhar gyi sgo yi mtha' rnams dang ni mi yi bdag po'i khang par 'khrul 'khor kho na mtshon cha'o /
translated: The outer walls of the palace and the house of the lord of men are marked with machines.

original: 141 / srog shing steng du nyi ma'i lag pas rtsa ba'i gnas su 'gyur te 'khor lo'i tshad la dgu cha'o //
analyzed: 141 / srog shing steng du nyi ma'i lag pas rtsa ba'i gnas su 'gyur te 'khor lo'i tshad la dgu cha'o //
translated: The sun's rays are in the center of the life-tree, in the basic place, with a ninth part of the wheel's measure.

original: zur du ka ba 'phred gdang mnyam dang mi mnyam shing rta gnas las gnyis dang phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: zur du ka ba 'phred gdang mnyam dang mi mnyam shing rta gnas las gnyis dang phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
translated: In the corner, the pillars and crossbeams are equal or unequal, with a measure of two and a half from the chariot's place.

original: cha phyed dag la 'thab mo pa yis ste mnyam dang mi mnyam 'dren  byed rta'am glang po rnams //
analyzed: cha phyed dag la 'thab mo pa yis ste mnyam dang mi mnyam 'dren  byed rta'am glang po rnams //
translated: In half a part, the fighters, with equal or unequal horses or elephants, are the leaders.

original: de nas 'khor lo'i phyed kyi  sa la steng du me long do shal rgyal mtshan la sogs bkod pa'o /
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo'i phyed kyi  sa la steng du me long do shal rgyal mtshan la sogs bkod pa'o /
translated: Then, on the half of the wheel, the mirror, necklace, victory banner, and so forth are arranged above.

original: 142 / gcig phyed cha gnyis dag ste zla ba lag pa rtse mo can rnams rtsa ba'i gnas dang gdan rnams kyi //
analyzed: 142 / gcig phyed cha gnyis dag ste zla ba lag pa rtse mo can rnams rtsa ba'i gnas dang gdan rnams kyi //
translated: One and a half parts, the moon, hand, and peak, are in the basic place and on the seats.

original: zlum po phyed bcas gcig cha padma'i shing rta'i sa ni dga' ba'i dbye @16b  bdag la mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: zlum po phyed bcas gcig cha padma'i shing rta'i sa ni dga' ba'i dbye @16b  bdag la mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: The round with an addition of one part, the lotus chariot's place, is equal to the division of joy for me.

original: rten dang bcas pa 'khor lo'i tshad ni rta dang glang po'i dbang gis phyed dang bcas pa rnams gnyis kyang //
analyzed: rten dang bcas pa 'khor lo'i tshad ni rta dang glang po'i dbang gis phyed dang bcas pa rnams gnyis kyang //
translated: The measure of a chariot with its base is half a kroÅ›a, a kroÅ›a, or one and a half kroÅ›as, according to whether it is for a horse, an elephant, or a chariot.

original: lha rnams kyi ni padma'i rigs te lha yi bu yis bkod pa dga' ba'i rigs ni mi rnams kyi /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni padma'i rigs te lha yi bu yis bkod pa dga' ba'i rigs ni mi rnams kyi /
translated: The gods have a lotus chariot, the sons of the gods have a delightful chariot, and humans have a chariot of the species.

original: 143 / brgyad dang chu gter srog shing 'khor lo rnams kyis rnams gsum 'dir ni shing rta chen po phyed dang mnyam //
analyzed: 143 / brgyad dang chu gter srog shing 'khor lo rnams kyis rnams gsum 'dir ni shing rta chen po phyed dang mnyam //
translated: These three great chariots are equal to one-eighth, one-half, and one-half of a kroÅ›a, respectively.

original: nyi ma'i shing rta mchog ni 'khor lo gcig pa mi mnyam rta yang lha ma yin rnams rnam par 'joms //
analyzed: nyi ma'i shing rta mchog ni 'khor lo gcig pa mi mnyam rta yang lha ma yin rnams rnam par 'joms //
translated: The supreme chariot of the sun has one wheel, and its uneven horses conquer the asuras.

original: g-yul du phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba mi mnyam mnyam pa'i shing rta chen po rgyal rigs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: g-yul du phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba mi mnyam mnyam pa'i shing rta chen po rgyal rigs rnams kyi'o //
translated: The great chariot of the ká¹£atriyas, which is uneven and equal, is invincible in battle.

original: steng dang mngon du phyogs pa 'joms te mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du rgyab ni 'joms pa mnyam par 'gyur /
analyzed: steng dang mngon du phyogs pa 'joms te mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du rgyab ni 'joms pa mnyam par 'gyur /
translated: It conquers above and in front, and in equal and unequal battles, it conquers the rear.

original: 144 / drug lnga chu gter me yi cha rnams dag gis ka ba'i rtse mor bug pa mnyam par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 144 / drug lnga chu gter me yi cha rnams dag gis ka ba'i rtse mor bug pa mnyam par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: The top of the pillar is the same as the water, fire, and air parts, each of which is one-sixth of the diameter of the moon.

original: rtsa ba dag las steng du phyed kyi cha ni rtseg ma'i dbang gis 'gyur te lha rnams gzhal med khang //
analyzed: rtsa ba dag las steng du phyed kyi cha ni rtseg ma'i dbang gis 'gyur te lha rnams gzhal med khang //
translated: Above the base, the top of the pillar is divided into three stories, each half the size of the one below it, and the gods live in the celestial palaces.

original: de bzhin sa la mi bdag rnams kyi rnam gsum rtseg ma'i dbang gis yul gyi ltad mo dga' ston la //
analyzed: de bzhin sa la mi bdag rnams kyi rnam gsum rtseg ma'i dbang gis yul gyi ltad mo dga' ston la //
translated: In the same way, the kings of men live in the three-storied palaces on the earth, enjoying the spectacle of the land.

original: khru nas khru yi bar dag gis ni phyogs rnams kun tu 'khor ba dang ldan chen por rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: khru nas khru yi bar dag gis ni phyogs rnams kun tu 'khor ba dang ldan chen por rab tu 'gyur /
translated: The circumference of the palace is from one to one and a half cubits in all directions.

original: 145 /'khor lo'i steng du ka ba'i rtse mo dag la rnam gsum rtseg ma'i dbang gis khyogs rnams phyogs kun du //
analyzed: 145 /'khor lo'i steng du ka ba'i rtse mo dag la rnam gsum rtseg ma'i dbang gis khyogs rnams phyogs kun du //
translated: Above the wheel, the top of the pillar is divided into three stories, and the palanquins are in all directions.

original: brgyad gnyis brgyad dang de nas phyed de phyogs dang dus dang dus dag lag pa rten nyid sa gsum la //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis brgyad dang de nas phyed de phyogs dang dus dang dus dag lag pa rten nyid sa gsum la //
translated: In the eight directions, there are two, eight, and then half, and in the directions, times, and times, the hands are the support.

original: steng dang 'og tu 'khor bar byed pa lag pas gzung ba'i 'khrul shing la ni bu mo rnams kyis sten //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu 'khor bar byed pa lag pas gzung ba'i 'khrul shing la ni bu mo rnams kyis sten //
translated: The girls sit on the turning pole held by the hands, above and below the three stories.

original: nang dang phyi rol dag tu gnas pa 'og dang steng du son cing phyogs brgyad du ni 'khyog pa rnams /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol dag tu gnas pa 'og dang steng du son cing phyogs brgyad du ni 'khyog pa rnams /
translated: The inner and outer [parts] are arranged above and below, and the eight directions are bent.

original: 146 / steng dang 'og tu sbubs ni 'khyog por 'gyur te kun nas sbubs kyi rnam pa dag gis 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: 146 / steng dang 'og tu sbubs ni 'khyog por 'gyur te kun nas sbubs kyi rnam pa dag gis 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: The upper and lower cavities are bent, and the machine is [made] with all kinds of cavities.

original: sbubs kyi rtse mor bum pa'i gzugs la bug pa yang ni sbubs kyi bug pa dag gi tshad du 'gyur //
analyzed: sbubs kyi rtse mor bum pa'i gzugs la bug pa yang ni sbubs kyi bug pa dag gi tshad du 'gyur //
translated: At the tip of the cavity, there is the form of a pot, and the hole is the size of the hole of the cavity.

original: chu ni 'dren par byed cing drangs pa'i chu ni btang bar gyur pa dag kyang bum pa'i bu ga  nas //
analyzed: chu ni 'dren par byed cing drangs pa'i chu ni btang bar gyur pa dag kyang bum pa'i bu ga  nas //
translated: Drawing in water and letting go of the drawn water through the hole of the pot,

original: skyed mos tshal dang ldum ra dag gi mnyam pa'i sa la gang du drangs pa der ni 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang ldum ra dag gi mnyam pa'i sa la gang du drangs pa der ni 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: it goes to the place where it is drawn, the level ground of the garden and the park.

original: 147 / rab mchog sa gzhi dag la gdug pa can rnams sgrub pa'i don dang @17a * //
analyzed: 147 / rab mchog sa gzhi dag la gdug pa can rnams sgrub pa'i don dang @17a * //
translated: On the best ground, for the purpose of accomplishing the wicked,

original: chos dang ldan pa rgyal don du //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa rgyal don du //
translated: and for the purpose of the king, for the righteous,

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srid gsum bla mas zla ba bzang la thams cad sngon du gsungs pa gang //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srid gsum bla mas zla ba bzang la thams cad sngon du gsungs pa gang //
translated: whatever was previously taught by the supreme one of the three worlds, the primordial Buddha, to Sucandra,

original: de yi nang nas cung zad tsam zhig 'dir ni de ring yul 'dir khyod la bdag gis gsal bar bstan //
analyzed: de yi nang nas cung zad tsam zhig 'dir ni de ring yul 'dir khyod la bdag gis gsal bar bstan //
translated: Of these, a small portion has been clearly indicated to you today in this place.

original: rang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag mtha' dag gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas min no nyi ma kye /
analyzed: rang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag mtha' dag gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas min no nyi ma kye /
translated: Do not do this out of hatred or attachment, O Sun, but for the sake of protecting your own abode.

original: 148 / chang dang lan tshva'i chu gter dbus su thub pa sa yi dkyil 'khor la ni las sa yang dag gnas //
analyzed: 148 / chang dang lan tshva'i chu gter dbus su thub pa sa yi dkyil 'khor la ni las sa yang dag gnas //
translated: In the middle of the ocean of wine and salt water, the sage, the earth mandala, is situated.

original: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum la nyi ma'i dum bu rnams su mi yi bdag po rim pas 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum la nyi ma'i dum bu rnams su mi yi bdag po rim pas 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: The sun moves in stages in the three hundred thousand leagues of the earth.

original: dum bu gcig la dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu lnga ste nor gyi 'dab ma dag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dum bu gcig la dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu lnga ste nor gyi 'dab ma dag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One part is twenty-five thousand leagues, together with the petal of wealth.

original: de yi dbus na kee la sha ste mchog gi gangs ri yis ni phyogs rnams kun tu bskor ba'o /
analyzed: de yi dbus na kee la sha ste mchog gi gangs ri yis ni phyogs rnams kun tu bskor ba'o /
translated: In its middle is Kailash, the supreme snow mountain, surrounding all directions.

original: 149 / sa la kee la sha yi dum du gangs kyi ri dang bcas pa de ni kun nas sum cha ste //
analyzed: 149 / sa la kee la sha yi dum du gangs kyi ri dang bcas pa de ni kun nas sum cha ste //
translated: In the part of Kailash on earth, together with the snow mountain, it is three-fourths.

original: phyi rol du ni 'dab ma re re dag kyang nyin byed yul dang gling gi yul rnams dag gis brgyan //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'dab ma re re dag kyang nyin byed yul dang gling gi yul rnams dag gis brgyan //
translated: Externally, each petal is adorned with the lands of the sun and the lands of the continents.

original: g-yas kyi phyed na sham bha lar grags thub mchog gi gnas grong ni bye ba lhag par gnas pa ste //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyed na sham bha lar grags thub mchog gi gnas grong ni bye ba lhag par gnas pa ste //
translated: On the right half is the land of the supreme sages, known as Shambhala, inhabited by more than ten million towns.

original: bye ba'i grong gis nges par bcings pa yul du 'gyur te rgyal khams grong ni 'bum phrag rnams kyis so /
analyzed: bye ba'i grong gis nges par bcings pa yul du 'gyur te rgyal khams grong ni 'bum phrag rnams kyis so /
translated: The land is surrounded by ten million towns, and the kingdom by one hundred thousand towns.

original: 150 / gcig gnyis gsum dang chu gter dbye ba mda' ro thub pa lnga dang 'jig rten la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: 150 / gcig gnyis gsum dang chu gter dbye ba mda' ro thub pa lnga dang 'jig rten la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: One, two, three, and four oceans, five sages, and the divisions of the world, etc.

original: phye ba mi dbang 'khor lo can ni sa gzhi dag la 'khor te rnam shes ldan pas btsal bar bya //
analyzed: phye ba mi dbang 'khor lo can ni sa gzhi dag la 'khor te rnam shes ldan pas btsal bar bya //
translated: The cakravartins, the lords of men, rule the earth, to be sought by those endowed with consciousness.

original: 'khor lo can dang phyed can dum bu can ni yul gyi mi bdag phyag rgya'i lag ni de las gzhan //
analyzed: 'khor lo can dang phyed can dum bu can ni yul gyi mi bdag phyag rgya'i lag ni de las gzhan //
translated: The cakravartins, the half-cakravartins, and the partial cakravartins are the rulers of the land, the seal-holders are other than that.

original: phyi rol du ni dus kyi dbye ba nges par 'gyur te ji ltar 'jig rten mgon gyi de bzhin no /
analyzed: phyi rol du ni dus kyi dbye ba nges par 'gyur te ji ltar 'jig rten mgon gyi de bzhin no /
translated: Externally, the divisions of time are determined, just as in the case of the Lord of the World.

original: 151 /'od zer bdun dang ri gza' thub rnams 'dir ni de bzhin snying stobs ldan pa lha yi skye gnas te //
analyzed: 151 /'od zer bdun dang ri gza' thub rnams 'dir ni de bzhin snying stobs ldan pa lha yi skye gnas te //
translated: The seven rays, the seven planets, the seven sages, here are the abodes of the gods, endowed with sattva.

original: nya dang rus sbal phag pa mi yi seng ge dang bcas mi'u thung dang dz'a mad  aag ni dang // r'a ma nag po de ltar brgyad ni lha min rigs la 'jigs ster rdul gyi 'byung po'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: nya dang rus sbal phag pa mi yi seng ge dang bcas mi'u thung dang dz'a mad  aag ni dang // r'a ma nag po de ltar brgyad ni lha min rigs la 'jigs ster rdul gyi 'byung po'i skye gnas so //
translated: The fish, the tortoise, the pig, the human, the lion, the dwarf, the demon, the black Ramaâ€”these eight are the abodes of the rajas-born demons, fearful to the gods.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gdan gyi mthar ni lha min dgra bo tshe lo brgya pa phyag na 'khor lor 'gyur /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gdan gyi mthar ni lha min dgra bo tshe lo brgya pa phyag na 'khor lor 'gyur /
translated: At the end of the thirty-two seats, the enemy of the asuras, with a life of one hundred years, is Cakra in his hand.

original: 152 / a'a dra aa no gha dang phag ldan lha min lag 'gro'i @17b rigs la mun pa can ni gzhan yang lnga //
analyzed: 152 / a'a dra aa no gha dang phag ldan lha min lag 'gro'i @17b rigs la mun pa can ni gzhan yang lnga //
translated: Ä€dra, AnoghÄ, Varaha, Asura, Lagna, and the five families of the dark one,

original: byi ba dbang po gos dkar can dang sbrang rtsi'i blo gros 'joms byed brgyad pa gang de mun pa can //
analyzed: byi ba dbang po gos dkar can dang sbrang rtsi'i blo gros 'joms byed brgyad pa gang de mun pa can //
translated: the mouse, Indra, PÄá¹‡á¸ara, and the one with the mind of honeyâ€”the eighth is the dark one.

original: gsal bar mkha'i yul gyi b'a ga da sogs grong khyer du ni bdun pa yang dag skyes pa ste //
analyzed: gsal bar mkha'i yul gyi b'a ga da sogs grong khyer du ni bdun pa yang dag skyes pa ste //
translated: The seventh is the one born in the city of VÄgÄá¸a in the land of the sky, clearly.

original: gang du 'jig rten lha min yan lag stobs dang ldan par gnas shing brtse ba med pa kla klo'i gzugs /
analyzed: gang du 'jig rten lha min yan lag stobs dang ldan par gnas shing brtse ba med pa kla klo'i gzugs /

analyzed: dbus su gdan ni nyi shu rtsa lnga rim par yongs su bgrangs pa dag gi dus kyi mthar //

analyzed: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs te bde ster zhes pa de bzhin kla klo'i rigs la mthar byed nyid //

analyzed: rdo yi rta bcibs 'khor lo can gyi phyag na mdung thung mtha' dag dgra la snun byed nyi ma'i gzi /

translated: The sons and grandsons of the Ká¹£atriyas, who have been born in the middle of the Ká¹£atriya race, will be destroyed.

original: dus 'dir kee la sha yi ri bo lha yis bkod pa'i grong nas 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus 'dir kee la sha yi ri bo lha yis bkod pa'i grong nas 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: rdo rta glang po'i dbang po gser gyi shing rta mi bdag phyag na mtshon ldan dpa' bo rnams kyang ngo /

analyzed: 160 / rdo yi rta ni rlung gi shugs can yon tan gyis bsgyur yon tan bye ba kha dog sna tshogs pa //

translated: The elephant, intoxicated with wine, is called the Veda, and has a hundred thousand numbers, and a hundred thousand chariots. The six of Akshauhini, and the king of men, bound with a diadem, are the nine and ninety families.

original: rigs ldan khyab 'jug 'phrog byed dag dang bcas pa sde 'di dag gis kla klo rlag par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs ldan khyab 'jug 'phrog byed dag dang bcas pa sde 'di dag gis kla klo rlag par byed par 'gyur /

analyzed: 161 / mchog tu tsha ba'i dpa' bo rnams kyis kla klo'i tshogs la bsnun bya glang po'i dbang pos glang po la //

analyzed: rdo yi rta yis rta rnams la ste mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du sa skyong rnams kyis sa skyong la //

analyzed: rta la gnas pa zla ba chen po'i bu ni ha nu m'a na  da rnon po'i mtshon gyis bsnun par 'gyur //
translated: The son of MahÄcandra, mounted on a horse, will be struck down by the sharp weapon of HanumÄn.

translated: The entire army of the fierce barbarian heroes, having made the lord of the demigods their leader,ğŸ”½will be defeated in battle by the fierce Ká¹£atriya king, and Viá¹£á¹‡u, together with Åšiva, will go

analyzed: de yi dus su 'dzin ma dag la mtha' dag skye bo'i rigs ni chos dang 'dod pa nor rnams rdzogs //
translated: At that time, the entire human race will be perfect in Dharma, desire, and wealth.

analyzed: 'bru rnams dgon par skye ba dang ni shing rnams 'bras bu brtan pos dud  pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Grains will grow in the wilderness, and trees will be laden with stable fruit.

analyzed: 163 / kla klo'i tshogs ni 'khor gyi skye bo dang bcas rab tu bcad nas mi yi lo ni brgya phyed na //
translated: After cutting down the hordes of barbarians, together with their retinue, for fifty human years,

analyzed: rigs ldan grub par 'gyur te lha yis bkod pa'i pho brang mtho ba kee la sha yi rgyab tu'o //
translated: He will be born in the family of the Kshatriyas, and will be the king of the whole earth, in the city of Kusumapura.

translated: The son of the Lord of men and gods, the son of Brahma, the Lord of the gods, will be born in the family of the Brahmanas, in the city of VidiÅ›Ä.

analyzed: 164 / rdzogs ldan mtshams su kla klo'i chos rnams mtha' dag srid pa gsum gyi bla ma dag gis bcad byas te //
translated: In the age of the fourth age, the Lord of the three worlds will destroy all the barbarian religions,

original: bcad nas lo ni brgyad brgya rnams su tshangs pa gzhag pa mdzad nas bde ba'i gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½slar yang de nyid dbus su mi yi bdag po sras rnams dag gi rigs kyi dbye ba dag tu 'gyur //

translated: and having established the Brahmanas for eight hundred years, will go to the abode of happiness.ğŸ”½Then in the middle of the country, the sons of the Lord of men will be divided into families.

analyzed: de rnams dbus su lha min dbang po mi bdag thub pa rnams ni phal pa gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: In the middle of the country, the Lord of the Asuras, the Lord of men, and the sages will appear, and other ordinary people.

analyzed: 165 / kla klo rnams ni gzhom pa'i slad du lha yi bdag po dbang po bcu gnyis dag dang ldan par 'gro //
translated: For the sake of conquering the barbarians, the Lord of the Gods, Indra, goes forth with his twelve armies.

analyzed: dum bu dum bu dag tu kla klo'i chos ni bcom nas 'khor lo can yang bde ba'i gnas su 'gro //
translated: Having destroyed the barbarian religion, piece by piece, the Cakravartin also goes to the land of happiness.

analyzed: skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma'i sras ni tshangs dang lha yi dbang po rgyab dang mdun du ste //
translated: The son of the human guru of the third period, Brahma and the Lord of the Gods, are behind and in front.

original: rgyab tu tshangs pa la sogs rigs rnams rnam pa sna tshogs sa yi steng du dbye ba du mar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyab tu tshangs pa la sogs rigs rnams rnam pa sna tshogs sa yi steng du dbye ba du mar 'gyur /
translated: Behind, Brahma and so forth, the various types, become many divisions on the earth.

original: 166 / tshangs pa sogs la mi rnams lo ni brgya phrag bco brgyad dang ldan 'di dag mi rnams dag gi tshe //
analyzed: 166 / tshangs pa sogs la mi rnams lo ni brgya phrag bco brgyad dang ldan 'di dag mi rnams dag gi tshe //
translated: The humans of Brahma and so forth, with one hundred and eighteen human years,

original: de yi phyed ni 'od srung gi'o rab mchog sa yi steng du dpal ldan mi yi seng ge'i phyed //
analyzed: de yi phyed ni 'od srung gi'o rab mchog sa yi steng du dpal ldan mi yi seng ge'i phyed //
translated: half of that is Kasyapa's. On the most excellent earth, half of the glorious human lion,

original: drug cus dman pa de bzhin nyid du dus bzhi so so'i dus su mi thung sogs la 'phrog byed kyi //
analyzed: drug cus dman pa de bzhin nyid du dus bzhi so so'i dus su mi thung sogs la 'phrog byed kyi //
translated: less by sixty, in the same way, in the four periods, in the time of each, is taken by Vamana and so forth.

original: rigs ldan @19a * //
analyzed: rigs ldan @19a * //
