translated: The one of the lineage,

original: mthar ni ji srid brgya phrag gcig gi lo yi grangs kyi skye bo'i tshe ru rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: mthar ni ji srid brgya phrag gcig gi lo yi grangs kyi skye bo'i tshe ru rab tu 'gyur /
translated: Finally, for a period of one hundred years, the life span of men will be short.

original: 167 / de ltar dum bu thams cad du yang dus bzhi'i dus su kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: 167 / de ltar dum bu thams cad du yang dus bzhi'i dus su kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug pa ste //
translated: Thus, in all the continents, the religion of the barbarians will last for a period of four ages.

original: lo ni brgyad dang brgya phrag gcig tu nges par gnas te de nas kla klo'i chos ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: lo ni brgyad dang brgya phrag gcig tu nges par gnas te de nas kla klo'i chos ni nyams pa'o //
translated: It will last eight years and one hundred years, and then the religion of the barbarians will decline.ğŸ”½Then, for twenty thousand years, with the exception of one hundred years, the religion of the Buddha will spread.

original: de nas lo ni stong phrag nyi shu lag pa brgya dang bral ba sangs rgyas chos ni rab tu 'jug / rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan rtsod pa'i dus ni nus pa'i tshad kyis sa gzhi dag la nges par rgyu /
analyzed: de nas lo ni stong phrag nyi shu lag pa brgya dang bral ba sangs rgyas chos ni rab tu 'jug / rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan rtsod pa'i dus ni nus pa'i tshad kyis sa gzhi dag la nges par rgyu /
translated: The age of perfection, the age of three quarter of the Law, the age of two quarters, and the age of dispute will follow one another according to their order, and will last for a certain time on the earth.

original: 168 /'jig rten khams ni bskyed pa dag dang gza' yi rgyu ba mnyam pa 'khor lo can ni 'byung ba dang // kla klo rnams kyi chos ni nyams shing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas la rigs ldan gyis ni lam sbyin pa //
analyzed: 168 /'jig rten khams ni bskyed pa dag dang gza' yi rgyu ba mnyam pa 'khor lo can ni 'byung ba dang // kla klo rnams kyi chos ni nyams shing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas la rigs ldan gyis ni lam sbyin pa //
translated: When the world is created, when the movement of the planets is regular, when the Cakravartins appear, when the religion of the barbarians declines, the Ká¹£atriyas will give the path to the abode of supreme happiness.

original: 'di dag thams cad bdag gis khyod la don ni ji bzhin bshad do zla ba bzang po dus gsum las //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad bdag gis khyod la don ni ji bzhin bshad do zla ba bzang po dus gsum las //
translated: I have explained all of this to you just as it is, O Candrabhadra, in the three times.

original: slar yang khyod ni skye bo kun la phan pa'i don dang thar pa'i slad du bdag la ci zhig 'dri /ğŸ”½169 / dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung pa /ğŸ”½dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las /
analyzed: slar yang khyod ni skye bo kun la phan pa'i don dang thar pa'i slad du bdag la ci zhig 'dri / 169 / dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung pa / dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las /
translated: Again, what do you ask of me for the sake of the benefit of all beings and for the sake of liberation?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par bkod pa'i le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par bkod pa'i le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter, on the arrangement of the world systems, from the glorious Great Original Buddha, the glorious Wheel of Time.

original: // / mi shes sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis bstan pa dag kyang bdag gis te //
analyzed: // / mi shes sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis bstan pa dag kyang bdag gis te //
translated: The extent of the various ignorances that you, O Victorious One, have taught, I have understood.

original: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ji ltar lags //
analyzed: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ji ltar lags //
translated: Again, I wish to listen: How is the entirety of the three worlds in existence in the center of the body?

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab gsungs pa ;
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab gsungs pa ;
translated: Having heard the words of Candrabhadra, the Sugata gave his approval and spoke:

original: / sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du mchog gi thugs rjes sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la'o /
analyzed: / sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du mchog gi thugs rjes sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la'o /
translated: And for the sake of the liberation of sentient beings, the supreme compassion of the Buddhas is also in the body.

original: 1 / sa dang chu me rlung dang rdo rje lha yi gzhu dang rlung rnams dang ni khyim gyi 'khor lo dang // zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan lhun po gdengs can mi dang lta yi gnas dang 'khyog po skar mar bcas //
analyzed: 1 / sa dang chu me rlung dang rdo rje lha yi gzhu dang rlung rnams dang ni khyim gyi 'khor lo dang // zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan lhun po gdengs can mi dang lta yi gnas dang 'khyog po skar mar bcas //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, the divine bow of Indra, the wind, the wheel of the house, the moon, the sun, RÄhu, Meru, the serpent, the human, the abode of the gods, the crooked, the stars,

original: 'pho ba zla ba dag dang phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo tshes rnams mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ni //
analyzed: 'pho ba zla ba dag dang phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo tshes rnams mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ni //
translated: the transits, the months, the directions, the days, the nights, the lunar days, all of these are in the middle of the body.

original: rang rang yi ges shes bya rnam gsum khyab bdag bgrod pa rnal 'byor pa yis stong pa'i dbye bas so /
analyzed: rang rang yi ges shes bya rnam gsum khyab bdag bgrod pa rnal 'byor pa yis stong pa'i dbye bas so /
translated: They are to be known by their respective syllables, the three pervaders, the lord, the path, by the yogi, by the division of emptiness.

original: 2 / lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs su mtha' dag ro drug zos shing @19b 'thungs pa dag las 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: 2 / lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs su mtha' dag ro drug zos shing @19b 'thungs pa dag las 'gyur pa ste //
translated: In this body, the entire collection of elements arises from the six tastes that are eaten and drunk.

original: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung las te rab gsal nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang rnam mkha'i khams las so //
analyzed: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung las te rab gsal nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang rnam mkha'i khams las so //
translated: The six tastes are from the elements, and the collection of the manifest and the unmanifest is from the element of space.

original: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa ro mnyam 'gyur med rtag par yang ni 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa ro mnyam 'gyur med rtag par yang ni 'gyur pa ste //
translated: In emptiness, gnosis is mixed, becoming of one taste, unchanging, and permanent.

original: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba rnam gsum srid pa la gnas rang gi lus la rig par bya /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba rnam gsum srid pa la gnas rang gi lus la rig par bya /
translated: Thus, the three kinds of peace, which are based on the elements, are to be understood as being based on oneâ€™s own body.

original: 3 / sa bon padmar gnas pa dag ni 'dzin mas 'dzin te de las chu yis sdud do phyi nas ni //
analyzed: 3 / sa bon padmar gnas pa dag ni 'dzin mas 'dzin te de las chu yis sdud do phyi nas ni //
translated: The seed, which is located in the lotus, is held by the holding [vÄyu] and is moistened by the water [vÄyu].

original: me yis smin par byed cing ro dang ro ni za bar byed de 'di yi 'phel ba rlung gis so //
analyzed: me yis smin par byed cing ro dang ro ni za bar byed de 'di yi 'phel ba rlung gis so //
translated: Then, it is ripened by the fire [vÄyu], and the taste and taste-consumer are consumed. Its increase is due to the air [vÄyu].

original: nam mkha' dag kyang 'phel ba'i go skabs sbyin byed mi yi bdag po dus las de ltar grub pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' dag kyang 'phel ba'i go skabs sbyin byed mi yi bdag po dus las de ltar grub pa ste //
translated: Space, the lord of humans, gives the opportunity for increase. Thus, it is accomplished from time.

original: btsa' bar gyur pa'i dus dang byis pa la sogs dus dag tu yang lha yi gnas skabs rnams byed do /
analyzed: btsa' bar gyur pa'i dus dang byis pa la sogs dus dag tu yang lha yi gnas skabs rnams byed do /
translated: At the time of birth and in the stages of childhood and so on, the states of the gods are created.

original: 4 / sa bon dag gis ni gsal bar lci zhing srab  nyid byed chu ni de bzhin gsher ba nyid //
analyzed: 4 / sa bon dag gis ni gsal bar lci zhing srab  nyid byed chu ni de bzhin gsher ba nyid //
translated: The seed makes it clear, heavy, and thin. Water makes it moist.

original: mes ni smin par byed cing rab mchog rnam pa bcu yi rlung rnams dag ni 'di yi 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: mes ni smin par byed cing rab mchog rnam pa bcu yi rlung rnams dag ni 'di yi 'phel ba'o //
translated: Fire ripens it, and the tenfold supreme wind increases it.

original: 'phel ba dag la slar yang nam mkha' nyid ni go skabs sbyin byed dus las de ltar bskyed pa ste //
analyzed: 'phel ba dag la slar yang nam mkha' nyid ni go skabs sbyin byed dus las de ltar bskyed pa ste //
translated: Space gives it room again in its increase, and thus it is generated from time.

original: sna tshogs dngos po du  ma dag gis lus bcas sgra dang yid dang nus pa rnams ni spro bar byed /
analyzed: sna tshogs dngos po du  ma dag gis lus bcas sgra dang yid dang nus pa rnams ni spro bar byed /
translated: The body is formed with many various things, and sound, mind, and power are emitted.

original: 5 / gsang ba'i padmar khrag gi nang du gang tshe lhung ba'i byang chub sa bon srog dang bcas pa dag / nya dang rus sbal phag par 'gyur te mi yi seng ge mi thung r'a ma r'a ma dag dang ni //
analyzed: 5 / gsang ba'i padmar khrag gi nang du gang tshe lhung ba'i byang chub sa bon srog dang bcas pa dag / nya dang rus sbal phag par 'gyur te mi yi seng ge mi thung r'a ma r'a ma dag dang ni //
translated: When the seed of enlightenment, together with the life force, falls into the blood in the secret lotus, it becomes a fish, a tortoise, a pig, a human lion, a dwarf, a ram, a ram,

original: nag po sangs rgyas mi dbang rnam bcur 'gyur te 'di dag rnams kyang gnas skabs rnam pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: nag po sangs rgyas mi dbang rnam bcur 'gyur te 'di dag rnams kyang gnas skabs rnam pa bcu yin no //
translated: a black one, a buddha, and a lord of men. These are the ten states.

original: mngal du gsum ste de bzhin btsa' ba'i dus su gcig dbang byis pa'i dus dag tu yang rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: mngal du gsum ste de bzhin btsa' ba'i dus su gcig dbang byis pa'i dus dag tu yang rnam pa gnyis /
translated: Three in the womb, one at the time of birth, two in the stages of childhood,

original: 6 / gzhon nu lang tsho dag la gzhan du rab tu 'gyur te rgyas pa gcig dang yang dag de bzhin gcig / rgan po nyid la zhi ba gcig ste mngal skyes rnams kyi srid pa 'chi ba nyid ni tha ma'o //ğŸ”½nya la nya yi rnam par 'gyur ba nyin zhag 'ga' ste rus sbal la ni rus sbal dngos po yang //
analyzed: 6 / gzhon nu lang tsho dag la gzhan du rab tu 'gyur te rgyas pa gcig dang yang dag de bzhin gcig / rgan po nyid la zhi ba gcig ste mngal skyes rnams kyi srid pa 'chi ba nyid ni tha ma'o // nya la nya yi rnam par 'gyur ba nyin zhag 'ga' ste rus sbal la ni rus sbal dngos po yang //
translated: 6. In youth, the body is one, in the full bloom of youth another, in old age another; in the womb, another; at death, another.ğŸ”½7. The fish is transformed into a fish for a few days; the tortoise into a tortoise;ğŸ”½the pig into a pig; the man into a man; the lion into a lion.ğŸ”½8. The dwarf is born a dwarf; the king is born a king; the black man is born a black man.

original: phag pa la yang de yi skye mched nyi ma 'byung ste mi yi seng ge la ni rab tu skye /ğŸ”½7 / mi thung la ni byis pa'i dngos po r'a ma la @20a * //ğŸ”½yang mi bdag nyid kyi so rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phag pa la yang de yi skye mched nyi ma 'byung ste mi yi seng ge la ni rab tu skye / 7 / mi thung la ni byis pa'i dngos po r'a ma la @20a * // yang mi bdag nyid kyi so rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: 9. The black man, again, falls to the earth; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½10. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½11. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½12. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½13. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½14. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½15. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½16. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½17. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½18. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.ğŸ”½19. The black man, again, is born a black man; the king, again, is born a king; the dwarf, again, is born a dwarf.

original: slar yang r'a ma la ni ltung bar 'gyur te de nyid nag po la ni gsal bar sgyu dag byed //ğŸ”½sangs rgyas la yang zhi ba dang ni brtul zhugs nges pa byed de rigs ldan la ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: slar yang r'a ma la ni ltung bar 'gyur te de nyid nag po la ni gsal bar sgyu dag byed //ğŸ”½sangs rgyas la yang zhi ba dang ni brtul zhugs nges pa byed de rigs ldan la ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: 20. The black man, again, is born a black man; the

original: khu ba las ni rkang dang rus pa rgyus par 'gyur te rdul las pags pa khrag dang sha nyid do /
analyzed: khu ba las ni rkang dang rus pa rgyus par 'gyur te rdul las pags pa khrag dang sha nyid do /
translated: From the semen, the bones, marrow, and sinews are produced; from the blood, the skin, flesh, and veins.

original: 8 / mngal gyi nang du zla ba gcig ni khrag dang sa bon bdud rtsi'i ror gyur rab tu skye ba ste //
analyzed: 8 / mngal gyi nang du zla ba gcig ni khrag dang sa bon bdud rtsi'i ror gyur rab tu skye ba ste //
translated: In the womb, for one month, the embryo is a clot of blood, a seed, and an essence.

original: phyi nas sa bon myu gu rang gi snying khar rnam pa bcu yi rtsa ni shin tu phra ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nas sa bon myu gu rang gi snying khar rnam pa bcu yi rtsa ni shin tu phra ba'o //
translated: Then, in the heart, there are ten very subtle channels, like a seed and a sprout.

original: lte ba la yang brgyad pa brgyad  ni gzhan te rkang lag gdong rnams la ni gyen du skyod par byed //
analyzed: lte ba la yang brgyad pa brgyad  ni gzhan te rkang lag gdong rnams la ni gyen du skyod par byed //
translated: At the navel, there are eight groups of eight, which move upward in the arms, legs, and face.

original: zla ba gnyis po rdzogs par gyur pa dag la 'dir ni rkang lag gdong gi mtshon pa cung zad do /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis po rdzogs par gyur pa dag la 'dir ni rkang lag gdong gi mtshon pa cung zad do /
translated: In the second month, the arms, legs, and face are slightly indicated.

original: 9 / zla ba gsum pa rdzogs pa na ni lag pa rkang pa mgrin pa dag gi mgo po mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: 9 / zla ba gsum pa rdzogs pa na ni lag pa rkang pa mgrin pa dag gi mgo po mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: In the third month, the arms, legs, neck, and head are equal.

original: phra mo'i rtsa rnams zla ba bzhi pa la ni rkang lag gdong dang mgrin pa dag gi phyogs su ste //
analyzed: phra mo'i rtsa rnams zla ba bzhi pa la ni rkang lag gdong dang mgrin pa dag gi phyogs su ste //
translated: In the fourth month, the subtle channels of the arms, legs, face, and neck are formed.

original: lnga pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rus pa mkha' ro bsreg za dag ste tshigs rnams dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rus pa mkha' ro bsreg za dag ste tshigs rnams dag kyang ngo //
translated: In the fifth month, the flesh, blood, bones, and marrow are formed, and the joints.

original: zla ba drug pa la yang sha dang khrag tu 'gyur te tshor ba bde ba dang ni sdug bsngal yang /
analyzed: zla ba drug pa la yang sha dang khrag tu 'gyur te tshor ba bde ba dang ni sdug bsngal yang /
translated: In the sixth month, the flesh and blood are formed, and the sensations of pleasure and pain.

original: 10 / smin ma skra dang sbu dang bug pa rnams kyang thub mchog la ste rtsa ni lhag mar gyur pa rnams //ğŸ”½zla ba'i mjug tu nyin zhag so so'i dbang gis stong pa stong pa mig gi grangs ni skye ba ste //
analyzed: 10 / smin ma skra dang sbu dang bug pa rnams kyang thub mchog la ste rtsa ni lhag mar gyur pa rnams // zla ba'i mjug tu nyin zhag so so'i dbang gis stong pa stong pa mig gi grangs ni skye ba ste //
translated: In the seventh month, the eyebrows, body hair, and pores are formed, and the veins.ğŸ”½In the eighth month, the eyes, ears, and nose are formed, and the tongue.ğŸ”½In the ninth month, the teeth and nails are formed, and the faculties.

original: gnang dang rus pa rkang du 'gyur te ro 'dzin dang ni gci ba bshang ba brgyad pa dag la yang //ğŸ”½bug pa zhes la btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas kyis ni btsir ba dag gis sdug bsngal drag po'o /
analyzed: gnang dang rus pa rkang du 'gyur te ro 'dzin dang ni gci ba bshang ba brgyad pa dag la yang // bug pa zhes la btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas kyis ni btsir ba dag gis sdug bsngal drag po'o /
translated: In the tenth month, the sense faculties are completed, and the child is born.ğŸ”½At birth, the child is squeezed by the womb, and experiences intense pain.

original: 11 / mngal du mngal na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal btsa' ba'i dus dang byis pa'i dngos po la yang sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: 11 / mngal du mngal na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal btsa' ba'i dus dang byis pa'i dngos po la yang sdug bsngal te //
translated: In the womb, the suffering of being in the womb; at birth, the suffering of being a child;

original: gzhon nu dang ni lang tsho dag la bud med nor dang 'byor nyams nyon mongs sdug bsngal chen po gang //
analyzed: gzhon nu dang ni lang tsho dag la bud med nor dang 'byor nyams nyon mongs sdug bsngal chen po gang //
translated: In youth and in the prime of life, women are tormented by the suffering of the loss of wealth and power.

original: rgan po nyid la 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal slar yang 'gro ba drug tu 'jigs ster du 'bod la sogs te //
analyzed: rgan po nyid la 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal slar yang 'gro ba drug tu 'jigs ster du 'bod la sogs te //
translated: In old age, the suffering of death, which brings terror in the six realms of samsara, such as the Hell of Ultimate Torment.

original: sgyu mas rmongs par byas pa'i mtha' dag 'gro ba 'di ni sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: sgyu mas rmongs par byas pa'i mtha' dag 'gro ba 'di ni sdug bsngal dag las sdug bsngal 'dzin par byed /
translated: All these beings, deluded by illusion, are caught up in suffering after suffering.

original: 12 /'khor bar mi @20b nyid du ni 'gyur ba dag kyang 'ga' zhig tu ste chos kyi blo ni res 'ga' na //
analyzed: 12 /'khor bar mi @20b nyid du ni 'gyur ba dag kyang 'ga' zhig tu ste chos kyi blo ni res 'ga' na //
translated: Human birth is rare, and even then, the mind of Dharma is rare.ğŸ”½Therefore, through the power of virtue, one should have devotion to the Buddha and enter the first vehicle.

original: de bas sangs rgyas la ni rjes chags dge ba'i dbang gis 'gyur zhing dang po'i theg par rab tu 'jug / de bas dpal ldan rdo rje theg pa sgom pa la ni blo gros ma lus brgya lam dag ni 'jug / de las sangs rgyas nyid 'dod mchog
analyzed: de bas sangs rgyas la ni rjes chags dge ba'i dbang gis 'gyur zhing dang po'i theg par rab tu 'jug / de bas dpal ldan rdo rje theg pa sgom pa la ni blo gros ma lus brgya lam dag ni 'jug / de las sangs rgyas nyid 'dod mchog
translated: Therefore, to enter the glorious Vajrayana, the mind must enter it completely.

original: gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la 'jug pa ae ma shin tu dka'/
analyzed: gi bde ba'i go 'phang dag la 'jug pa ae ma shin tu dka'/
translated: From that, to enter the state of supreme bliss, the state of buddhahood, is very difficult.

original: 13 / mngal du yang dag dag pa'i sku ste btsa' ba'i dus nas so ni skyes pa dag kyang chos kyi'o //
analyzed: 13 / mngal du yang dag dag pa'i sku ste btsa' ba'i dus nas so ni skyes pa dag kyang chos kyi'o //
translated: The body of perfect purity is in the womb; the body of the Dharma is from the time of birth.

original: so rnams rab tu lhung bar 'gyur ba mi yi bdag po rgyal ba yi ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: so rnams rab tu lhung bar 'gyur ba mi yi bdag po rgyal ba yi ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: The body of enjoyment of the Victor, O King, is when the teeth appear.

original: de nas sprul pa'i sku ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par 'chi ba'i mtshams te mi rnams dag gi'o //
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i sku ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par 'chi ba'i mtshams te mi rnams dag gi'o //
translated: Then the emanation body is clearly manifest, at the time of certain death for human beings.

original: mngal dang phyi rol dag tu slar yang 'di ni ye shes rnam shes dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ru 'gyur /
analyzed: mngal dang phyi rol dag tu slar yang 'di ni ye shes rnam shes dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ru 'gyur /
translated: In the womb and outside, it is again fourfold, by the division of intuition and consciousness.

original: 14 / rnam shes zla ba nyi ma dag kyang padmar gnas pa de ni mngal du dag pa'i sku yin te //
analyzed: 14 / rnam shes zla ba nyi ma dag kyang padmar gnas pa de ni mngal du dag pa'i sku yin te //
translated: The body of perfect purity in the womb is the intuition and consciousness abiding in the lotus of the sun and moon.

original: khams dang phung po rab tu 'byung ba rnam pa bcu po gang yin rgyal ba yi ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: khams dang phung po rab tu 'byung ba rnam pa bcu po gang yin rgyal ba yi ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The Dharma body of the Victor is the tenfold appearance of the elements and the aggregates.

original: de nas yon tan dbang gis rna ba sgra sogs skyes pa dag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas yon tan dbang gis rna ba sgra sogs skyes pa dag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru 'gyur //
translated: Then, by the power of the qualities, the ears and so on, born of sound and so forth, are the body of enjoyment.

original: de nas skra la sogs pa skyes te rab tu btsa' ba'i dus kyang 'dir ni sprul pa dag gi sku /ğŸ”½15 / skyes pa na ni nges par dbugs dag gang zhig rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de nyid dag pa'i sku //
analyzed: de nas skra la sogs pa skyes te rab tu btsa' ba'i dus kyang 'dir ni sprul pa dag gi sku / 15 / skyes pa na ni nges par dbugs dag gang zhig rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de nyid dag pa'i sku //
translated: Then, when the hair and so forth have grown, the time of birth is the NirmÄá¹‡akÄya of the victors.ğŸ”½When the teeth are produced, the DharmakÄya is the one who definitely gives rise to the breath.

original: de nas so ni rab 'byung gang zhig tshig ni gsal min dag kyang de bzhin nyid du chos kyi sku //
analyzed: de nas so ni rab 'byung gang zhig tshig ni gsal min dag kyang de bzhin nyid du chos kyi sku //
translated: Then, when the teeth are produced, the SambhogakÄya is the one who is not clear in speech.

original: de nas gnyis skyes rnams ni ltung bar 'gyur ba mi yi bdag po rgyal ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: de nas gnyis skyes rnams ni ltung bar 'gyur ba mi yi bdag po rgyal ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: Then, when the two sexual organs fall, the Saá¹ƒbhogakÄya of the lord of humans is the victor.

original: so rnams dag las 'chi ba'i mtshams ni phyi ru rgyal ba'i bdag po dag gi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur /
analyzed: so rnams dag las 'chi ba'i mtshams ni phyi ru rgyal ba'i bdag po dag gi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur /
translated: The limit of death from the teeth is the NirmÄá¹‡akÄya of the lords of the victors.

original: 16 / mngal du 'dir ni dang po dpal ldan sku yi rdo rjer 'gyur te gsung gi rang bzhin skyes pa na'o //
analyzed: 16 / mngal du 'dir ni dang po dpal ldan sku yi rdo rjer 'gyur te gsung gi rang bzhin skyes pa na'o //
translated: Here, in the womb, the first is ÅšrÄ«vajra Body; when born, it is the nature of speech.

original: thugs ni so dag rab tu skyes pa nyid na'o slar yang ltung nas ye shes rdo rjer rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: thugs ni so dag rab tu skyes pa nyid na'o slar yang ltung nas ye shes rdo rjer rab tu 'gyur //
translated: When the mind is produced from the teeth, it is the mind; falling again, it is the wisdom vajra.

original: ye shes rnam shes bsres shing nyi ma ri bong can dang bcas pa ye shes rdo rje la sogs kun //
analyzed: ye shes rnam shes bsres shing nyi ma ri bong can dang bcas pa ye shes rdo rje la sogs kun //
translated: The sun and moon together with the wisdom consciousness are the vajra of wisdom and so forth.

original: mngal na gnas pa dag ni sku yi rdo rje la sogs rim pa yis kyang stobs dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa dag ni sku yi rdo rje la sogs rim pa yis kyang stobs dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: The embryo becomes strong in stages, with the vajra body and so forth.

original: 17 / sa yi snying po dag ni bsreg zar 'gyur te @21a * //
analyzed: 17 / sa yi snying po dag ni bsreg zar 'gyur te @21a * //
translated: The heart of the earth becomes the fire,

original: 'dzin ma dang ni rlung dag stong pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: 'dzin ma dang ni rlung dag stong pa'i snying po'o //
translated: the navel and the wind become the heart of space.

original: rlung dang sa yi snying po dag ni chu nyid du 'gyur rang bzhin med pa dang ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung dang sa yi snying po dag ni chu nyid du 'gyur rang bzhin med pa dang ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The heart of the wind and the earth become water, the absence of intrinsic existence and intrinsic existence.

original: sa yi rten ni chu ste 'bar byed dag kyang chu yi rlung ni dag par byed pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: sa yi rten ni chu ste 'bar byed dag kyang chu yi rlung ni dag par byed pa dag gi'o //
translated: The support of the earth is water, the fire is the water wind, and the wind is the support of space.

original: rlung gi stong par rab tu 'gyur te  mi yi dbang po 'byung ba'i rten dang brten pa ji lta bzhin /
analyzed: rlung gi stong par rab tu 'gyur te  mi yi dbang po 'byung ba'i rten dang brten pa ji lta bzhin /
translated: The space of the wind becomes the space of the human lord, just as the support and the supported of the elements are.

original: 18 / phung po'i rten ni 'byung ba rnams su 'gyur te lus mchog dag la 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: 18 / phung po'i rten ni 'byung ba rnams su 'gyur te lus mchog dag la 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rtsa rnams so //
translated: The support of the aggregates becomes the elements, the channels of the collection of elements in the supreme body.

original: rtsa rnams kyi ni srog rlung rnam pa bcu por 'gyur te srog gi rlung rnams dag gi sems yin no //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi ni srog rlung rnam pa bcu por 'gyur te srog gi rlung rnams dag gi sems yin no //
translated: The tenfold life-force wind is the mind of the life-force winds.

original: sems de gnyis kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur yon tan dbang gis rang bzhin can dang rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: sems de gnyis kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur yon tan dbang gis rang bzhin can dang rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The nature of those two minds is the nature of the qualities, which is both existent and nonexistent.

original: de dag gi yang rten ni gtso bo srid pa gsum gyis btud cing gzhom med kun tu 'gro pa gang /
analyzed: de dag gi yang rten ni gtso bo srid pa gsum gyis btud cing gzhom med kun tu 'gro pa gang /
translated: The support of those is the supreme principle, which is bowed to by the three worlds and is the indestructible all-pervading.

original: 19 / dri ni 'dzin ma dag las 'byung ste ro yang rtse mo can las gzugs kyi khams ni chu las so //
analyzed: 19 / dri ni 'dzin ma dag las 'byung ste ro yang rtse mo can las gzugs kyi khams ni chu las so //
translated: Smell arises from the earth, taste from water, and the form realm from fire.

original: rlung las reg par 'gyur te zhi ba las kyang sgra dang chos kyi khams ni nam mkha' dag las so //
analyzed: rlung las reg par 'gyur te zhi ba las kyang sgra dang chos kyi khams ni nam mkha' dag las so //
translated: Touch arises from wind, and sound and the phenomena element arise from space.

original: stong pa sgra ni 'dzin par byed de nges par rgyal ba skyed mdzad chos kyi khams dang rlung dag ni //
analyzed: stong pa sgra ni 'dzin par byed de nges par rgyal ba skyed mdzad chos kyi khams dang rlung dag ni //
translated: The empty sound is the apprehender, and the phenomena element and wind definitely produce the Victor.

original: dri dang me yang gzugs te chu dag kyang ni ro'o de bzhin 'dzin ma dag ni reg bya'o /
analyzed: dri dang me yang gzugs te chu dag kyang ni ro'o de bzhin 'dzin ma dag ni reg bya'o /
translated: Smell and fire are form, and water is taste. Likewise, earth is touch.

original: 20 / grub pa gzugs ni 'dzin ma la ste srid pa gsum gyi gnas su chu la yang ni 'du shes grub //
analyzed: 20 / grub pa gzugs ni 'dzin ma la ste srid pa gsum gyi gnas su chu la yang ni 'du shes grub //
translated: The form aggregate is established in the water, and in the three worlds the perception aggregate is established in the water.

original: me la nges pa nyid du tshor bar 'gyur te rlung la yang ni phung po 'du byed kho na'o //
analyzed: me la nges pa nyid du tshor bar 'gyur te rlung la yang ni phung po 'du byed kho na'o //
translated: The feeling aggregate is definitely in the fire, and in the wind the formation aggregate is only a collection.

original: rnam shes ye shes bsres pa nam mkha' dang bcas rdo rje dag la grub pa nyid de lus 'di la //
analyzed: rnam shes ye shes bsres pa nam mkha' dang bcas rdo rje dag la grub pa nyid de lus 'di la //
translated: Consciousness is mixed with gnosis in the vajra with space, and in this body

original: khams dang phung po la sogs thams cad 'gyur ba dag kyang rngul dang byang chub sems sogs sbyor bas so /
analyzed: khams dang phung po la sogs thams cad 'gyur ba dag kyang rngul dang byang chub sems sogs sbyor bas so /
translated: all the elements, aggregates, and so on are transformed by the union of sweat and bodhicitta.

original: 21 / rna ba rdo rje'i rang bzhin du 'gyur mi yi bdag po sems ni nam mkha' dag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 21 / rna ba rdo rje'i rang bzhin du 'gyur mi yi bdag po sems ni nam mkha' dag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The ear becomes the nature of vajra, and the mind, O King, is the nature of space.

original: sna ni sa yi rang bzhin dag ste de bzhin kho na lce ni me yi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: sna ni sa yi rang bzhin dag ste de bzhin kho na lce ni me yi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The nose is the nature of earth, and the tongue is definitely the nature of fire.

original: mig ni chu yi rang bzhin dag ste srid pa gsum gyi gnas su lus kyang rlung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mig ni chu yi rang bzhin dag ste srid pa gsum gyi gnas su lus kyang rlung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The eyes are the nature of water, and the body is the nature of wind in the three worlds.

original: de ltar rna ba la sogs thams cad yon tan dbang gis 'gyur te ye shes rnam shes sbyor bas so /
analyzed: de ltar rna ba la sogs thams cad yon tan dbang gis 'gyur te ye shes rnam shes sbyor bas so /
translated: Thus, all, the ears and so forth, are transformed by the power of the qualities, by the union of intuition and consciousness.

original: 22 / ser sna ye shes khams la 'gyur te lus mchog @21b dag la nam mkha' la ni zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 22 / ser sna ye shes khams la 'gyur te lus mchog @21b dag la nam mkha' la ni zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
translated: Avarice is transformed into the element of intuition, and in the pure supreme body, Hatred Vajra is in space.

original: rlung la phrag dog rdo rje me la chags pa'i rdo rje rab tu gsal mdzad de bzhin nyid du ni //
analyzed: rlung la phrag dog rdo rje me la chags pa'i rdo rje rab tu gsal mdzad de bzhin nyid du ni //
translated: Jealousy Vajra is in the wind, Passion Vajra is in the fire, and Illuminator Vajra is in the water.

original: chu la dpal ldan nga rgyal rdo rje sa la gti mug rdo rje rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis so //
analyzed: chu la dpal ldan nga rgyal rdo rje sa la gti mug rdo rje rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis so //
translated: In the earth, Glorious Arrogance Vajra is by the power of the qualities.

original: ngag dang lag pa rkang pa bshang lam thams cad rlung me chu dang sa rnams dag las 'byung par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngag dang lag pa rkang pa bshang lam thams cad rlung me chu dang sa rnams dag las 'byung par 'gyur /
translated: All, the speech, hands, feet, and anus, are produced from the wind, fire, water, and earth elements.

original: 23 / thur sel ye shes khams la rnam gsum zhes par 'gyur te srog gi rlung yang stong pa dag la'o //
analyzed: 23 / thur sel ye shes khams la rnam gsum zhes par 'gyur te srog gi rlung yang stong pa dag la'o //
translated: The downward-voiding is transformed into the element of intuition, and the life-force wind is in the empty.

original: rlung gi dbus su mnyam gnas rtse mo can la slar yang gyen rgyu chu la khyab par byed pa nyid //
analyzed: rlung gi dbus su mnyam gnas rtse mo can la slar yang gyen rgyu chu la khyab par byed pa nyid //
translated: In the middle of the wind, the even-staying is in the peak, and again, the upward-moving is in the water, and the pervading is in the earth.

original: sa la klu ste de nas rus sbal rtsangs pa dang ni lha sbyin nor las rgyal ba dag gi rlung //
analyzed: sa la klu ste de nas rus sbal rtsangs pa dang ni lha sbyin nor las rgyal ba dag gi rlung //
translated: The nÄgas are on the earth, and then the tortoise, the lizard, and Devadatta, the conqueror of wealth, are in the wind.

original: bzhi po rlung dang me dag dang ni chu dang sa rnams dag la rim pa yis ni yang dag 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhi po rlung dang me dag dang ni chu dang sa rnams dag la rim pa yis ni yang dag 'gyur /
translated: The four, wind, fire, water, and earth, are in sequence.

original: 24 / gtsug tor stong pa'i khams la 'gyur te lha dang mi rnams kyi ni ye shes khams la gsang pa'o //
analyzed: 24 / gtsug tor stong pa'i khams la 'gyur te lha dang mi rnams kyi ni ye shes khams la gsang pa'o //
translated: The uá¹£á¹‡Ä«á¹£a is in the space element, and the secret is in the gnosis element of gods and humans.

original: snying gi padma rlung gi khams la rab gsal rtse mo can la mgrin pa'i 'khor lo gsal bar ro //
analyzed: snying gi padma rlung gi khams la rab gsal rtse mo can la mgrin pa'i 'khor lo gsal bar ro //
translated: The heart lotus is in the wind element, the very clear one is in the crown, and the throat cakra is clear.

original: chu la smin ma'i nang gi padma nor ni nor gyi 'dab ldan lte ba'i padma sa la'o //
analyzed: chu la smin ma'i nang gi padma nor ni nor gyi 'dab ldan lte ba'i padma sa la'o //
translated: In the water, the lotus in the middle of the brow is the lotus of wealth; the navel lotus is in the earth.

original: rkang pa lag pa dag gi tshigs drug sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung rnams dag la gsum gyi grangs /
analyzed: rkang pa lag pa dag gi tshigs drug sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung rnams dag la gsum gyi grangs /
translated: The six joints of the hands and feet are in the earth, water, fire, and wind elements, in that order.

original: 25 / sa sogs khams lnga dag la rnam gsum yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba rkang pa lag pa dag gi ni //
analyzed: 25 / sa sogs khams lnga dag la rnam gsum yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba rkang pa lag pa dag gi ni //
translated: The five elements, earth, and so on, are in the three places, in dependence on the qualities, in the feet, hands, and so on.

original: mthe bong la sogs sor mo bcu ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i tshigs kyi gzugs dang ldan pa mtha' dag ste //
analyzed: mthe bong la sogs sor mo bcu ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i tshigs kyi gzugs dang ldan pa mtha' dag ste //
translated: The ten fingers and toes are the totality of the form of the joints, which are modified by the three.

original: de dag sen mo'i mthar thug yang dag gzung bya slar yang so rnams de nyid rab tu dbye bas so //
analyzed: de dag sen mo'i mthar thug yang dag gzung bya slar yang so rnams de nyid rab tu dbye bas so //
translated: They are the nails at the ends, and the teeth are their divisions.

original: gzhan yang spu yi mthar ni lus mchog la 'gyur de dang de ni de bzhin du yang khams la'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang spu yi mthar ni lus mchog la 'gyur de dang de ni de bzhin du yang khams la'o /
translated: Moreover, the body is at the end of the pores, and that is so in the elements.

original: 26 / gsang ba gtsug tor lte ba la yang lhan cig skyes pa rgyal ba'i sku ste rang bzhin med rang bzhin //
analyzed: 26 / gsang ba gtsug tor lte ba la yang lhan cig skyes pa rgyal ba'i sku ste rang bzhin med rang bzhin //
translated: The innate body of the Victor is in the secret place, the crown, and the navel, which are without intrinsic nature.

original: snying ga'i chu skyes la ni chos skur 'gyur te mgrin pa'i chu skyes la yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: snying ga'i chu skyes la ni chos skur 'gyur te mgrin pa'i chu skyes la yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: The dharmakÄya is in the heart lotus, and the saá¹ƒbhogakÄya is in the throat lotus.

original: thig le la yang sprul pa'i sku ni yon tan dbang gis lhag pa'i lha ru rim pa dag gis 'gyur //
analyzed: thig le la yang sprul pa'i sku ni yon tan dbang gis lhag pa'i lha ru rim pa dag gis 'gyur //
translated: The nirmÄá¹‡akÄya is in the bindu, which is the supreme deity by virtue of its qualities.

original: snying ga'i 'khor lo mgrin pa'i 'khor lo spyi bo'i padma chos dang longs spyod rdzogs dang dag pa'o /
analyzed: snying ga'i 'khor lo mgrin pa'i 'khor lo spyi bo'i padma chos dang longs spyod rdzogs dang dag pa'o /
translated: The dharmacakra is in the heart cakra, the saá¹ƒbhogacakra is in the throat cakra, and the padma is in the head.

original: 27 / lte ba mgrin pa @22a * //
analyzed: 27 / lte ba mgrin pa @22a * //
translated: navel, throat,

original: dag dang gsang ba spyi bo dang ni snying ga de bzhin gtsug tor dbus su ni //
analyzed: dag dang gsang ba spyi bo dang ni snying ga de bzhin gtsug tor dbus su ni //
translated: secret place, head, and heart, and likewise the top of the head.

original: yum dang gtso bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje rnam pa gsum po dag kyang rim pas 'gyur //
analyzed: yum dang gtso bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje rnam pa gsum po dag kyang rim pas 'gyur //
translated: The three of the mother, the principal, and the body, speech, and mind vajras are in sequence.

original: 'khor lo rin chen mkha' yi padma chu skyes ral gri mchog dang rdo rje dang ldan rigs drug go //
analyzed: 'khor lo rin chen mkha' yi padma chu skyes ral gri mchog dang rdo rje dang ldan rigs drug go //
translated: The six families are endowed with the wheel, jewel, space, lotus, sword, and vajra.

original: de dag steng 'og rtsa gsum rnam gsum lam la gnas pa rnams te nyi zla me yi dbye bas so /
analyzed: de dag steng 'og rtsa gsum rnam gsum lam la gnas pa rnams te nyi zla me yi dbye bas so /
translated: They are the three of the three upper and lower channels, abiding in the path, by the divisions of sun, moon, and fire.

original: 28 / lus la bsam pa rab tu zhugs pa nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam bsam pa'i dbus su lus dag kyang //
analyzed: 28 / lus la bsam pa rab tu zhugs pa nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam bsam pa'i dbus su lus dag kyang //
translated: The body, having entered the thought of the body, is in the middle of the thought, equal in taste like space.

original: rnal 'byor ldan pas shes bya rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khams kyi kha dog la sogs dbye ba ste //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldan pas shes bya rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis khams kyi kha dog la sogs dbye ba ste //
translated: The yogis and yoginis should know the divisions of the colors of the elements and so on by the power of the nature of the qualities.

original: ser po nag po dag dang kha dog dmar po zhes dang dkar po sa rlung me dang chu la'o //
analyzed: ser po nag po dag dang kha dog dmar po zhes dang dkar po sa rlung me dang chu la'o //
translated: Yellow, black, and red colors are for the earth, air, fire, and water elements, and white is for space.

original: ye shes nam mkha' la yang sngon po ljang gur 'gyur te lus dang bsam pa'i rab tu dbye bas so /
analyzed: ye shes nam mkha' la yang sngon po ljang gur 'gyur te lus dang bsam pa'i rab tu dbye bas so /
translated: The gnosis in the sky also becomes blue and green, due to the differences in the body and thoughts.

original: 29 / shes rab thabs ni rus pa sha dang chu dang bcas pa'i khrag dang me dag dang ni gci ba nyid //
analyzed: 29 / shes rab thabs ni rus pa sha dang chu dang bcas pa'i khrag dang me dag dang ni gci ba nyid //
translated: Wisdom and means are the bones, flesh, water, blood, and fire, and the feces.

original: rlung dang bshad pa stong pa khu ba mchog gi lus la dpal ldan rdul dang sems nyid dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rlung dang bshad pa stong pa khu ba mchog gi lus la dpal ldan rdul dang sems nyid dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The wind and the explanation are the empty semen, the supreme body, and the glorious dust, and the mind itself.

original: rna ba sgra sogs gzhan rnams rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis ngag gi rang bzhin la sogs kyang //
analyzed: rna ba sgra sogs gzhan rnams rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis ngag gi rang bzhin la sogs kyang //
translated: The ears, sounds, and so on are the other ones. The nature of the voice, and so on, is also the nature of oneâ€™s own buddha family.

original: de ltar lha mo sangs rgyas dang bcas yul dang yul can rnams ni dkyil 'khor dag la rig par bya /ğŸ”½30 / rtsa rnams stong phrag drug ni nyin mor byed pas bsgyur ba mngal gyi dbus dag tu yang 'phel ba ni //
analyzed: de ltar lha mo sangs rgyas dang bcas yul dang yul can rnams ni dkyil 'khor dag la rig par bya / 30 / rtsa rnams stong phrag drug ni nyin mor byed pas bsgyur ba mngal gyi dbus dag tu yang 'phel ba ni //
translated: Thus the goddesses and the buddhas, the objects and the subjects, are to be known in the maá¹‡á¸ala.ğŸ”½The six thousand channels are transformed by the sun. They increase in the middle of the womb.

original: byas nas lo ni rdzogs pa na yang gtong ste ri bong 'dzin pa nyi ma dag kyang 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: byas nas lo ni rdzogs pa na yang gtong ste ri bong 'dzin pa nyi ma dag kyang 'phel bar byed //
translated: Having done that, they are released when the year is complete, and the rabbit-holder, the sun, also increases.

original: lo ni bcu gnyis dag na nyin byed khams ni 'phel ba gtong ste rang gi lus po dag la'o //
analyzed: lo ni bcu gnyis dag na nyin byed khams ni 'phel ba gtong ste rang gi lus po dag la'o //
translated: The sun, in twelve years, increases its dimension by one-fourth of a degree, in its own body.

original: rtsa ni 'chad pa rab tu skyes nas nyin zhag nyin zhag dag la rim pas zung gi grangs su 'gyur /
analyzed: rtsa ni 'chad pa rab tu skyes nas nyin zhag nyin zhag dag la rim pas zung gi grangs su 'gyur /
translated: The channels, having been produced, are cut off, one by one, day by day, in the order of the pairs.

original: 31 / dpal ldan 'byung ba dang ni dbang po rnams dag bcu ru rab 'gyur las kyi dbang po lnga rnams dang // de tsam lnga ru brjod pa rnams dang yon tan bcas pa dag kyang yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin mchog /'di dag de nyid rnams te lus dang srid pa gsum gyi gnas su 'di ni longs spyod gtso bo dag / phung po lnga yi bdag nyid @22b rnam
analyzed: 31 / dpal ldan 'byung ba dang ni dbang po rnams dag bcu ru rab 'gyur las kyi dbang po lnga rnams dang // de tsam lnga ru brjod pa rnams dang yon tan bcas pa dag kyang yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin mchog /'di dag de nyid rnams te lus dang srid pa gsum gyi gnas su 'di ni longs spyod gtso bo dag / phung po lnga yi bdag nyid @22b rnam
translated: The glorious elements and the organs are ten. The five organs of action and the five organs of knowledge are said to be the five elements. The mind, the intellect, and the great one are the three qualities. These are the principles. The body is the principal enjoyment in the three worlds.

original: gsum srid pa la gnas bdag gi las ni bsags pa dag gi'o /
analyzed: gsum srid pa la gnas bdag gi las ni bsags pa dag gi'o /
translated: The three worlds are the abode of the five aggregates.

original: 32 / sa ni sra ba chu ni gsher ba me yang tsha ba rlung ni yang ba nyid de bug pa ni //
analyzed: 32 / sa ni sra ba chu ni gsher ba me yang tsha ba rlung ni yang ba nyid de bug pa ni //
translated: Earth is solidity, water is fluidity, fire is heat, and air is motion.

original: stong pa dag ste brtan pa'i rus pa 'chi med ri bo mchog dang char pa 'dir ni bdud rtsir 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa dag ste brtan pa'i rus pa 'chi med ri bo mchog dang char pa 'dir ni bdud rtsir 'gyur //
translated: The empty bones are the mountain of immortality, and the rain here is nectar.

original: rdo rje sgra dang gzhu yang bshang ba dag ste chu tshod rnams ni dbugs dang dbugs 'byung zung dag go //
analyzed: rdo rje sgra dang gzhu yang bshang ba dag ste chu tshod rnams ni dbugs dang dbugs 'byung zung dag go //
translated: The vajra sound and the bow are feces, and the hours are pairs of breaths and exhalations.

original: zung rnams dgu brgya nyis 'gyur dag gis 'pho ba gcig ste skar rtsis pa rnams bug pa'i dbye ba'o /
analyzed: zung rnams dgu brgya nyis 'gyur dag gis 'pho ba gcig ste skar rtsis pa rnams bug pa'i dbye ba'o /
translated: Nine hundred pairs doubled is one cycle, and the astrologers are the divisions of the holes.

original: 33 / rgyu skar dag ni so yi phreng ba rjes su nyin zhag chu tshod rnams ni tshigs kyi dbye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 33 / rgyu skar dag ni so yi phreng ba rjes su nyin zhag chu tshod rnams ni tshigs kyi dbye bar 'gyur //
translated: The lunar mansions are the garland of teeth, and the days and hours are the divisions of the joints.

original: rtsa rnams chu bo rgyu ma sprin te ri bong can gyi cha gzhan khams rnams gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa rnams chu bo rgyu ma sprin te ri bong can gyi cha gzhan khams rnams gnyis kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The channels are the rivers, the intestines are the clouds, and the other parts of the moon are the nature of the two elements.

original: spu dang shig dang khu ba srin bu'i rigs dang bcas pa rnams ni 'byung po skye gnas rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: spu dang shig dang khu ba srin bu'i rigs dang bcas pa rnams ni 'byung po skye gnas rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The hair, the lice, and the semen with the worms are the four types of birth of the bhÅ«tas.

original: dga' ba la sogs mthe bong tshigs rnams spyi bo'i padma lte ba'i padma dag kyang nus pa'o /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs mthe bong tshigs rnams spyi bo'i padma lte ba'i padma dag kyang nus pa'o /
translated: The joy and so on are the joints of the thumb, and the lotus of the crown and the navel are the capabilities.

original: 34 / tshangs pa'i yul sa mtho ris 'jig rten lag mchog rkang pa dag ni mi yul sa 'og 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 34 / tshangs pa'i yul sa mtho ris 'jig rten lag mchog rkang pa dag ni mi yul sa 'og 'jig rten no //
translated: The highest heaven is the region of Brahma, the middle region is the world of men, and the lowest region is the nether world.

original: chu gter gling dang ri bo rnams ni gsher dang 'jam pa sra ba gsum gyi rang bzhin khams rnams so //
analyzed: chu gter gling dang ri bo rnams ni gsher dang 'jam pa sra ba gsum gyi rang bzhin khams rnams so //
translated: The oceans, continents, mountains, and so forth are the three natures of the elements, wet, soft, and hard.

original: lan tshva'i chu gter gci ba 'di dag rnams kyi me rlung dkyil 'khor rgyal po khrag dang pags pa'o //
analyzed: lan tshva'i chu gter gci ba 'di dag rnams kyi me rlung dkyil 'khor rgyal po khrag dang pags pa'o //
translated: The oceans of salt water are urine, the oceans of milk are blood, and the oceans of water are skin.

original: skra rnams grub pa mtha' dag srid pa gsum gyi gnas su du ma'i dbye ba  ngag gis grub pa'o /ğŸ”½35 / snying mgrin lte ba'i padma dag la rdo rje nyi ma rtse mo can rnams rab 'phro rim pa yis //
analyzed: skra rnams grub pa mtha' dag srid pa gsum gyi gnas su du ma'i dbye ba  ngag gis grub pa'o / 35 / snying mgrin lte ba'i padma dag la rdo rje nyi ma rtse mo can rnams rab 'phro rim pa yis //
translated: The hair is the creation of all things, the creation of speech in the three worlds, with many divisions.ğŸ”½The lotuses of the heart, throat, and navel are the sun, moon, and fire, with their peaks, spreading in stages.

original: gzhu yi rnam pa zlum po dang ni nyin bzhin sreg byed chu gter zur gyi thab khung dag la yang //
analyzed: gzhu yi rnam pa zlum po dang ni nyin bzhin sreg byed chu gter zur gyi thab khung dag la yang //
translated: The round shape of the bow is the sun, and the fire is the ocean of the corners of the hearth.

original: de dag gang na me gzhan dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes gzugs ni mun pa dag gi mthar //
analyzed: de dag gang na me gzhan dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes gzugs ni mun pa dag gi mthar //
translated: In them, the other fire, the stainless light, the form of wisdom, is at the end of the darkness.

original: gang zhig nyi ma glog gis mi gdung ri bong 'dzin pa gza' dang skar ma la sogs med pa na'o /
analyzed: gang zhig nyi ma glog gis mi gdung ri bong 'dzin pa gza' dang skar ma la sogs med pa na'o /
translated: When the sun is not tormented by the planets, the moon is not seized by RÄhu, and the stars and so forth are not absent.

original: 36 / gza' ni snying ga'i padma la ste rab tu gsal byas chu tshod drug cu lte ba'i padma la //
analyzed: 36 / gza' ni snying ga'i padma la ste rab tu gsal byas chu tshod drug cu lte ba'i padma la //
translated: The planets are in the lotus of the heart, and the sixty nÄá¸Ä«s are in the navel lotus.

original: smin ma'i dbus su nyin zhag rkang pa ma nu slar yang mi bdag longs spyod 'khor lor skar ma'o //
analyzed: smin ma'i dbus su nyin zhag rkang pa ma nu slar yang mi bdag longs spyod 'khor lor skar ma'o //
translated: The day and night are in the middle of the eyebrows, and the lunar mansions are in the navel cakra of the king of men.

original: slar yang lte ba'i padmar rgyu skar rnams kyi chu tshod rnal 'byor ldan pa dag gis rig par bya //
analyzed: slar yang lte ba'i padmar rgyu skar rnams kyi chu tshod rnal 'byor ldan pa dag gis rig par bya //
translated: Again, the yogÄ« should know that the nÄá¸Ä«s are in the navel cakra.

original: chu tshod chu srang gsal bar mtha' dag lus la lag pa @23a * //
analyzed: chu tshod chu srang gsal bar mtha' dag lus la lag pa @23a * //
translated: The nÄá¸Ä«s and the hours are clearly in the body, in the joints of the hands,

original: rkang pa la sogs dag gi tshigs la'o /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs dag gi tshigs la'o /
translated: feet, and so on.

original: 37 / lte ba'i chu skyes nyi ma'i 'dab ma dag la 'khor te mchog gi cha ni 'pho ba rim pas so //
analyzed: 37 / lte ba'i chu skyes nyi ma'i 'dab ma dag la 'khor te mchog gi cha ni 'pho ba rim pas so //
translated: The sun moves through the petals of the navel lotus, and the supreme part moves through the stages.

original: srog zung dgu brgya nyis 'gyur dag gis 'pho bar 'gyur te dus sbyor ka rka ta nas mi yi dbang //
analyzed: srog zung dgu brgya nyis 'gyur dag gis 'pho bar 'gyur te dus sbyor ka rka ta nas mi yi dbang //
translated: The prÄá¹‡a moves through the nine hundred and seventy-two double nÄá¸Ä«s.

original: dus sbyor gang la nyi ma gnas pas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba de la de ni rig par bya //
analyzed: dus sbyor gang la nyi ma gnas pas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba de la de ni rig par bya //
translated: The day and night revolutions of the sun in the lunar mansions are to be known as the revolutions of the sun in the lunar mansions.

original: dus sbyor tshad dang nor dang bu lon mnyam pa dag kyang bgrod pa g-yas dang g-yon la shes par bya /
analyzed: dus sbyor tshad dang nor dang bu lon mnyam pa dag kyang bgrod pa g-yas dang g-yon la shes par bya /
translated: The equinoctial points, the solstices, and the lunar mansions of the ecliptic are to be known as the right and left revolutions.

original: 38 / re re padma'i 'dab ma dag la rab tu 'bab ste nub tu 'dzin ma dang ni byang du chu //
analyzed: 38 / re re padma'i 'dab ma dag la rab tu 'bab ste nub tu 'dzin ma dang ni byang du chu //
translated: Each one falls on the petals of the lotus. In the west is the petal of water, and in the north is the petal of earth.

original: lho ru me dang shar du rlung ni rab tu 'bab ste 'dab ma'i dbus dag tu yang stong pa'o //
analyzed: lho ru me dang shar du rlung ni rab tu 'bab ste 'dab ma'i dbus dag tu yang stong pa'o //
translated: In the south is the petal of fire, and in the east is the petal of wind. In the middle of the petals is the petal of space.

original: dbye ba lnga yis 'pho bar 'gyur te mnyam pa rab tu 'bab pa dman pa'i dbugs ni drug cu'o //
analyzed: dbye ba lnga yis 'pho bar 'gyur te mnyam pa rab tu 'bab pa dman pa'i dbugs ni drug cu'o //
translated: The revolutions are fivefold. The revolutions of the equal, the superior, and the inferior breaths are sixty.

original: de ltar 'pho ba'i dbye pa rnams ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su dus sbyor dbye ba dag gis 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba'i dbye pa rnams ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su dus sbyor dbye ba dag gis 'gyur /
translated: Thus the divisions of the revolutions are by the divisions of the lunar mansions in each day and night.

original: 39 / stong pa la sogs de nyid lnga ni nges par byang du rab 'bab sa la sogs pa g-yas su'o //
analyzed: 39 / stong pa la sogs de nyid lnga ni nges par byang du rab 'bab sa la sogs pa g-yas su'o //
translated: The five realities of space and so on definitely fall on the left, and earth and so on fall on the right.

original: sgra gcan dus me zla ba nyi ma dag dang gza' lag sa skyes lha min blon po bla ma dang // mjug rings spen pa 'di bcu dag ni nam mkha' la sogs dkyil 'khor rnams la bdag po zhing can no //
analyzed: sgra gcan dus me zla ba nyi ma dag dang gza' lag sa skyes lha min blon po bla ma dang // mjug rings spen pa 'di bcu dag ni nam mkha' la sogs dkyil 'khor rnams la bdag po zhing can no //
translated: RÄhu, KÄlÄgni, Candra, SÅ«rya, Budha, Bá¹›haspati, Åšukra, Åšani, and Ketu are the lords of the maá¹‡á¸alas of the sky, etc., and are the lords of the fields.

original: zla ba drug la zla ba dbang phyug tu 'gyur byang dag tu ste mi bdag lho ru nyi ma'o /
analyzed: zla ba drug la zla ba dbang phyug tu 'gyur byang dag tu ste mi bdag lho ru nyi ma'o /
translated: In the north, Candra is the lord of the six months, and in the south, SÅ«rya is the lord.

original: 40 / de steng snying ga'i phyogs su padma nor gyi 'dab ma dag la rtsa yi 'khor lo yang dag gnas //
analyzed: 40 / de steng snying ga'i phyogs su padma nor gyi 'dab ma dag la rtsa yi 'khor lo yang dag gnas //
translated: Above them, in the region of the heart, is the cakra of the nÄá¸Ä«s, situated on the petals of the lotus of wealth.

original: srog la sogs pa rlung gi tshogs te zla ba nyi ma me rnams g-yon dang g-yas dang dbus su'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa rlung gi tshogs te zla ba nyi ma me rnams g-yon dang g-yas dang dbus su'o //
translated: The groups of prÄá¹‡a and so on, the winds, are on the left, right, and in the middle, respectively.

original: g-yon du rtsa ni ri bong mtshan ma 'bab ste nges par dkar po g-yas su dmar po nyi ma'o //
analyzed: g-yon du rtsa ni ri bong mtshan ma 'bab ste nges par dkar po g-yas su dmar po nyi ma'o //
translated: On the left, the nÄá¸Ä« of the rabbit-marked moon flows, certainly white; on the right, the red one of the sun.

original: dbus su dus me'i gzugs ni rab tu 'bab ste mnyam pa dag la dman pa'i dbugs ni drug cu'o /
analyzed: dbus su dus me'i gzugs ni rab tu 'bab ste mnyam pa dag la dman pa'i dbugs ni drug cu'o /
translated: In the middle, the form of KÄlÄgni flows, and the breaths are equal in number, sixty.

original: 41 / srog dang thur sel mnyam gnas padma nor gyi 'dab ma dag la rlung ni gyen du rgyu ba dang // khyab byed klu dang rus sbal dag dang rtsangs pa'i rlung dang lha sbyin dang ni nor las rgyal zhes pa //
analyzed: 41 / srog dang thur sel mnyam gnas padma nor gyi 'dab ma dag la rlung ni gyen du rgyu ba dang // khyab byed klu dang rus sbal dag dang rtsangs pa'i rlung dang lha sbyin dang ni nor las rgyal zhes pa //
translated: The winds that move upward in the lotus of the navel, which has sixty-four petals, are life, downward-voiding, and the winds called upward-moving, pervading, snake, tortoise, lizard, Devadatta, and Vasuki.

original: rlung ni rnam pa bcu po 'di rnams lte ba'i 'khor lo la ni las kyi dbye bas yang dag gnas //
analyzed: rlung ni rnam pa bcu po 'di rnams lte ba'i 'khor lo la ni las kyi dbye bas yang dag gnas //
translated: These ten winds are in the navel chakra, abiding by their functions.

original: dung can mtha' yang ai da la sogs rang gi snying ga'i padma rtsa yi 'khor lo mtha' dag go /
analyzed: dung can mtha' yang ai da la sogs rang gi snying ga'i padma rtsa yi 'khor lo mtha' dag go /
translated: The conch-shell channel ends at the heart lotus, the end of all the channel chakras.

original: 42 / @23b srog ni nyi ma zla ba'i lam na gnas pa dag kyang srog byed bza' dang btung ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: 42 / @23b srog ni nyi ma zla ba'i lam na gnas pa dag kyang srog byed bza' dang btung ba ma lus pa //
translated: The life wind, which moves in the paths of the sun and moon, is the life-force of all food and drink.

original: de dag thur sel gyis ni 'og tu 'dren te mtha' dag ro mnyam lus la mnyam gnas dag gis 'thob //
analyzed: de dag thur sel gyis ni 'og tu 'dren te mtha' dag ro mnyam lus la mnyam gnas dag gis 'thob //
translated: The downward-voiding wind draws it downward, and the upward-moving wind causes it to be evenly distributed throughout the body.

original: lus la gyen rgyus g-yo bar byed de kha dang lag pa rkang pa rnams kyi glu dang zlos gar byed //
analyzed: lus la gyen rgyus g-yo bar byed de kha dang lag pa rkang pa rnams kyi glu dang zlos gar byed //
translated: The upward-moving wind causes the body to move, and the bodyâ€™s singing and dancing are the activity of the winds in the mouth, arms, and legs.

original: khyab byed kyis ni nang dag byed de rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis lus 'di 'jig pa de lta nyid /
analyzed: khyab byed kyis ni nang dag byed de rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis lus 'di 'jig pa de lta nyid /
translated: The pervading wind purifies the inside, because of the power of the nature qualities, this body is destroyed just like that.

original: 43 / klu yang sgregs pa nyid de gsal bar lag pa rkang pa bskum pa dag ni rus sbal rlung gis so //
analyzed: 43 / klu yang sgregs pa nyid de gsal bar lag pa rkang pa bskum pa dag ni rus sbal rlung gis so //
translated: The snake wind causes yawning, and the tortoise wind causes the clear contraction of the hands and feet.

original: khro dang g-yeng ba mtha' dag de ni rtsangs pa'i rlung dag gis te glal  ba dag kyang lha sbyin gyis //
analyzed: khro dang g-yeng ba mtha' dag de ni rtsangs pa'i rlung dag gis te glal  ba dag kyang lha sbyin gyis //
translated: The lizard wind causes all anger and distraction, and the god-given wind causes yawning.

original: lus ni lnga pa nyid gyur gtong bar mi byed mi yi bdag po rlung gcig nor las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: lus ni lnga pa nyid gyur gtong bar mi byed mi yi bdag po rlung gcig nor las rgyal ba'o //
translated: The fifth wind does not cause the body to be abandoned, O lord of men, the wind is victorious over wealth.

original: de ltar srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis gnas yon tan dag ni gtong mi byed /
analyzed: de ltar srog la sogs pa'i rlung rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis gnas yon tan dag ni gtong mi byed /
translated: Thus all the life-sustaining winds do not abandon the natural abodes and qualities.

original: 44 / dmar ser phra mo dag kyang ai da la sogs rnam gsum lam bgrod snar ma dang ni lag ldan lce //
analyzed: 44 / dmar ser phra mo dag kyang ai da la sogs rnam gsum lam bgrod snar ma dang ni lag ldan lce //
translated: The subtle reddish wind travels the three paths of ida and so forth, the mouth, the hand,

original: drug pa rgyal dang ri yang rgyal ba nor dang dgu pa aa li bu sha dpal ldan ku h'a'o //
analyzed: drug pa rgyal dang ri yang rgyal ba nor dang dgu pa aa li bu sha dpal ldan ku h'a'o //
translated: the sixth, the victorious, the mountain victor, wealth, and the ninth, the son of Ali, glorious Kuha.

original: phyogs kyi grangs ni dung can ma gang mi yi bdag po byang chub sa bon bde ba'i mthar zag byed //
analyzed: phyogs kyi grangs ni dung can ma gang mi yi bdag po byang chub sa bon bde ba'i mthar zag byed //
translated: The number of directions is the number of the conch-shell channel, which is the lord of men, the seed of enlightenment, the end of bliss, and the maker of the passage.

original: dpal ldan rtsa yi 'khor lo 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur te tshigs kyi dbye ba du mas so /
analyzed: dpal ldan rtsa yi 'khor lo 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'gyur te tshigs kyi dbye ba du mas so /
translated: This glorious channel-wheel becomes manifold by the division of the spokes.

original: 45 / dbang po me dang gshin rje lha min chur bcas rlung dang gnod sbyin dang ni drag po dag gi dbus //
analyzed: 45 / dbang po me dang gshin rje lha min chur bcas rlung dang gnod sbyin dang ni drag po dag gi dbus //
translated: The spokes are the directions of the elements, fire, Yama, the demigods, water, wind, the yakshas, and Rudra.

original: gnas ni 'di dag rnams su de yi rang bzhin brten zhing nus pa nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor bar byed //
analyzed: gnas ni 'di dag rnams su de yi rang bzhin brten zhing nus pa nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor bar byed //
translated: In these directions, the nature of the spokes is supported, and the power moves by day and night.

original: de yi steng gi mgrin pa'i phyogs su gza' yi tshogs dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar 'khor lo yang dag gnas //
analyzed: de yi steng gi mgrin pa'i phyogs su gza' yi tshogs dang bcas pa'i rgyu skar 'khor lo yang dag gnas //
translated: Above that, in the throat region, the wheel of the lunar mansions with the planets is situated.ğŸ”½The glorious forehead, the abode of Brahma, is the white drop surrounded by the vowels.

original: tshangs pa'i yul sa dpal ldan  dbral ba dag gnas dbyangs kyis yongs su bskor ba'i thig le dkar po zag 46 / rtsa bar sa ste g-yon du chu dang g-yas su bsreg za dag ni rab tu 'bab ste steng du rlung //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i yul sa dpal ldan  dbral ba dag gnas dbyangs kyis yongs su bskor ba'i thig le dkar po zag 46 / rtsa bar sa ste g-yon du chu dang g-yas su bsreg za dag ni rab tu 'bab ste steng du rlung //
translated: The root is earth, the left is water, the right is fire, and above is wind.

original: gnyis kyi dbus su nam mkha' dang ni mnyam pa rab tu 'bab ste sna bug dag las rim pas so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dbus su nam mkha' dang ni mnyam pa rab tu 'bab ste sna bug dag las rim pas so //
translated: In the middle of the two, it falls evenly, from the nostrils, in sequence.

original: 'di dag rnams ni 'bugs te nus pa mchog gi gnas dang bcu gnyis mtha' dang cha yi mtha' ru 'gro //ğŸ”½zhing la sogs pa lag pa rkang pa lag pad sbyar bdag la chen @24a * //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni 'bugs te nus pa mchog gi gnas dang bcu gnyis mtha' dang cha yi mtha' ru 'gro // zhing la sogs pa lag pa rkang pa lag pad sbyar bdag la chen @24a * //
translated: These are the twelve and the end of the parts, going to the supreme place of the power of the opening.

original: po'i mthar thug mtha' dag go /
analyzed: po'i mthar thug mtha' dag go /
translated: The field and so on, the hands and feet, the lotus of the hands, the great end of the self, the end of all.

original: 47 /'khor lo can ni rang gi lus la rdo rje can te lha mchog bdag rnams yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog / rigs ldan dag ni yang dag ye shes glang po rta dang shing rta mngag gzhug 'phags pa'i tshad med rnams //
analyzed: 47 /'khor lo can ni rang gi lus la rdo rje can te lha mchog bdag rnams yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog / rigs ldan dag ni yang dag ye shes glang po rta dang shing rta mngag gzhug 'phags pa'i tshad med rnams //
translated: The cakra-holder, the vajra-holder in one's own body, the supreme gods, the self, the cessation of the twelve limbs, the noble ones, the immeasurables, the elephants, horses, and chariots of true pristine consciousness.

original: drag po rang rgyal ming can dag tu 'gyur te ha nu m'an ni nyan thos gdug pa kla klo'i dbang //
analyzed: drag po rang rgyal ming can dag tu 'gyur te ha nu m'an ni nyan thos gdug pa kla klo'i dbang //
translated: The powerful ones become the names of the pratyekabuddhas, the Å›rÄvakas are the evil mlecchas, the HanumÄn.

original: srog chags rnams kyi sdig pa dag ste gang zhig byed pa'i blo gros sdug bsngal sbyin byed mi dge'i lam /
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi sdig pa dag ste gang zhig byed pa'i blo gros sdug bsngal sbyin byed mi dge'i lam /
translated: The sins of beings, which give rise to the mind that creates suffering, are the paths of nonvirtue.

original: 48 / rta la gnas pa ma rig pa ste lha min dpung rnams mtha' dag bdud kyi phyogs ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: 48 / rta la gnas pa ma rig pa ste lha min dpung rnams mtha' dag bdud kyi phyogs ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The horse is ignorance, the whole army of the Titans is the fourfold group of the Maras.

original: de yi g-yul la sdud pa srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa dag ste dpal ldan rgyal ba thar pa'i lam //
analyzed: de yi g-yul la sdud pa srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa dag ste dpal ldan rgyal ba thar pa'i lam //
translated: The battle is the round of life, the victory is the conquest of the fear of life, the path of salvation is the glorious Conqueror.

original: kee la shar ni chos dag sbyin pa srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog yin te sa ni rdzas kyis gang ba yang //
analyzed: kee la shar ni chos dag sbyin pa srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog yin te sa ni rdzas kyis gang ba yang //
translated: The Kailasa is the gift of the Dharma, the conquest of the fear of life is the earth filled with wealth.

original: skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma'i sras po tshangs dang lha dbang dag ni rgyab dang mdun du gang /
analyzed: skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma'i sras po tshangs dang lha dbang dag ni rgyab dang mdun du gang /
translated: The three worlds are the son of the lord of men, Brahma and Indra are the front and the rear.

original: 49 /'jam dpal 'jig rten mgon po srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba dpal ldan rdul dang byang chub sems //
analyzed: 49 /'jam dpal 'jig rten mgon po srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba dpal ldan rdul dang byang chub sems //
translated: Manjusri, the lord of the world, is the glorious conqueror of the three worlds, the dust and the Bodhisattva.

original: rgyab tu sa gzhi dag la tshangs pa la sogs sna tshogs rigs rnams du ma'i sangs rgyas rnam dag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu sa gzhi dag la tshangs pa la sogs sna tshogs rigs rnams du ma'i sangs rgyas rnam dag pa'o //
translated: The rear is the earth, the various Brahmas and so on are the many different pure Buddhas.

original: de ltar kla klo dbang po'i 'khrug par 'gyur te nges par lus can rnams kyi lus kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: de ltar kla klo dbang po'i 'khrug par 'gyur te nges par lus can rnams kyi lus kyi dbus su'o //
translated: Thus the battle of the barbarian kings is in the body of the body-possessors, in the middle of the body.

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyang phyi rol tu ni nges par mkha'i yul du kla klo 'khrug ste 'khrug pa min /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyang phyi rol tu ni nges par mkha'i yul du kla klo 'khrug ste 'khrug pa min /
translated: The illusory form is not definitely external, in the field of space, a barbarian war.

original: 50 / dus kyi lo ni me grangs lo yi nyin zhag tshogs kyis bsgyur te rigs drug bgrod pa'i yan lag gis //
analyzed: 50 / dus kyi lo ni me grangs lo yi nyin zhag tshogs kyis bsgyur te rigs drug bgrod pa'i yan lag gis //
translated: The year of the age is converted by the sum of the days of the year, divided by six,

original: zla ba'i dbye bas sum cu drug ste ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro ni rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi rigs //
analyzed: zla ba'i dbye bas sum cu drug ste ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro ni rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi rigs //
translated: and by the thirty-six divisions of the moon, the converted sign is the type of the yoginis.

original: gza' yis bcad pas thob pa rab tu gsal zhing nges par dus kyi 'khor lo dag gi lha rnams so //
analyzed: gza' yis bcad pas thob pa rab tu gsal zhing nges par dus kyi 'khor lo dag gi lha rnams so //
translated: The result of the division by the planets is the clear and definite deities of the wheel of time.ğŸ”½The deities and goddesses of the divisions by the directions are the ones who will be expressed, O king.ğŸ”½The three kinds of magical nets also arise from the limbs of the day, the right nostril, the Veda,

original: phyogs kyis bcang  pa dag gi lha dang lha mo rnams kyis mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro mi yi bdag 51 / sgyu 'phrul dra ba rnam pa gsum yang nyin zhag yan lag las 'gyur yang dag bug par rig byed dang // slar yang 'byung ba rgya mtsho me dang chu gter gyis 'gyur dpal ldan 'dus pa dus kyi dbye ba ni //
analyzed: phyogs kyis bcang  pa dag gi lha dang lha mo rnams kyis mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro mi yi bdag 51 / sgyu 'phrul dra ba rnam pa gsum yang nyin zhag yan lag las 'gyur yang dag bug par rig byed dang // slar yang 'byung ba rgya mtsho me dang chu gter gyis 'gyur dpal ldan 'dus pa dus kyi dbye ba ni //
translated: and again from the ocean of the elements, the treasure of fire and water, the glorious assembly, the division of time.

original: de nyid ces bya gzhan yang drug gis rnam dman @24b de dag phyed kyi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya gzhan yang drug gis rnam dman @24b de dag phyed kyi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
translated: The â€œrealâ€ ones are six less than that, divided into two halves.

original: slar yang bsres pa dag ni dbye ba gnyis te bcu gsum bcu dgu dang ni bug pa de nyid bcas /
analyzed: slar yang bsres pa dag ni dbye ba gnyis te bcu gsum bcu dgu dang ni bug pa de nyid bcas /
translated: Again, the mixed ones are two divisions, thirteen and nineteen, together with the â€œrealâ€ one.

original: 52 / zla ba'i cha shas su nges nyin zhag tshogs las gza' yi cha yis thob pa gang dag nyin zhag drug / de dag rdo rje can gyi phyag rgya drug ste gzhan pa'i nyin zhag tshogs ni sku gsung thugs kyi rgya //
analyzed: 52 / zla ba'i cha shas su nges nyin zhag tshogs las gza' yi cha yis thob pa gang dag nyin zhag drug / de dag rdo rje can gyi phyag rgya drug ste gzhan pa'i nyin zhag tshogs ni sku gsung thugs kyi rgya //
translated: Those which are obtained by the parts of the planets from the collection of days, which are ascertained as parts of the moon, are the six seals of the Vajra Holder, and the collection of other days is the seal of body, speech, and mind.

original: shes rab sku la dus sbyor gsum rnams nges par gsal byas rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor rgyud la'o //
analyzed: shes rab sku la dus sbyor gsum rnams nges par gsal byas rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor rgyud la'o //
translated: The three junctures are definitely clarified in the wisdom body, for the yoginÄ«s and the Yoga Tantra.

original: nus ma khro bo rnams ni rim pas bcu ru rab tu 'gyur te lnga ni sangs rgyas lha mo rnams /
analyzed: nus ma khro bo rnams ni rim pas bcu ru rab tu 'gyur te lnga ni sangs rgyas lha mo rnams /
translated: The Ká¹›iá¹£á¹‡as and Åšaktis become ten in order, and the five are the Buddhas and goddesses.

original: 53 / gzugs sogs mig la sogs pa drug ste slar yang mi yi bdag po lha yi tshogs ni drug gnyis so //
analyzed: 53 / gzugs sogs mig la sogs pa drug ste slar yang mi yi bdag po lha yi tshogs ni drug gnyis so //
translated: The six are the six beginning with the eye, and again, O King, the two groups of six are the gods.

original: rnal 'byor ma dang klu dang gtum mo brgyad ces bya ste srid pa 'di dag thams cad nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang klu dang gtum mo brgyad ces bya ste srid pa 'di dag thams cad nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoginis, nagas, and eight fierce women are all doubled.

original: 'di dag dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo bzhi lhag brgya ste de yi phyed kyang khams gsum dag tu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo bzhi lhag brgya ste de yi phyed kyang khams gsum dag tu'o //
translated: These are the one hundred and four glorious Kalpas, half of which are in the three realms.

original: nyi ma'i cha las nyin zhag so sor chu tshod 'byung ba gang zhig zla ba'i dbus su drug cu ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i cha las nyin zhag so sor chu tshod 'byung ba gang zhig zla ba'i dbus su drug cu ste /
translated: From the parts of the sun, the hours arise individually. In the center of the moon, there are sixty.

original: 54 / de dag mtha' dag rnal 'byor ma ste srid pa gsum gyi gnas su dus sbyor bsres pa'o nyis 'gyur rnams //
analyzed: 54 / de dag mtha' dag rnal 'byor ma ste srid pa gsum gyi gnas su dus sbyor bsres pa'o nyis 'gyur rnams //
translated: All of them are yoginis, doubled in the abodes of the three existences, mixed with the ayanas.

original: nyi ma'i cha las nyin zhag rab phye nyis 'gyur dag kyang gang zhig 'dir ni rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs //
analyzed: nyi ma'i cha las nyin zhag rab phye nyis 'gyur dag kyang gang zhig 'dir ni rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs //
translated: From the parts of the sun, the days are differentiated, doubled, and also the assembly of yoginis here.

original: mtha' dag bsdus par gyur pa mngon brjod rnams dang bcas pa dag ni nyi ma'i nyin zhag sum 'gyur 'gyur //
analyzed: mtha' dag bsdus par gyur pa mngon brjod rnams dang bcas pa dag ni nyi ma'i nyin zhag sum 'gyur 'gyur //
translated: All of them are included, together with the manifest states, three times the solar days.

original: nyi ma lo yi rab dbyer 'gyur te ri bong 'dzin pa la ni mtha' dag phyogs kyi dbye ba'o /
analyzed: nyi ma lo yi rab dbyer 'gyur te ri bong 'dzin pa la ni mtha' dag phyogs kyi dbye ba'o /
translated: The sun becomes the divisions of the year, and the moon is the totality of the directions.

original: 55 / de ltar dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyud la mkha' lag mi bdag rnams te lha dang lha mo rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: 55 / de ltar dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyud la mkha' lag mi bdag rnams te lha dang lha mo rnams kyi ni //
translated: In this way, the first Buddha, the lord of the body, is in the body of the king of the sky, that is, of the gods and goddesses.

original: shes rab thabs dag mtshan mo nyin mor 'gyur ba mnyam pa'i cha ste mtshan mo phyed dang nyin phyed la'o //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dag mtshan mo nyin mor 'gyur ba mnyam pa'i cha ste mtshan mo phyed dang nyin phyed la'o //
translated: The equal parts, night and day, are the wisdom and means, in the night and day, in the half-night and half-day.

original: gang gis rang gi lus la nyin mtshan dus dang zla ba 'pho ba'i dbye ba dag gis shes gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gis rang gi lus la nyin mtshan dus dang zla ba 'pho ba'i dbye ba dag gis shes gyur pa //
translated: He who knows his body by the divisions of day and night, of the passage of the moon,

original: de ni dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms sangs rgyas skye ba 'di nyid dag la'o /
analyzed: de ni dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms sangs rgyas skye ba 'di nyid dag la'o /
translated: he is the glorious MaÃ±juvajra, the Buddha who destroys the fear of existence, in this very life.

original: 56 / sum cu'i cha yis de las thob pa gsum gyis bsgyur ba nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i lha rnams dang // phyi rol gyi ni phyag rgya drug ste slar yang de las 'khor lo @25a * //
analyzed: 56 / sum cu'i cha yis de las thob pa gsum gyis bsgyur ba nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i lha rnams dang // phyi rol gyi ni phyag rgya drug ste slar yang de las 'khor lo @25a * //
translated: The thirty parts of that, multiplied by three, are the deities of the KÄlacakra, and the six external seals.

original: dag gi rtsa rnams de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: dag gi rtsa rnams de bzhin nyid //
translated: Again, the channels of the cakras are just so.

original: gtsug tor la ni chu gter snying gar brgyad de spyi bor mi bdag mgrin pa la yang so yi grangs //
analyzed: gtsug tor la ni chu gter snying gar brgyad de spyi bor mi bdag mgrin pa la yang so yi grangs //
translated: In the uá¹£á¹‡Ä«á¹£a, there are eight lotuses; in the heart, there are eight; in the head, there are thirty-two; and in the throat, there are forty.

original: lte bar brgyad ni brgyad kyis bsgyur ba dag ste nyis 'gyur mi bdag gsang pa'i dbus su rab tu grags /
analyzed: lte bar brgyad ni brgyad kyis bsgyur ba dag ste nyis 'gyur mi bdag gsang pa'i dbus su rab tu grags /
translated: Eight at the navel, multiplied by eight, are sixteen, in the middle of the secret of the lord of men.

original: 57 / rtsa drug rnams ni 'khor lo 'gog cing bcu ni yul rnams 'phrog pa 'dus pa dag gi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: 57 / rtsa drug rnams ni 'khor lo 'gog cing bcu ni yul rnams 'phrog pa 'dus pa dag gi rang bzhin te //
translated: Six channels block the cakras, and ten steal the objects of the aggregates.

original: slar yang yang nas yang du nyis 'gyur bsgyur ba dag kyang bad kan rlung dang mkhris pa dag gi cha //
analyzed: slar yang yang nas yang du nyis 'gyur bsgyur ba dag kyang bad kan rlung dang mkhris pa dag gi cha //
translated: Again and again, doubled, they are the portions of phlegm, wind, and bile.

original: 'di dag nges par 'chi ba ster byed bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis tshe dang nang med dag kyang ster //
analyzed: 'di dag nges par 'chi ba ster byed bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis tshe dang nang med dag kyang ster //
translated: These are the givers of certain death, but by the power of the guruâ€™s initiation, they also give immortality.

original: 'khor lo drug la dus kyi rtsa rnams 'chi ba'i 'jigs 'phrog rnal 'byor rnams kyi 'di la ngo mtshar med /
analyzed: 'khor lo drug la dus kyi rtsa rnams 'chi ba'i 'jigs 'phrog rnal 'byor rnams kyi 'di la ngo mtshar med /
translated: In the six cakras, the channels of time steal the fear of death. This is not surprising for yogins.

original: 58 / gtsug tor la ni chu gter dpral bar rgya mtshos bsnun pa'i dus rnams bad kan khams ni rab 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: 58 / gtsug tor la ni chu gter dpral bar rgya mtshos bsnun pa'i dus rnams bad kan khams ni rab 'khrug pa'o //
translated: In the uá¹£á¹‡Ä«á¹£a, the water treasure, and in the forehead, the time of the oceanâ€™s embrace, the phlegm element is disturbed.

original: mgrin pa so dang snying ga'i chu skyes dag la mig gis bsgyur ba'i dus rnams mkhris pa'i khams rab 'khrug / lte ba gsang ba dag la chu gter drug cu mi bdag dag kyang de bzhin rlung gi khams rab 'khrug / gsang bar gzhan ni phyogs dang drug
