analyzed: mgrin pa so dang snying ga'i chu skyes dag la mig gis bsgyur ba'i dus rnams mkhris pa'i khams rab 'khrug / lte ba gsang ba dag la chu gter drug cu mi bdag dag kyang de bzhin rlung gi khams rab 'khrug / gsang bar gzhan ni phyogs dang drug
translated: The navel and the secret place, the sixty water treasures and the lords of men, likewise greatly disturb the wind element.

original: kyang rab tu gsal byas nges par 'dus pa dag ste 'gog pa'o /
analyzed: kyang rab tu gsal byas nges par 'dus pa dag ste 'gog pa'o /
translated: The other six directions in the secret place are well illuminated and are certainly the gathering and cessation.

original: 59 / drug gi rtsa ni 'khor lo 'gog pa zla nyi me yi dbye bas rnam gsum lam la gnas pa gang //
analyzed: 59 / drug gi rtsa ni 'khor lo 'gog pa zla nyi me yi dbye bas rnam gsum lam la gnas pa gang //
translated: The three channels of the six wheels are the three paths of the sun, moon, and fire, which are the cessation of the wheels.

original: srog chags rnams la 'chi ba star  ba de ni bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis lus la bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la 'chi ba star  ba de ni bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis lus la bsrung bar bya //
translated: The one who bestows death upon all living beings is to be protected in the body by the power of the guru's certainty.

original: drug la gal te srog ni rab zhugs gyur na de tshe mi rnams kyi ni 'chi pa 'joms par nges //
analyzed: drug la gal te srog ni rab zhugs gyur na de tshe mi rnams kyi ni 'chi pa 'joms par nges //
translated: If the life [energy] definitely enters the six [wheels], then the death of humans is destroyed.

original: phra mo la ni ma zhugs pa na rnal 'byor rnams kyis 'chi ba'i yul ni gang du gcod par byed /
analyzed: phra mo la ni ma zhugs pa na rnal 'byor rnams kyis 'chi ba'i yul ni gang du gcod par byed /
translated: When it does not enter the subtle [channel], where is the place of death cut by the yogis?

original: 60 / srog ni gal te rtsa gcig nyid la nyin dang mtshan mor 'bab na 'tsho ba dag ni dus kyi lo //
analyzed: 60 / srog ni gal te rtsa gcig nyid la nyin dang mtshan mor 'bab na 'tsho ba dag ni dus kyi lo //
translated: If the life [breath] moves in one channel only, day and night, for a year,

original: gal te phyogs gcig rnam par ma chad 'bab na mi rnams kyi ni 'tsho ba phyed dang bcas pa'i lo //
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig rnam par ma chad 'bab na mi rnams kyi ni 'tsho ba phyed dang bcas pa'i lo //
translated: then one lives for half a year if it moves in one part without interruption.

original: zla ba gcig tu rnam par ma chad 'bab na mi yi bdag po 'tsho ba dag kyang zla ba gsum //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tu rnam par ma chad 'bab na mi yi bdag po 'tsho ba dag kyang zla ba gsum //
translated: If it moves for one month without interruption, then, O King, one lives for three months.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor bas ni rang lus dag la zla bgrod 'chi ba'i dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor bas ni rang lus dag la zla bgrod 'chi ba'i dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya /
translated: Thus the yogi should know the wheel of death in his own body.

original: 61 / lnga nas nyi shu rtsa lnga'i nyin zhag bgrod pa @25b skye ba lnga ni 'phel ba dag gis skye ba ste //
analyzed: 61 / lnga nas nyi shu rtsa lnga'i nyin zhag bgrod pa @25b skye ba lnga ni 'phel ba dag gis skye ba ste //
translated: The five [years] up to twenty-five are the five ascendant births.

original: de nas re re lhag pas bcu ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba dag kyang gsum ni lhag pa ji srid nyid //
analyzed: de nas re re lhag pas bcu ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba dag kyang gsum ni lhag pa ji srid nyid //
translated: Then, with each additional year, ten [years] are added, and three are added as long as there are three.

original: dus ni rdzogs na'o lo rnams gsum mig zla ba de dag rnams dang drug gsum zung dang zla ba gang //
analyzed: dus ni rdzogs na'o lo rnams gsum mig zla ba de dag rnams dang drug gsum zung dang zla ba gang //
translated: When the time is complete, the three years, the eyes, the months, and the six, three, and one [months] are added.

original: zla ba de dag rnams dang nyin zhag tshes phyogs mda' dang yon tan gnyis zla 'tsho ba'i lhag ma'o /
analyzed: zla ba de dag rnams dang nyin zhag tshes phyogs mda' dang yon tan gnyis zla 'tsho ba'i lhag ma'o /
translated: and qualities is the life of the moon.ğŸ”½From its own place, by the best part, it abandons the wheel of the houses.

original: 62 / rang gi gnas nas mchog gi cha yis khyim gyi 'khor lo 'dor te nyams dang lhag ma mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: 62 / rang gi gnas nas mchog gi cha yis khyim gyi 'khor lo 'dor te nyams dang lhag ma mtshungs pa yi //
translated: The remainder is the same.

original: lo dang zla ba zhag gis kyang ste gsum mig ri bong can dang drug gsum zung dang zla bas kyang //
analyzed: lo dang zla ba zhag gis kyang ste gsum mig ri bong can dang drug gsum zung dang zla bas kyang //
translated: By years, months, and days, by three, by the moon, by six, by three pairs, and by the moon,ğŸ”½from completion, the remainder is the same.

original: rdzogs pa nas ni lhag ma mtshungs pa'i tshes phyogs mda' dang yon tan rnams dang lte bar rab zhugs pa'i //
analyzed: rdzogs pa nas ni lhag ma mtshungs pa'i tshes phyogs mda' dang yon tan rnams dang lte bar rab zhugs pa'i //
translated: The lunar mansions, the qualities, and the entry into the navel

original: sum cu rtsa drug gis te nyin zhag mthar ni nyin mor byed pa'i 'chi ltas sbyor bas 'chi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug gis te nyin zhag mthar ni nyin mor byed pa'i 'chi ltas sbyor bas 'chi bar 'gyur /
translated: by thirty-six, at the end of the day, death is by the application of the death omens of the sun.

original: 63 / sngon du nyi ma'i lo gsum dag gi nyin zhag tshogs ni mda' dang me dang 'jig rten 'dor bar byed //
analyzed: 63 / sngon du nyi ma'i lo gsum dag gi nyin zhag tshogs ni mda' dang me dang 'jig rten 'dor bar byed //
translated: Previously, the collection of days of three years of the sun is abandoned by the lunar mansions, fire, and the world.

original: de nas rgyu ba dang bcas mda' dus rtse mo can dang mkha' ri zla ba dag ni gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyu ba dang bcas mda' dus rtse mo can dang mkha' ri zla ba dag ni gsum pa la'o //
translated: Then, with movement, the lunar mansions, the time, the peak, the sky, the mountain, and the moon are for the third.

original: mig sbrul ri bo mda' dang nor dang lag pa gzhan te bdun pa la ni rgyu ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: mig sbrul ri bo mda' dang nor dang lag pa gzhan te bdun pa la ni rgyu ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: The seven movements are: the eye, the snake, the mountain, the arrow, the wealth, the hand, and the other.

original: de nas tshes la sogs pa'i nyin zhag tshogs pa thams cad dag kyang gang zhig lte ba ji srid nyid /
analyzed: de nas tshes la sogs pa'i nyin zhag tshogs pa thams cad dag kyang gang zhig lte ba ji srid nyid /
translated: Then, all the collections of days beginning with the lunar day, for as long as the navel,

original: 64 / dus kyi lo yi bar du nges par nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'pho zhing rgyu bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: 64 / dus kyi lo yi bar du nges par nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'pho zhing rgyu bar byed pa ste //
translated: are certainly transferred and move by the power of counting the days up to the year.

original: zla ba zhes dang nyi ma'i lam la mi mnyam mnyam pa'i nyin zhag re re 'phel pas rim pas so //
analyzed: zla ba zhes dang nyi ma'i lam la mi mnyam mnyam pa'i nyin zhag re re 'phel pas rim pas so //
translated: On the lunar and solar paths, the unequal and equal days increase in sequence.

original: slar yang 'pho ba'i dbye ba mi mnyam mnyam pa'i nyin zhag rnams kyis bcu gnyis rtsibs la byed pa ste //
analyzed: slar yang 'pho ba'i dbye ba mi mnyam mnyam pa'i nyin zhag rnams kyis bcu gnyis rtsibs la byed pa ste //
translated: Again, the divisions of the transfer are made by the unequal and equal days on the twelve spokes.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba ji srid gzhan ni sum cu dag dang 'tsho ba dag gis mtshan mo gsum /
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba ji srid gzhan ni sum cu dag dang 'tsho ba dag gis mtshan mo gsum /
translated: For as long as the half-month, the other thirty days, and the three nights of life

original: 65 / dbugs dang chu srang dang ni chu tshod nyin mtshan dus rnams de ni rim pa dag gis rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: 65 / dbugs dang chu srang dang ni chu tshod nyin mtshan dus rnams de ni rim pa dag gis rgyu ba ste //
translated: are the breaths, the finger lengths, and the hours of day and night, they move in sequence.

original: bgrod pa'i yan lag las ni lo bdun dag gis bgrod pa 'gro ba'i dbang las lo ni drug cus kyang //ğŸ”½zla ba gsum las sum cu'i lo yis nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis dus kyi lo dang phyogs kyis kyang //
analyzed: bgrod pa'i yan lag las ni lo bdun dag gis bgrod pa 'gro ba'i dbang las lo ni drug cus kyang // zla ba gsum las sum cu'i lo yis nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis dus kyi lo dang phyogs kyis kyang //
translated: By the power of the movement, [the breath] moves in the day and night of the time year.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo dag la phyed bcas sum cu gnyis kyis bgos pa'i nyin zhag tshogs kyis rgyu bar @26a * //ğŸ”½'gyur / 66 //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo dag la phyed bcas sum cu gnyis kyis bgos pa'i nyin zhag tshogs kyis rgyu bar @26a * // 'gyur / 66 //
translated: In the years of the time wheel, the breath moves in the groups of days divided by thirty-two and a half.ğŸ”½In the navel chakra, the breath is cut by the nine [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the throat chakra, the breath is cut by the twenty-four [breaths] in each direction.

original: phyogs dang phyogs la rtsa ni dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro lte ba'i 'khor lo dag la gcod par byed //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs la rtsa ni dgu yis bsnun pa'i lag 'gro lte ba'i 'khor lo dag la gcod par byed //
translated: In the head chakra, the breath is cut by the thirty-six [breaths] in each direction.

original: las kyi 'khor lo bya ba zhes pa'i tshigs las nyin zhag rtse mo can gyis rtsa ni re re 'dor //ğŸ”½mgrin pa dag las rgyu skar rtsa ni nyin dang nyin la zla ba'i nang du rim pas 'dor ba ste //
analyzed: las kyi 'khor lo bya ba zhes pa'i tshigs las nyin zhag rtse mo can gyis rtsa ni re re 'dor // mgrin pa dag las rgyu skar rtsa ni nyin dang nyin la zla ba'i nang du rim pas 'dor ba ste //
translated: In the wheel of action, the breath is cut by the twelve [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the body, the breath is cut by the twenty-four [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the mind, the breath is cut by the thirty-six [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the voice, the breath is cut by the forty-eight [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the eyes, the breath is cut by the sixty [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the ears, the breath is cut by the seventy-two [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the nose, the breath is cut by the eighty-four [breaths] in each direction.

original: thig ler gnas pa zla ba'i rkang pa phyogs kyi nang du 'dor te gza' yi rtsa dang gsang bar gnas /
analyzed: thig ler gnas pa zla ba'i rkang pa phyogs kyi nang du 'dor te gza' yi rtsa dang gsang bar gnas /
translated: In the wheel of the tongue, the breath is cut by the ninety-six [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the body, the breath is cut by the one hundred and eight [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the mind, the breath is cut by the one hundred and twelve [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the eyes, the breath is cut by the one hundred and sixteen [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the ears, the breath is cut by the one hundred and twenty [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the nose, the breath is cut by the one hundred and twenty-four [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the tongue, the breath is cut by the one hundred and twenty-eight [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the body, the breath is cut by the one hundred and thirty-two [breaths] in each direction.ğŸ”½In the wheel of the mind, the breath is cut by the

original: 67 / sde pa dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams las nyin mor byed pa khyim gyi dbye bas bgrod par rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: 67 / sde pa dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams las nyin mor byed pa khyim gyi dbye bas bgrod par rgyu ba ste //
translated: The sun, in its course through the zodiacal signs, moves in the day,

original: phyi nas re re lhag pas nyin dang nyin la ldog par 'gyur te dus kyi lo ni ji srid nyid //
analyzed: phyi nas re re lhag pas nyin dang nyin la ldog par 'gyur te dus kyi lo ni ji srid nyid //
translated: and in the night it moves in the reverse direction, increasing by one sign each day, for as many years as there are signs.

original: lo ni chad na phyogs kyi nang du dbyangs kyi nyin zhag dbang gis rgyu ba dang ni zad pa yang //
analyzed: lo ni chad na phyogs kyi nang du dbyangs kyi nyin zhag dbang gis rgyu ba dang ni zad pa yang //
translated: When the year is complete, the sun moves in the reverse direction, by the power of the vowels, in the inner directions, and it also moves in the forward direction.ğŸ”½In the course of a day and night, the exhalation and inhalation of the breath, which is the life of the body, is the measure of a night.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su dbugs ni 'byung dang 'jug pa nyams pa 'tsho ba dag gi mtshan mo gcig 68 / lte ba mgrin pa  dpral ba rang gi snying ga'i padma dag la rtsa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su dbugs ni 'byung dang 'jug pa nyams pa 'tsho ba dag gi mtshan mo gcig 68 / lte ba mgrin pa  dpral ba rang gi snying ga'i padma dag la rtsa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa //
translated: The remaining channels are in the navel, throat, forehead, and heart lotuses.

original: nyi ma ro dang me dag gnas te rang gi snying ga'i padmar phyed bcas rtsa ni de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: nyi ma ro dang me dag gnas te rang gi snying ga'i padmar phyed bcas rtsa ni de bzhin nyid //
translated: The sun, the rasanÄ, and the fire abide there, and the channels, together with the half, are in the heart lotus.

original: lag pa rkang pa'i tshigs la tshes kyis bsgyur ba'i dus rnams nyin zhag drug ni ji srid nyid du ste //
analyzed: lag pa rkang pa'i tshigs la tshes kyis bsgyur ba'i dus rnams nyin zhag drug ni ji srid nyid du ste //
translated: The days and nights, multiplied by the lunar mansions, are six days, for as long as the sun is in one sign.

original: mthar ni kun tu phra mo rab tu 'bab ste nyin zhag snying gi chu skyes yang dag gtong bar byed /
analyzed: mthar ni kun tu phra mo rab tu 'bab ste nyin zhag snying gi chu skyes yang dag gtong bar byed /
translated: In the end, the subtle [breath] descends completely, and the day is released into the heart lotus.

original: 69 / sum cu drug gi stong phrag dhru brgya'i nyin zhag tshogs rnams dag gis dus kyi rtsa ni rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: 69 / sum cu drug gi stong phrag dhru brgya'i nyin zhag tshogs rnams dag gis dus kyi rtsa ni rgyu ba ste //
translated: The time of the channel is the gathering of days, thirty-six thousand, six hundred.

original: nyin mtshan dus la nyi ma zla bas rang rang rgyu ba dag gis gang gang rdzogs par mi nus pa //
analyzed: nyin mtshan dus la nyi ma zla bas rang rang rgyu ba dag gis gang gang rdzogs par mi nus pa //
translated: The day and night times are not able to be completed by the sun and moon in their own movements.

original: nyi ma'i nyin zhag nyi ma rgyu ba la yang bu lon du 'gyur de phyed zla ba'i rgyu ba la //
analyzed: nyi ma'i nyin zhag nyi ma rgyu ba la yang bu lon du 'gyur de phyed zla ba'i rgyu ba la //
translated: The sun's day is also a debt in the movement of the sun, and half a month in the movement of the moon.

original: rgyu skar nyin zhag rab tu dbye bas 'chi ba'i nyi zla rgyu ba stong pa'i zla ba dag la'o /
analyzed: rgyu skar nyin zhag rab tu dbye bas 'chi ba'i nyi zla rgyu ba stong pa'i zla ba dag la'o /
translated: The movement of the sun and moon of death is in the empty months of the divisions of the lunar day.

original: 70 / srog ni lus la lhag pa gang zhig rab gsal mtshams su rig byed rkang chad kyis dman drug cu ste //
analyzed: 70 / srog ni lus la lhag pa gang zhig rab gsal mtshams su rig byed rkang chad kyis dman drug cu ste //
translated: The remaining life in the body is sixty [years] less the vedic pÄdas in the bright juncture.

original: 'pho ba'i dbye  ba dag gis thams cad nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa ni zung dag nges par 'joms //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i dbye  ba dag gis thams cad nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa ni zung dag nges par 'joms //
translated: By the divisions of the transits, all [the breaths] are definitely destroyed in the pairs of channels at the time of each day.

original: yang dang yang du lo yi dbus su nyi zla rgyu ba dag las stong pa mig dang ri yi grangs //
analyzed: yang dang yang du lo yi dbus su nyi zla rgyu ba dag las stong pa mig dang ri yi grangs //
translated: The sun and moon move through the middle of the year, and from them the empty [points] and the [number of] mountains [are determined].

original: de ltar rang rang tshad kyi lo brgya dag gis lha mi rnams kyi rang gi tshe la dus bgrod do /
analyzed: de ltar rang rang tshad kyi lo brgya dag gis lha mi rnams kyi rang gi tshe la dus bgrod do /
translated: In this way, the year, which is the measure of each [planet], is traversed in one's own life of gods and men.

original: 71 / @26b  zos dang nad dang bsnun pa gal te res 'ga' mi rnams la ni dus kyi rtsa la gyur pa na //
analyzed: 71 / @26b  zos dang nad dang bsnun pa gal te res 'ga' mi rnams la ni dus kyi rtsa la gyur pa na //
translated: If, at some point, the time of men is [spent] in eating, illness, and fighting,

original: gzhi de yis ni 'phral la myur bar rtsa yi 'khor lo dag la dus ni rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhi de yis ni 'phral la myur bar rtsa yi 'khor lo dag la dus ni rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: then, by that very basis, time quickly enters the channel wheels.

original: 'khor lo dag gi rtsa 'di 'gog ste nyi ma ri bong can gyi bgrod pa bcad nas rim pa yis //
analyzed: 'khor lo dag gi rtsa 'di 'gog ste nyi ma ri bong can gyi bgrod pa bcad nas rim pa yis //
translated: Stopping these channels of the wheels, cutting off the path of the sun and moon,

original: dbu mar phra mo la ni brten pa gang zhig 'phrog pa mi bdag srog chags rnams kyi 'tsho ba'o /
analyzed: dbu mar phra mo la ni brten pa gang zhig 'phrog pa mi bdag srog chags rnams kyi 'tsho ba'o /
translated: the subtle one that is based in the middle is taken away, the life of the lord of men.

original: 72 / snying ga'i padma dpal ldan dpral bar 'byung ba phyogs dang nyin zhag ces bya zla ba'i rkang pa rgyu //
analyzed: 72 / snying ga'i padma dpal ldan dpral bar 'byung ba phyogs dang nyin zhag ces bya zla ba'i rkang pa rgyu //
translated: The glorious heart lotus arises in the forehead, the so-called directions and days, the path of the moon's digits.

original: longs spyod lte ba'i 'khor lo dag la dgu ldan bcu dang drag po zung dang rgyal ba zhes bya dang // de nyid ces bya zhag bdun dag nis  slar yang ri bong mtshan ma gang 'di rim pa min pas 'dor //
analyzed: longs spyod lte ba'i 'khor lo dag la dgu ldan bcu dang drag po zung dang rgyal ba zhes bya dang // de nyid ces bya zhag bdun dag nis  slar yang ri bong mtshan ma gang 'di rim pa min pas 'dor //
translated: Then again, the rabbit-marked moon, which is not in order, is abandoned.

original: thig le dag la rdzogs par byas nas snying gar rab 'jug dkar po'i phyogs la nor gyi slad du'o /
analyzed: thig le dag la rdzogs par byas nas snying gar rab 'jug dkar po'i phyogs la nor gyi slad du'o /
translated: Having completed it in the bindu, it enters the heart for the sake of wealth on the white side.

original: 73 / slar yang nag po dag la de bzhin 'gro ste rkang pa'i dbang gis lte ba'i padma dag gi bar //
analyzed: 73 / slar yang nag po dag la de bzhin 'gro ste rkang pa'i dbang gis lte ba'i padma dag gi bar //
translated: Again, it goes in the same way on the black side, by the power of the feet, to the navel.

original: snying ga de bzhin mgo bor rtsibs brgyad rtsibs bcu drug la gnag dang dkar ba dag gi chu skyes ming //
analyzed: snying ga de bzhin mgo bor rtsibs brgyad rtsibs bcu drug la gnag dang dkar ba dag gi chu skyes ming //
translated: The lotus has eight and sixteen spokes, respectively, black and white, in the heart and the head.

original: mgrin pa lte ba dag la sum cu rtsa gnyis rtsibs dang nyis 'gyur gzhan te dmar dang ser po'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa lte ba dag la sum cu rtsa gnyis rtsibs dang nyis 'gyur gzhan te dmar dang ser po'o //
translated: The throat and the navel have thirty-two spokes, and another double that, red and yellow, respectively.

original: brgyad pa gnyis ni lte ba mgrin pa la ste mgo dang snying ga la yang dkar nag rdzogs pa'o /
analyzed: brgyad pa gnyis ni lte ba mgrin pa la ste mgo dang snying ga la yang dkar nag rdzogs pa'o /
translated: The two eights are in the navel and the throat, and the white and black are complete in the head and the heart, respectively.

original: 74 / aa sogs sum cu'i dbyangs gang ha yar wa lar ldan thig le dpal ldan rnam par bcad pa yis //
analyzed: 74 / aa sogs sum cu'i dbyangs gang ha yar wa lar ldan thig le dpal ldan rnam par bcad pa yis //
translated: The vowels from â€œaâ€ to â€œhaâ€ are endowed with â€œyaâ€ and â€œraâ€ and â€œwaâ€ and â€œlaâ€ and the bindu and the crescent.

original: phye ba drug cur 'gyur te de dag dus dang mi bdag nor dang so rnams ge sar rtse mo la'o //
analyzed: phye ba drug cur 'gyur te de dag dus dang mi bdag nor dang so rnams ge sar rtse mo la'o //
translated: They are divided into sixty by the glorious anusvÄra and the visarga, which are on the stamens and the tips of the petals.

original: thig le'i rnam pa dang ni rnam par bcad pas pad 'dab mchog la ka sogs sde rnams rnam phye ba //
analyzed: thig le'i rnam pa dang ni rnam par bcad pas pad 'dab mchog la ka sogs sde rnams rnam phye ba //
translated: The consonants from â€œkaâ€ to â€œmaâ€ are divided on the supreme petals by the form of the bindu and the visarga.

original: nyi shu dang ni brgya phrag gcig kyang thun gyi bgrod pa'i dbang gis nyi ma rgyu zhing nyams par byed /
analyzed: nyi shu dang ni brgya phrag gcig kyang thun gyi bgrod pa'i dbang gis nyi ma rgyu zhing nyams par byed /
translated: They are twenty and one hundred, which are diminished by the movement of the sun through the periods.

original: 75 / phyogs la zla ba rang gi rgyu bas nyin zhag ces bya'i rkang pa dag kyang bu lon dag tu byed //
analyzed: 75 / phyogs la zla ba rang gi rgyu bas nyin zhag ces bya'i rkang pa dag kyang bu lon dag tu byed //
translated: The moon in the directions is also in debt, so to speak, for the so-called day-parts.

original: slar yang zla ba gnyis kyis gzhan pa dag kyang nyin zhag lo yi sbyor ba dag las 'phel ba ni //
analyzed: slar yang zla ba gnyis kyis gzhan pa dag kyang nyin zhag lo yi sbyor ba dag las 'phel ba ni //
translated: Again, the other [day-parts] increase by two months each, from the day-parts to the years.

original: rdzogs pa'i lo la nyin zhag drug tu 'gyur te gzhan yang de bzhin 'chi  bdag gis mtshams su 'phel //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i lo la nyin zhag drug tu 'gyur te gzhan yang de bzhin 'chi  bdag gis mtshams su 'phel //
translated: In a complete year, there are six day-parts, and the others increase in the same way up to the lord of death.

original: rgyal po de ltar nyi ma'i bu lon nyis 'gyur 'di ni lo  @27a * //
analyzed: rgyal po de ltar nyi ma'i bu lon nyis 'gyur 'di ni lo  @27a * //
translated: O King, this debt to the sun is doubled every day.ğŸ”½

original: yi sbyor  ba dag gis 'phel bar byed /
analyzed: yi sbyor  ba dag gis 'phel bar byed /
translated: The king, in this way, the debt of the sun increases by a double amount through the application of the years.

original: 76 / dbugs drug gis ni chu srang gcig tu rab tu 'gyur te chu srang drug cu yis kyang chu tshod do //
analyzed: 76 / dbugs drug gis ni chu srang gcig tu rab tu 'gyur te chu srang drug cu yis kyang chu tshod do //
translated: Six breaths make one breath-moment. Sixty breath-moments make one minute.

original: chu tshod drug cu nyin zhag tu 'gyur gsum gyis bsgyur ba bcu yi nyin zhag dag gis zla ba gcig / zla ba drug gis kyang ni bgrod  par 'gyur te gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i bgrod pa lo gcig tu rab grags //
analyzed: chu tshod drug cu nyin zhag tu 'gyur gsum gyis bsgyur ba bcu yi nyin zhag dag gis zla ba gcig / zla ba drug gis kyang ni bgrod  par 'gyur te gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i bgrod pa lo gcig tu rab grags //
translated: Sixty minutes make one hour. Three times sixty make one day and night. Ten of those make one month. Six months make one ayana. Two of those make one year.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi tshe lo brgya las bu lon bgrod par son pa dus kyi rtsa yi dbang gis so /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi tshe lo brgya las bu lon bgrod par son pa dus kyi rtsa yi dbang gis so /
translated: The debt of the sun reaches the end of the hundred years of human life through the power of the channel of time.

original: 77 /'jig rten gsum na lha min lha mi rnams las gang zhig rang gi lus la zla ba nyi ma dag / rdzogs par nus pa'i rnal 'byor ldan pa min de zla bas rang gi rgyu bas nyin mtshan rgyu ba dang // srid par lo yi nang du rim pas nyi mas kyang ni rgyu skar thams cad rgyu ba min pa nyid //
analyzed: 77 /'jig rten gsum na lha min lha mi rnams las gang zhig rang gi lus la zla ba nyi ma dag / rdzogs par nus pa'i rnal 'byor ldan pa min de zla bas rang gi rgyu bas nyin mtshan rgyu ba dang // srid par lo yi nang du rim pas nyi mas kyang ni rgyu skar thams cad rgyu ba min pa nyid //
translated: The sun, in the course of a year, does not traverse all the signs of the zodiac in the same time.

original: lo dang lor ni bu lon dag gis de ni srid pa za ste dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig 78 / chad pa gal te rtsa gcig yin na mi yi bdag po gci ba dag ni skyur ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: lo dang lor ni bu lon dag gis de ni srid pa za ste dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig 78 / chad pa gal te rtsa gcig yin na mi yi bdag po gci ba dag ni skyur ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The year, which is the debt of the world, is devoured by the Kalpa, which is the single hero. If the year is divided into parts, the lord of men will find that the excrement is acid.

original: de tsam rnams ni nyin zhag lnga nas mchog gi cha yis 'dor te gong bu 'chad pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de tsam rnams ni nyin zhag lnga nas mchog gi cha yis 'dor te gong bu 'chad pa'i dus su'o //
translated: In five days, the supreme part is lost, and the body is destroyed.

original: sgra ni rna ba las te ro yang nges par kha las 'dor zhing mig 'bras mig gi dbus nas so //
analyzed: sgra ni rna ba las te ro yang nges par kha las 'dor zhing mig 'bras mig gi dbus nas so //
translated: The sound is lost from the ear, the taste from the tongue, the eye from the middle of the eye.

original: dri ni sna las mi rnams dag gi lag pa rkang pa'i lus las dro ba'i dngos po rim pa yis /
analyzed: dri ni sna las mi rnams dag gi lag pa rkang pa'i lus las dro ba'i dngos po rim pa yis /
translated: The smell of humans is the heat of the body, from the hands and feet in order.

original: 79 / sna yi rtse mo 'phyang ba dang ni spyi bor lag pa bzhag pa de yi rang bzhin dag tu mthong //
analyzed: 79 / sna yi rtse mo 'phyang ba dang ni spyi bor lag pa bzhag pa de yi rang bzhin dag tu mthong //
translated: The tip of the nose hangs down, and the hands are placed on the headâ€”this is the nature of that [smell].

original: lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil la rgya skyegs tshon gyis rab tu byugs kyang dmar po nyid du byed ma yin //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil la rgya skyegs tshon gyis rab tu byugs kyang dmar po nyid du byed ma yin //
translated: Even if the palms of both hands are well anointed with red dye, they do not become red.

original: nyi ma kha dog nag po dang ni yongs su gyur pa'i ri bong 'dzin pa kha dog ser por mthong //
analyzed: nyi ma kha dog nag po dang ni yongs su gyur pa'i ri bong 'dzin pa kha dog ser por mthong //
translated: The sun becomes black in color, and the moon, which has turned yellow, is seen to be white.

original: gcin dang lus kyang bsil bar gyur na mi yi bdag po de yi nyin zhag la ni 'chi ba nyid /
analyzed: gcin dang lus kyang bsil bar gyur na mi yi bdag po de yi nyin zhag la ni 'chi ba nyid /
translated: If urine and the body become cool, then on that day and night, O King, death itself [occurs].

original: 80 / lce 'og nag po'i thig tu rab tu 'gyur te mig la tshangs pa'i ri mo shin tu phra mo dang // dbugs ni zla ba nyi ma'i lam du 'phro ste mi yi bdag po mkhur tshos gnyis po de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 80 / lce 'og nag po'i thig tu rab tu 'gyur te mig la tshangs pa'i ri mo shin tu phra mo dang // dbugs ni zla ba nyi ma'i lam du 'phro ste mi yi bdag po mkhur tshos gnyis po de bzhin nyid //
translated: A black spot appears under the tongue, and in the eyes a very fine line of BrahmÄ appears. The breath moves in the path of the moon and sun, and likewise, O King, in both cheeks.

original: nu ma'i steng ni mchan khung du zhugs gza' yi tshogs rnams mtha' dag me stag dag dang bcas par mthong //
analyzed: nu ma'i steng ni mchan khung du zhugs gza' yi tshogs rnams mtha' dag me stag dag dang bcas par mthong //
translated: The nipples are the armpits, and the entire group of planets is seen to be the sparks.

original: mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa rengs shing 'khor ba yang ni lus la 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid dag tu @27b 'dod /
analyzed: mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa rengs shing 'khor ba yang ni lus la 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid dag tu @27b 'dod /
translated: The stiffening and whirling of the throat and body are considered to be the characteristics of death in the body.

original: 81 / skye ba dang ni bca' ba'i dus dang byis pa gzhon nu dag gi gzugs ni byed pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: 81 / skye ba dang ni bca' ba'i dus dang byis pa gzhon nu dag gi gzugs ni byed pa gang yin pa //
translated: The form of the birth, the creation, the childhood, and the youth are the actions.

original: de nyid 'jig rten dag tu slar yang sdud par byed pa dus kyi 'khor lo can te nyi ma min //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten dag tu slar yang sdud par byed pa dus kyi 'khor lo can te nyi ma min //
translated: The one who again gathers the world is the KÄlacakra, not the sun.

original: zla ba nyi ma la sogs lha rnams 'byung ba dang bcas mtshan mo'i cha la bcom ldan de yis zos //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma la sogs lha rnams 'byung ba dang bcas mtshan mo'i cha la bcom ldan de yis zos //
translated: The moon, the sun, and so on, along with the gods, are consumed by the Lord at night.

original: slar yang nyin mo'i dus su mtha' yas rnams kyang gtong bar byed de skyed pa'i rgyur ni rim pas so /
analyzed: slar yang nyin mo'i dus su mtha' yas rnams kyang gtong bar byed de skyed pa'i rgyur ni rim pas so /
translated: Again, in the daytime, he releases the infinite ones in order to create them in sequence.

original: 82 / sgra la sogs pa drug po rnams ni las su 'gyur te dbang po drug po dag kyang byed pa'o //
analyzed: 82 / sgra la sogs pa drug po rnams ni las su 'gyur te dbang po drug po dag kyang byed pa'o //
translated: The six, sound and so on, are the objects, and the six sense faculties are the agents.

original: lo dang zla ba phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo tshes dang zla ba nyi ma dag kyang byed pa po //
analyzed: lo dang zla ba phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo tshes dang zla ba nyi ma dag kyang byed pa po //
translated: The years, the months, the directions, the days and nights, the lunar fortnights, the months, and the years are the agents.

original: de dag sdud pa'i byed po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur skyed pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po ma yin //
analyzed: de dag sdud pa'i byed po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur skyed pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po ma yin //
translated: The agent who gathers them is not the creator, for he is not the agent who generates.

original: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can de yul dang rnam bral yon tan med la rang bzhin med pa'o /ğŸ”½83 / dri dang kha dog dang ni ro dang reg pa zhes dang 'dzin ma dang ni chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can de yul dang rnam bral yon tan med la rang bzhin med pa'o / 83 / dri dang kha dog dang ni ro dang reg pa zhes dang 'dzin ma dang ni chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: The all-pervading one, the sky-vajra, is free from objects, is devoid of qualities, and is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: nges par gzugs can brgyad po rnams ni mtha' dag yul gyi tshogs pa dag ste gcig ni gtso bor 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par gzugs can brgyad po rnams ni mtha' dag yul gyi tshogs pa dag ste gcig ni gtso bor 'gyur //
translated: The eight substances, sound, space, earth, water, fire, wind, form, and the mind, are the totality of the objects, and one is the principal.

original: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag 'di ni spro ba dag dang sdud par 'gyur te dus kyi mthu las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag 'di ni spro ba dag dang sdud par 'gyur te dus kyi mthu las so //
translated: This entire triple world expands and contracts by the power of time.

original: sgra dang stong pa dang ni chos kyi dbyings dang yid kyang mi yi bdag po gzugs med du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sgra dang stong pa dang ni chos kyi dbyings dang yid kyang mi yi bdag po gzugs med du 'gyur ro /
translated: Sound, emptiness, the realm of phenomena, and the mind are the lord of humans in the formless realm.

original: 84 / bdag nyid 'ching ste rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis ngar gyi srin bu ji bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 84 / bdag nyid 'ching ste rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis ngar gyi srin bu ji bzhin nyid //
translated: Bound by himself, he dwells in his own nature, like a silkworm in its cocoon.

original: bdag nyid bdag gis nges par slar yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid dag las ni gtong bar byed //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gis nges par slar yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid dag las ni gtong bar byed //
translated: But he, the self, is released by the self, by the mind, which is free from discursive thought.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang las rang bzhin yon tan la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba byed pa ste //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang las rang bzhin yon tan la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba byed pa ste //
translated: Therefore, the king is the maker of both happiness and sorrow, dwelling in his own nature.

original: rang bzhin rnam par bral ba su zhig byed po ci zhig byed de mi shes 'jig rten rmongs par byed /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par bral ba su zhig byed po ci zhig byed de mi shes 'jig rten rmongs par byed /
translated: Who is the maker, and what is made? The world is deluded by ignorance.

original: 85 / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ni yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin dag gi sems //
analyzed: 85 / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ni yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin dag gi sems //
translated: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intellect, and the sense of â€œIâ€

original: rags dang phra mo gzhan yang rnam gsum yon tan la gnas yi ge thig le la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rags dang phra mo gzhan yang rnam gsum yon tan la gnas yi ge thig le la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: are gross, subtle, and in three other ways, dwelling in the qualities.

original: rags pa rags pa'i dbang po rnams la rang bzhin gyis kyang gnas te phra mo'i sems la phra mo yang //
analyzed: rags pa rags pa'i dbang po rnams la rang bzhin gyis kyang gnas te phra mo'i sems la phra mo yang //
translated: The gross dwells in the gross sense organs by its very nature, and the subtle in the subtle mind.

original: ye shes la yang ye shes sku ste rang bzhin rnam 'gyur med pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ba @28a * //ğŸ”½'byung ba min /
analyzed: ye shes la yang ye shes sku ste rang bzhin rnam 'gyur med pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ba @28a * // 'byung ba min /
translated: The body of pristine consciousness is the life of pristine consciousness, which is unchanging and unmoving.ğŸ”½The five empty ones beginning with A are unchanging and unmoving.ğŸ”½The glorious ones with parts and drops and nÄda,ğŸ”½time, mind, and intellect are also like that.

original: 86 / aa sogs stong pa lnga ni rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur min dpal ldan cha dang thig le n'a da dang // dus dang sems dang blo ste rang bzhin dag kyang de bzhin gzhan pa'i dbyangs ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 86 / aa sogs stong pa lnga ni rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur min dpal ldan cha dang thig le n'a da dang // dus dang sems dang blo ste rang bzhin dag kyang de bzhin gzhan pa'i dbyangs ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other phonemes are the vÄyus and so on.ğŸ”½The phonemes of the coarse classes are the sixteen, the ten multiplied by three.

original: rags pa sde pa'i yi ge rnams ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu ste bcu drug gzhan ni rnam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rags pa sde pa'i yi ge rnams ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu ste bcu drug gzhan ni rnam 'gyur ro //
translated: The others are the movements.ğŸ”½The one with the vajra in the middle is neither unchanging nor moving.

original: de dag dbus su rdo rje can ni rang bzhin min cing rnam 'gyur min te khyab byed rang bzhin med /
analyzed: de dag dbus su rdo rje can ni rang bzhin min cing rnam 'gyur min te khyab byed rang bzhin med /
translated: The pervader is without a nature.

original: 87 /'khor bar bde dang sdug bsngal rang bzhin yon tan la gnas las las skyes pa de ni za ba ste //
analyzed: 87 /'khor bar bde dang sdug bsngal rang bzhin yon tan la gnas las las skyes pa de ni za ba ste //
translated: In saá¹ƒsÄra, happiness and suffering are based on the nature, qualities, and actions.

original: mi rnams kyi ni las 'di dag kyang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te rags dang phra mo zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni las 'di dag kyang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te rags dang phra mo zhi ba'o //
translated: The actions of humans are also of three types: coarse, subtle, and peace.

original: bdag ni byed pa po yang khyad par las te gzhan pa phyugs bdag kyang yod byed po zhes pa las //
analyzed: bdag ni byed pa po yang khyad par las te gzhan pa phyugs bdag kyang yod byed po zhes pa las //
translated: The self is the agent, and the difference is due to the other, the owner of the cattle.

original: byed po bdag gam gzhan pa min te rang bzhin rnam par bral bar shes pa de ni las ma yin /
analyzed: byed po bdag gam gzhan pa min te rang bzhin rnam par bral bar shes pa de ni las ma yin /
translated: The agent is neither the self nor the other, and the action is known to be devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: 88 / de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug bsngal dag ni mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste //
analyzed: 88 / de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug bsngal dag ni mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste //
translated: Therefore, no agent whatsoever gives or takes away the happiness and suffering of living beings.

original: 'khor ba dag tu rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba dag tu rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: Whatever is done in the three realms is the previous karma that gives its fruit.

original: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te //
analyzed: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te //
translated: This is the giver and the taker away of the confused mind.

original: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog par byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po dag gis mthong ma yin /
analyzed: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog par byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po dag gis mthong ma yin /
translated: The body is not seen by the senses to be the giver of infinite virtue.

original: 89 /'dod pa'i nus dang bya ba dang ni gsum pa ye shes nus pa 'gro ba rang gi yid la ste //
analyzed: 89 /'dod pa'i nus dang bya ba dang ni gsum pa ye shes nus pa 'gro ba rang gi yid la ste //
translated: The power of desire, the power of action, and the power of wisdom in the world are in one's own mind.

original: dngos po gsal ba dang ni 'jug pa dag dang ro mnyam rgyur ni don la nye bar dmigs par byed //
analyzed: dngos po gsal ba dang ni 'jug pa dag dang ro mnyam rgyur ni don la nye bar dmigs par byed //
translated: The object is perceived in the sense of being the cause of the manifestation of the entity, of its engagement, and of its being of the same taste.

original: slar yang gtong ba dag ni bzhi pa srid gsum gyis btud gnyis med kyis kyang nges par rim pas so //
analyzed: slar yang gtong ba dag ni bzhi pa srid gsum gyis btud gnyis med kyis kyang nges par rim pas so //
translated: Again, the giving up is fourfold, in the sense of being gradual, of being in the three worlds, of being nondual, and of being certain.

original: de dag nang nas rdo rje can ni mi yi bdag po cung zad mi za gtong ba min pa nyid /
analyzed: de dag nang nas rdo rje can ni mi yi bdag po cung zad mi za gtong ba min pa nyid /
translated: Among them, the one with the vajra, the lord of men, is not a little eater, but a giver.

original: 90 / bdag ni byed po sdug bsngal bde ba rab tu sbyin por mi yi bdag po der ni 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: 90 / bdag ni byed po sdug bsngal bde ba rab tu sbyin por mi yi bdag po der ni 'gyur ba min //
translated: I am not the agent, the lord of men, who gives out suffering and happiness.

original: 'ga' yang bcings dang grol bar 'gyur min mi yi bdag po sems kyi nus pa rnam par spangs nas so //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bcings dang grol bar 'gyur min mi yi bdag po sems kyi nus pa rnam par spangs nas so //
translated: No one is bound or liberated, the lord of men, having abandoned the capacity of the mind.

original: nam mkha' bum pa'i dbus nas chu ni len par byed pa na yang 'gro ba min pa ji lta ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' bum pa'i dbus nas chu ni len par byed pa na yang 'gro ba min pa ji lta ba //
translated: Just as when one takes water from the middle of a pot in space, it does not go anywhere,

original: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can ni yul dang rnam @28b bral lus kyi dbus dag tu yang de bzhin no /
analyzed: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can ni yul dang rnam @28b bral lus kyi dbus dag tu yang de bzhin no /
translated: so also the all-pervading one with the vajra in space, free from objects, in the middle of the body.

original: 91 / de ltar las ni yod par smra ba por 'gyur bcom ldan ston pa gcig pu de ni byed po min //
analyzed: 91 / de ltar las ni yod par smra ba por 'gyur bcom ldan ston pa gcig pu de ni byed po min //
translated: Thus, the only Teacher, the Lord, is not the agent, since he is the one who teaches the existence of karma.

original: kun mkhyen dang po'i sangs rgyas srid gsum gyis btud dus kyi 'khor lo can te 'khor lo can ma yin //
analyzed: kun mkhyen dang po'i sangs rgyas srid gsum gyis btud dus kyi 'khor lo can te 'khor lo can ma yin //
translated: The Omniscient One, the Primordial Buddha, the One Bowed to by the Three Worlds, the One with the Wheel, is not the One with the Wheel.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug drag po dag kyang gang gi zhabs kyi chu skyes drung du lhag par skyabs 'gro ba //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug drag po dag kyang gang gi zhabs kyi chu skyes drung du lhag par skyabs 'gro ba //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva themselves take refuge at his lotus feet.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo rgyal ba mchog skyed yon tan med cing rnam rtog med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo rgyal ba mchog skyed yon tan med cing rnam rtog med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: I pay homage to that Supreme Victor, the Wheel of Time, who is free of qualities and concepts and who gives rise to the Supreme Victor, the Wheel of Time.

original: 92 / zhi ba'i bsam pa la ni lha nyid du 'gyur mi yi bdag po mun pa la ni dmyal ba nyid //ğŸ”½rdul dag la yang dud 'gro nyid de rab mchog sa yi steng du mi nyid dag ni 'dres pa la //
analyzed: 92 / zhi ba'i bsam pa la ni lha nyid du 'gyur mi yi bdag po mun pa la ni dmyal ba nyid // rdul dag la yang dud 'gro nyid de rab mchog sa yi steng du mi nyid dag ni 'dres pa la //
translated: In a mind of peace, one becomes a god; in a mind of darkness, a lord of men; in a mind of darkness, a hell being.ğŸ”½In a mind of passion, an animal; in a mind of a mixture of the three, a human.

original: 'byung po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste rdul dang mun pa dang ni snying stobs phan tshun 'dres pa la'o //
analyzed: 'byung po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste rdul dang mun pa dang ni snying stobs phan tshun 'dres pa la'o //
translated: The three types of beings are those in whom passion, darkness, and goodness are mixed.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su yid kyi bsam pa gang zhig dran par gyur pa der ni skye bo yang dag skye /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su yid kyi bsam pa gang zhig dran par gyur pa der ni skye bo yang dag skye /
translated: At the time of death, whatever thought is in the mind, that is what the person is born into.

original: 93 / lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis lha yi mchog gi gnas su mi nyid gcig ni ji lta ba //
analyzed: 93 / lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis lha yi mchog gi gnas su mi nyid gcig ni ji lta ba //
translated: How is it that a human being can be born in the highest divine realms by the power of the eight divine qualities?ğŸ”½How is it that animals are born in the hells, and hell beings in the animal realm?

original: dud 'gro dag kyang chu gter rnam pa nges par dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dmyal ba nyid ni de bzhin gcig / gnas 'di rnams su ro yi 'gro bar skye bo 'khor te las kyi zhags pas nges par bcings pa dag / skye ba 'bum phrag du mas thar
analyzed: dud 'gro dag kyang chu gter rnam pa nges par dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dmyal ba nyid ni de bzhin gcig / gnas 'di rnams su ro yi 'gro bar skye bo 'khor te las kyi zhags pas nges par bcings pa dag / skye ba 'bum phrag du mas thar
translated: In these realms, beings are born in the realm of the dead, bound by the noose of karma.

original: pa mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang du ni 'gro zhing grol ba min /
analyzed: pa mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang du ni 'gro zhing grol ba min /
translated: For hundreds of thousands of lives, they do not attain liberation and the state of supreme bliss.

original: 94 / phung po khams dang dbang po dang ni rnam gsum srid pa 'jigs pa las kyi dbang po lnga dag dang // de tsam dang ni las kyi skyon dang yon tan dang bcas yid dang blo dang  ngar 'dzin la sogs te //
analyzed: 94 / phung po khams dang dbang po dang ni rnam gsum srid pa 'jigs pa las kyi dbang po lnga dag dang // de tsam dang ni las kyi skyon dang yon tan dang bcas yid dang blo dang  ngar 'dzin la sogs te //
translated: The three realms are the aggregates, elements, and sense bases. The five sense faculties are the source of fear. The mind, intellect, and grasping at â€œIâ€ and â€œmineâ€ are the source of faults and qualities.

original: 'di dag gis bcings 'tsho ba dag ni ro yi 'gro bar 'khor te phra mo'i dngos po dag gis slar //
analyzed: 'di dag gis bcings 'tsho ba dag ni ro yi 'gro bar 'khor te phra mo'i dngos po dag gis slar //
translated: Those who are bound by these are reborn in the world of the dead, and again by subtle things.

original: dngos po btang na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab tu 'gro ste gang du slar yang skye ldan min /
analyzed: dngos po btang na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab tu 'gro ste gang du slar yang skye ldan min /
translated: But if one gives up things, one goes to the supreme place of immortality, where there is no rebirth.

original: 95 / yan lag dang bcas rig byed dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas dang rtog ge grub pa'i mthar ldan 'jig rten du //
analyzed: 95 / yan lag dang bcas rig byed dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas dang rtog ge grub pa'i mthar ldan 'jig rten du //
translated: The world has the Vedas with their limbs, the scriptures of the MÄ«mÄá¹ƒsÄ, and the conclusions of the logicians.

original: snyan dngags mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min //
analyzed: snyan dngags mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min //
translated: The treatises composed by the poets VyÄsa, MedhÄtithi, and others are not knowledge.

original: rig pa zhes pa nang rig 'gyur med kyang ste 'jig rten 'dir ni thub pa rnams kyis rab @29a * //
analyzed: rig pa zhes pa nang rig 'gyur med kyang ste 'jig rten 'dir ni thub pa rnams kyis rab @29a * //
translated: Knowledge is the unchanging inner knowledge, which the sages have proclaimed in this world.

original: gsungs nyid // gang du 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur mi yi bdag po slar yang gang du thim pa'o /
analyzed: gsungs nyid // gang du 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur mi yi bdag po slar yang gang du thim pa'o /
translated: In it, the three worlds come to an end, and there the lord of men dissolves again.

original: 96 / rnal 'byor dbang po rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis gal te shi bar gyur pa na //
analyzed: 96 / rnal 'byor dbang po rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis gal te shi bar gyur pa na //
translated: If a lord of yogins, who has not attained the state of a yoginÄ«, should die with a very restless mind,

original: dpal ldan mi yi 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ldan pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan mi yi 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ldan pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: In the world of men, the most excellent of the glorious ones, he is born into the family of the Sage, endowed with yoga.

original: sngon gyi goms pa de yis slar yang ye shes rnal 'byor yangs pa dag ni kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon gyi goms pa de yis slar yang ye shes rnal 'byor yangs pa dag ni kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: By that previous habituation, again he takes up the vast yoga of wisdom.

original: ye shes thob na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab 'gro gang du slar yang skye ba ldan pa min /
analyzed: ye shes thob na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab 'gro gang du slar yang skye ba ldan pa min /
translated: When he has attained wisdom, he goes to the supreme abode of the inexhaustible, where he is no longer subject to birth.

original: 97 / ye shes skye ste rgyal ba rnams kyi nyi ma nyin mo'i dus su mtshan mo phyed dang mtshan mo'i mthar //
analyzed: 97 / ye shes skye ste rgyal ba rnams kyi nyi ma nyin mo'i dus su mtshan mo phyed dang mtshan mo'i mthar //
translated: The sun of the Victorious Ones, the source of wisdom, rises at noon and at the end of the night.

original: lha min rnams kyi zla ba mtshan mo'i dus su nyi ma phyed dang nyin mo dag gi mjug tu'o //
analyzed: lha min rnams kyi zla ba mtshan mo'i dus su nyi ma phyed dang nyin mo dag gi mjug tu'o //
translated: The moon of the demigods rises at midnight and at the end of the day.

original: yang dag ye shes rnam nyams dag la tshig ni legs sbyar tha mal dag tu rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes rnam nyams dag la tshig ni legs sbyar tha mal dag tu rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
translated: For those whose wisdom is impaired, the words are well-formed in the ordinary language.

original: zhi dang drag po las skye srid pa gsum gyi gnas su skyes bu nyid dang tha mal dag kyang ngo /
analyzed: zhi dang drag po las skye srid pa gsum gyi gnas su skyes bu nyid dang tha mal dag kyang ngo /
translated: In the three realms, born from peaceful and wrathful actions, he is a man and an ordinary being.

original: 98 / nyi ma gung dang mtshan mo phyed nas nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su de dag gi ni za ba'i dus //
analyzed: 98 / nyi ma gung dang mtshan mo phyed nas nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su de dag gi ni za ba'i dus //
translated: At noon and midnight, the time of day and night, is the time for their meals.

original: bza' ba zan dang ba lang sha ste btung ba rnam mang bcud ster dag dang sgo nga'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba zan dang ba lang sha ste btung ba rnam mang bcud ster dag dang sgo nga'i khu ba'o //
translated: Their food is rice and beef, their drink is various nutritious juices and egg-wine.

original: gos ni dmar dang dkar po dag dang nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin du mtho ris sa 'og gnas //
analyzed: gos ni dmar dang dkar po dag dang nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin du mtho ris sa 'og gnas //
translated: Their clothes are red and white, and they live in the upper and lower regions, like the courses of the sun and moon.

original: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ba yang ste bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis rdo rje lha min gdan yang ngo /
analyzed: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ba yang ste bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis rdo rje lha min gdan yang ngo /
translated: Their religion is non-violence and violence, and by the power of the guruâ€™s command, the vajra and the seat of the asura.

original: 99 /'byung po rnams kyi las ni 'dren mar rab tu 'gyur te tshig kyang 'dres pa sha za dag gi'o //
analyzed: 99 /'byung po rnams kyi las ni 'dren mar rab tu 'gyur te tshig kyang 'dres pa sha za dag gi'o //
translated: The actions of the bhÅ«tas are mixed, and their speech is mixed, that of the piÅ›Äcas.

original: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ldan nges par bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis srog gcod la sogs skyon dag la //
analyzed: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ldan nges par bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis srog gcod la sogs skyon dag la //
translated: By the power of the guruâ€™s command, their religion is non-violence and violence, and by the power of the guruâ€™s command, the faults of killing and so forth,

original: mchod sbyin la sogs don du rab tu 'jug 'gyur mi yi bdag po res 'ga' dag ni ldog pa 'am //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs don du rab tu 'jug 'gyur mi yi bdag po res 'ga' dag ni ldog pa 'am //
translated: for the sake of sacrifice and so forth, are engaged in, and sometimes the lords of men turn back.

original: bza' ba btung ba dag kyang 'dres pa nyi zla'i bgrod pa dag las lam ni 'dren ma gzhan du'o /
analyzed: bza' ba btung ba dag kyang 'dres pa nyi zla'i bgrod pa dag las lam ni 'dren ma gzhan du'o /
translated: The path of the sun and moon is mixed, and the path of the planets is different.

original: 100 /'od zer lam ni nyi ma'i snang ba dkar po nyin mo bgrod pa byang dang lho yi phyed dag kyang //
analyzed: 100 /'od zer lam ni nyi ma'i snang ba dkar po nyin mo bgrod pa byang dang lho yi phyed dag kyang //
translated: The path of the sunâ€™s rays is the northern and southern half of the day, the white light of the sun.

original: zla ba'i snang ba mtshan mo dag dang dkar min bgrod pa 'di ni lho ste du ba dag gi lam //
analyzed: zla ba'i snang ba mtshan mo dag dang dkar min bgrod pa 'di ni lho ste du ba dag gi lam //
translated: The path of the moon is the southern and northern half of the night, the light of the moon.

original: 'od zer lha rnams mtho ris su ste dkar min dag kyang de bzhin lha min klu yi 'jig rten @29b du ;
analyzed: 'od zer lha rnams mtho ris su ste dkar min dag kyang de bzhin lha min klu yi 'jig rten @29b du ;
translated: The rays of the sun are in the heavens of the gods, and the moon is in the world of the asuras and nÄgas.

original: / kun tu 'dres pa mi bdag mi yi 'jig rten du ni yi dags dud 'gro mi rnams dag gir 'gyur /
analyzed: / kun tu 'dres pa mi bdag mi yi 'jig rten du ni yi dags dud 'gro mi rnams dag gir 'gyur /
translated: The mixed [rays] are in the human world, the world of humans, the lord of men, the pretas, and animals.

original: 101 / gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab zhugs brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas nges bcings pa //
analyzed: 101 / gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab zhugs brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas nges bcings pa //
translated: Whoever enters the middle of that, bound by the noose of karma, is bound by the joy of the vow of discipline.

original: de yi dbus su rang rang bsam pas mi bdag de yi rigs su de yi 'dzin pa dag gir 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dbus su rang rang bsam pas mi bdag de yi rigs su de yi 'dzin pa dag gir 'gyur //
translated: In the middle of that, by oneâ€™s own thought, the king of that family is born in the grasping of that.

original: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal ba //
translated: As long as the nature of the mind is threefold, by the power of existence, there is the feeling of pleasure and pain.

original: de srid 'jigs rung 'khor ba 'dir 'khyam mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang /
analyzed: de srid 'jigs rung 'khor ba 'dir 'khyam mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang /
translated: For that long, O Lord of men, one wanders in this fearful saá¹ƒsÄra, above, below, and in the human realm.

original: 102 / ka sogs sde rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa dag kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur gang yang phyogs gsum dag gi dbyangs //
analyzed: 102 / ka sogs sde rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa dag kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur gang yang phyogs gsum dag gi dbyangs //
translated: The consonants beginning with ka, along with the vowels, are transformed by the qualities, and are the sounds of the three directions.

original: nges par sum cu'i gsal byed de dag rnams las rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: nges par sum cu'i gsal byed de dag rnams las rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas rgyu ba ste //
translated: The thirty consonants are definitely the movement of death by the power of the three transits.ğŸ”½The feet of the five planets, the feet of the sun and moon, and the feet of RÄhu and Ketu,

original: gza' lnga'i rkang pa nyi ma ri bong can gyi rkang pa dag dang sgra gcan mjug rings rkang pa dang // sum cu rtsa gnyis lo dang phyogs kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur zla ba nyi ma me yis phye ba'o /
analyzed: gza' lnga'i rkang pa nyi ma ri bong can gyi rkang pa dag dang sgra gcan mjug rings rkang pa dang // sum cu rtsa gnyis lo dang phyogs kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur zla ba nyi ma me yis phye ba'o /
translated: are divided by the thirty-two years and the directions, and by the qualities, the sun and moon, and fire.

original: 103 / lo gsum gyis ni phyogs rnams dag dang ri bong can gyi yon tan dus kyi me yi phyogs gnyis dag / lo brgya las ni dman gyur lhag ma'i phyogs ni nyi zla dag gi mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la //
analyzed: 103 / lo gsum gyis ni phyogs rnams dag dang ri bong can gyi yon tan dus kyi me yi phyogs gnyis dag / lo brgya las ni dman gyur lhag ma'i phyogs ni nyi zla dag gi mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la //
translated: The hundred years are the remaining terms of the zodiac, Taurus, Virgo, Scorpio, and Aquarius.

original: 'jig rten mig dang me mig grangs te nyin mtshan dus rnams gtso bo dag gis dman pa mtha' dag ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten mig dang me mig grangs te nyin mtshan dus rnams gtso bo dag gis dman pa mtha' dag ste //
translated: The days and nights are the two eyes of the world, the sun and the moon.

original: gsal byed la sogs ste pa dbyangs rnams dag ni nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas zos /
analyzed: gsal byed la sogs ste pa dbyangs rnams dag ni nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas zos /
translated: The vowels and consonants are devoured by death by the power of the movement of the sun and moon.

original: 104 / phyed bcas 'khor lo'i chu tshod ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang bral gza' yi chu tshod rnams dman pa //
analyzed: 104 / phyed bcas 'khor lo'i chu tshod ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang bral gza' yi chu tshod rnams dman pa //
translated: The half-hours of the wheel are devoured by death by the power of the lunar mansions and planets.

original: de dag rnams kyang shes rab thabs kyi rab tu dbye pa dag gis nyin mtshan dus kyis 'chi bas zos //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang shes rab thabs kyi rab tu dbye pa dag gis nyin mtshan dus kyis 'chi bas zos //
translated: They are also devoured by death by the power of the day and night.

original: de ltar sde pa dbyangs bcas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa gsal byed rnams nyid dag dang rkang pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar sde pa dbyangs bcas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa gsal byed rnams nyid dag dang rkang pa ni //
translated: Thus, the classes of consonants and vowels are the consonants and the lunar mansions.

original: dman dang bar ma dus 'chi zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ba dang ni gsal byed lhag pa'i lha la'o /
analyzed: dman dang bar ma dus 'chi zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ba dang ni gsal byed lhag pa'i lha la'o /
translated: The inferior and middling deaths are the death of the moon, the death of the sun, and the death of the vowels and the extra consonants.

original: 105 / sum cu gnyis dang nyin zhag gcig kyang ri bong can bcas nyi ma'i bgrod la rtsa ni gcod pa 'di //
analyzed: 105 / sum cu gnyis dang nyin zhag gcig kyang ri bong can bcas nyi ma'i bgrod la rtsa ni gcod pa 'di //
translated: The thirty-two [channels] and the one day and night are the cutting of the channels in the movement of the sun with the moon.

original: slar yang sum cu mtshan mo gsum gyis rdo @30a * //
analyzed: slar yang sum cu mtshan mo gsum gyis rdo @30a * //
translated: Again, the thirty [channels] and three nights are the cutting of the channels in the movement of the moon with the sun.

original: rje dang bcas phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs 'dor //
analyzed: rje dang bcas phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs 'dor //
translated: Then, together with the sun, one should cast off the aggregates, elements, faculties, and so on.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa dag dor nas dung can mar ni srog gi rlung dag nyin gcig rab 'jug ste //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa dag dor nas dung can mar ni srog gi rlung dag nyin gcig rab 'jug ste //
translated: Having cast off the channels of the moon and sun, the life vÄyu enters the conch shell for one day.

original: sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i khams ni rnam par chad pa ji srid nyid du'o /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i khams ni rnam par chad pa ji srid nyid du'o /
translated: For as long as the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space are cut off.

original: 106 / dang por mtha' dag rgyal ba'i lus ni dngos grub rgyu ru sngags pa dag gis yang dag bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: 106 / dang por mtha' dag rgyal ba'i lus ni dngos grub rgyu ru sngags pa dag gis yang dag bsrung bar bya //
translated: First, the complete body of the Victor is truly protected by the mantra practitioner as the cause of spiritual powers.

original: lus med na ni dngos grub med cing skye ba 'di la mchog gi bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'ang med //
analyzed: lus med na ni dngos grub med cing skye ba 'di la mchog gi bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'ang med //
translated: If there is no body, there are no spiritual powers, and there is no attainment of the supreme bliss in this life.

original: de phyir lus kyi don gyi rgyur ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa yi sbyor ba bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de phyir lus kyi don gyi rgyur ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa yi sbyor ba bsgom par bya //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of the body's goal, one should meditate on the union of the channels at each day's time.

original: lus ni grub na gzhan pa'i dngos grub srid pa gsum gyi gnas su mngag gzhug nyid du rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: lus ni grub na gzhan pa'i dngos grub srid pa gsum gyi gnas su mngag gzhug nyid du rab tu 'gyur /
translated: When the body is accomplished, the other accomplishments are fully present in the three worlds.

original: 107 / stong pa la ni du ba sogs lam bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis gzugs brnyan mtshams su bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 107 / stong pa la ni du ba sogs lam bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis gzugs brnyan mtshams su bsgom par bya //
translated: In the empty, one should meditate on the image by the power of the definite path of smoke, etc.

original: de nas rtsa yi 'khor lo rnams su srog dang thur sel rlung ni brtan pa dag kyang byed pa ste //
analyzed: de nas rtsa yi 'khor lo rnams su srog dang thur sel rlung ni brtan pa dag kyang byed pa ste //
translated: Then, the yogi should also stabilize the life-force and downward-voiding winds in the channel cakras.

original: phyi nas zla pa  des par 'gog pa gza' bzhin byed de byang chub sems ni rnal 'byor pa yis so //
analyzed: phyi nas zla pa  des par 'gog pa gza' bzhin byed de byang chub sems ni rnal 'byor pa yis so //
translated: Afterwards, the yogi should stop the moon and sun as if they were planets.

original: de nas gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa dag ni nyin zhag 'ga' yis skye ba 'di la thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nas gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa dag ni nyin zhag 'ga' yis skye ba 'di la thob par 'gyur /
translated: Then, whatever is desired is attained in this life in a few days.

original: 108 / nyi ma zla ba 'gog pa mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la ste dbu ma me la rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: 108 / nyi ma zla ba 'gog pa mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la ste dbu ma me la rab tu zhugs //
translated: The stopping of the sun and moon is the equal and unequal journey, the entry into the fire of the central channel.

original: srog dang thur sel gnyis po dag kyang nyin zhag dang po sod  na dus min 'chi ba slu pa ste //
analyzed: srog dang thur sel gnyis po dag kyang nyin zhag dang po sod  na dus min 'chi ba slu pa ste //
translated: If the life and downward-voiding vÄyus are stopped in the first day, untimely death is averted.

original: lag pa dang bcas rkang pa'i sor mo'i tshigs dang sen mo'i mthar ni srog gis kun tu gang byas nas //
analyzed: lag pa dang bcas rkang pa'i sor mo'i tshigs dang sen mo'i mthar ni srog gis kun tu gang byas nas //
translated: The life-sustaining vÄyu fills the fingers, toes, joints, and nails with the life-sustaining vÄyu.

original: 'khor lo drug la sangs rgyas lha mo 'jigs med lag pa'i padma rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya /
analyzed: 'khor lo drug la sangs rgyas lha mo 'jigs med lag pa'i padma rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya /
translated: The yogi/nÄ« should meditate on the six cakras, the buddhas, the goddesses, and the fearless hands.

original: 109 / thur sel bskum na 'dod par 'gyur te lus mchog dag la rlung gi nad ni ma lus dag la'o //ğŸ”½srog rtsol dag ni bad kan la 'gyur slar yang de dag gtong ba mkhris pa dag gi skyon la'o //
analyzed: 109 / thur sel bskum na 'dod par 'gyur te lus mchog dag la rlung gi nad ni ma lus dag la'o // srog rtsol dag ni bad kan la 'gyur slar yang de dag gtong ba mkhris pa dag gi skyon la'o //
translated: When the downward-voiding vÄyu is contracted, it is for the purpose of desire, for the purpose of all vÄyu disorders in the body,ğŸ”½and for the purpose of all phlegm disorders.

original: steng dang 'og ni yang dag 'gog pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te 'dus pa dag dang rims la'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og ni yang dag 'gog pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te 'dus pa dag dang rims la'o //
translated: When the upper and lower [vÄyus] are stopped, it is for the purpose of bliss, for the purpose of all disorders of the humors, and for the purpose of all fevers.

original: lte ba'i steng du srog gi rlung ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog lte ba'i rtsa bar gzhan pa dag kyang ngo /
analyzed: lte ba'i steng du srog gi rlung ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog lte ba'i rtsa bar gzhan pa dag kyang ngo /
translated: The life-sustaining vÄyu above the navel steals away all illnesses.

original: 110 / bskum ste thur sel rlung ni rnam pa gsum gyi lam du bgrod pa dag dang srog nyid steng nas kyang //
analyzed: 110 / bskum ste thur sel rlung ni rnam pa gsum gyi lam du bgrod pa dag dang srog nyid steng nas kyang //
translated: The downward-voiding vÄyu contracts and travels on the path of the three nÄá¸Ä«s.

original: ji @30b srid yang dag phrad de me ni stobs dang ldan zhing lus kun la ni khyab par rab 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji @30b srid yang dag phrad de me ni stobs dang ldan zhing lus kun la ni khyab par rab 'gyur ba //
translated: As long as the vÄyu and mind meet correctly, the fire becomes strong and spreads throughout the body.

original: dmu chu skran dang gzhang 'brum nad rnams dag kyang lto bar son pa zla ba'i sbyor bas 'joms pa ste //
analyzed: dmu chu skran dang gzhang 'brum nad rnams dag kyang lto bar son pa zla ba'i sbyor bas 'joms pa ste //
translated: Ascites, tumors, hemorrhoids, and so on, that have entered the stomach are destroyed by the union of the moon.

original: dbugs lud dang ni glo dang rnam pa gsum gyi dug dang mig gi nad la sogs pa dag kyang ngo /
analyzed: dbugs lud dang ni glo dang rnam pa gsum gyi dug dang mig gi nad la sogs pa dag kyang ngo /
translated: Also, the three types of asthma, cough, poison, eye disease, and so on, are destroyed.ğŸ”½The two breasts are pressed with the strong [vÄyus] of the right and left armpits.

original: 111 / mchan khung g-yas dang g-yas min las ni nu ma dag kyang stobs ldan mnan te srog ni bkag pa las //
analyzed: 111 / mchan khung g-yas dang g-yas min las ni nu ma dag kyang stobs ldan mnan te srog ni bkag pa las //
translated: The life-upholding [vÄyu] is blocked.

original: g-yas nas g-yon pa'i rtsar ni 'phral la rab tu 'bab ste g-yon pa'i mchan khung las kyang g-yas su'o //
analyzed: g-yas nas g-yon pa'i rtsar ni 'phral la rab tu 'bab ste g-yon pa'i mchan khung las kyang g-yas su'o //
translated: Immediately, the [vÄyu] moves from the right to the left nÄá¸Ä«, and from the left armpit to the right.

original: zla ba phyed kyis kyang ni 'chi ster 'chi ltas 'phrog ste rnal 'byor ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa yis so //
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyis kyang ni 'chi ster 'chi ltas 'phrog ste rnal 'byor ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa yis so //
translated: Even half a month destroys the signs of death and takes away death.

original: rdo rje skyil krung du gnas rkang pa gzung pa lag pa'i padmo dag ni rgyab kyi zug rngu 'joms /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung du gnas rkang pa gzung pa lag pa'i padmo dag ni rgyab kyi zug rngu 'joms /
translated: Sitting in the vajra posture, holding the feet with the lotus of the hands, he conquers the pain in the back.

original: 119 / steng du rkang pa dag dang 'og tu mgo bo lus la bad kan nad rnams mtha' dag 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: 119 / steng du rkang pa dag dang 'og tu mgo bo lus la bad kan nad rnams mtha' dag 'phrog par byed //
translated: With the feet above and the head below, he takes away all the phlegm diseases of the body.

original: srog 'gog pa las nyin zhag 'ga' zhig gis ni rab 'khru gci ba'i nad dag nges par 'joms par byed //
analyzed: srog 'gog pa las nyin zhag 'ga' zhig gis ni rab 'khru gci ba'i nad dag nges par 'joms par byed //
translated: By stopping the life-force, in a few days he certainly conquers the diseases of dysentery and diarrhea.

original: tho rangs ming med dag gis chu dang bral ba'i khar ni so yi phreng ba dag la rab bdar ba //
analyzed: tho rangs ming med dag gis chu dang bral ba'i khar ni so yi phreng ba dag la rab bdar ba //
translated: In the morning, with the ring fingers he cleans the teeth, which are free from water,

original: mig rnams dag gi mig sman du 'gyur slar yang nad ni 'phrog pa chu yis gtor ba dag kyang ngo /
analyzed: mig rnams dag gi mig sman du 'gyur slar yang nad ni 'phrog pa chu yis gtor ba dag kyang ngo /
translated: and they become an eye-medicine for the eyes, and again he takes away the disease by sprinkling with water.

original: 113 / gan rkyal nyal nas lte ba lag pa'i padmas gzung ba dag ni ma zhu ba yi zug rngu 'joms //
analyzed: 113 / gan rkyal nyal nas lte ba lag pa'i padmas gzung ba dag ni ma zhu ba yi zug rngu 'joms //
translated: Lying on his back, holding the navel with the lotus of the hand, he conquers the pain of indigestion.

original: 'bras rnams 'byung ba la ni nges par mar dang bcas pa'i tshva yis bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms par byed //
analyzed: 'bras rnams 'byung ba la ni nges par mar dang bcas pa'i tshva yis bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms par byed //
translated: For the arising of hemorrhoids, if he fumigates with salt and clarified butter, he conquers the increase.

original: de nas aa rka'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang ngo 'ga' zhig tshe na so srin zug rngu bcas 'gyur na //
analyzed: de nas aa rka'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang ngo 'ga' zhig tshe na so srin zug rngu bcas 'gyur na //
translated: Then, by anointing with the milk of a she-goat, the teeth are free of decay and pain.

original: stag ldan gyi ni sa bon du ba sbubs la sogs pa dag gis 'dir bzung srin bu la sogs 'joms /
analyzed: stag ldan gyi ni sa bon du ba sbubs la sogs pa dag gis 'dir bzung srin bu la sogs 'joms /
translated: The seed of a tiger claw, etc., held in the mouth, destroys worms, etc.

original: 114 / lo phyed kyis ni sngags pa rnams kyi mchog gi lus la dkar ba'i mdze 'phrog de las gzhan lta ci //
analyzed: 114 / lo phyed kyis ni sngags pa rnams kyi mchog gi lus la dkar ba'i mdze 'phrog de las gzhan lta ci //
translated: In half a year, the best of mantra adepts will steal away white leprosy from the body; what need to mention others.

original: shes rab 'dus la rang sems lhung ba dag kyang rtag tu srog gi rlung gis 'gog pa dag las te //ğŸ”½bdun cu'i lo yi rga pa skra dkar bcas pa dag kyang lo gnyis rab tu rdzogs na nges par 'phrog / nyi ma 'ga' yis lam dang sems ni rab tu 'grogs pa dag las de steng phyag @31a * //
analyzed: shes rab 'dus la rang sems lhung ba dag kyang rtag tu srog gi rlung gis 'gog pa dag las te // bdun cu'i lo yi rga pa skra dkar bcas pa dag kyang lo gnyis rab tu rdzogs na nges par 'phrog / nyi ma 'ga' yis lam dang sems ni rab tu 'grogs pa dag las de steng phyag @31a * //
translated: The falling of oneâ€™s mind into the union of wisdom and method is always blocked by the life-force wind.ğŸ”½Even one who is seventy years old, with white hair, will certainly steal it away in two years, if he is diligent.

original: rgya'i dngos grub 'gyur /
analyzed: rgya'i dngos grub 'gyur /
translated: In a few days, the mind is well-oriented to the path, and from that, the power of the seal is attained.

original: 115 / srog rtsol rab tu bya ste snying ga de bzhin mgo bo dag ni ji srid me yis gdung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 115 / srog rtsol rab tu bya ste snying ga de bzhin mgo bo dag ni ji srid me yis gdung 'gyur ba //
translated: One should practice the life-force wind, and the heart and head are warmed by the fire for as long as one wishes.

original: de las steng dag tu ni bzang po'i padmar brgyal bar 'gyur te ma bsdams pa'am stobs dag gis //
analyzed: de las steng dag tu ni bzang po'i padmar brgyal bar 'gyur te ma bsdams pa'am stobs dag gis //
translated: Above that, in the lotus of the good, he swoons, either through lack of control or through the powers.

original: gtsug tor phug cing phung po dag dang khams rnams rnam par spangs nas 'chi ba nyid du 'gro 'gyur te //
analyzed: gtsug tor phug cing phung po dag dang khams rnams rnam par spangs nas 'chi ba nyid du 'gro 'gyur te //
translated: Piercing the fontanel, abandoning the aggregates and elements, he goes to death.

original: phyag rgya 'grogs pa rab nyams skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la ni bde 'bras ster ba med /
analyzed: phyag rgya 'grogs pa rab nyams skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la ni bde 'bras ster ba med /
translated: The companion of the seal, the complete degeneration, does not give the fruit of happiness in this very life of men.

original: 116 / phyag rgya bsgom pa'i don du gsungs te nyin mtshan dus su chags pa zad pa'i don ni min pa nyid //
analyzed: 116 / phyag rgya bsgom pa'i don du gsungs te nyin mtshan dus su chags pa zad pa'i don ni min pa nyid //
translated: It is said for the purpose of cultivating the seal, not for the purpose of the exhaustion of passion at the time of day and night.

analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje mchod pa'i don te nges par sngags pa rnams la myos byed gsungs pa nyid ma yin //
translated: The meaning of worship of Vaktravajra, is certainly not the teaching of liquor for the mantrin.

analyzed: kha zas thams cad bde ba'i don te nyin zhag so so'i dus su ma zhu'i rgyur yang ma gsungs so //
translated: All food is for the purpose of happiness, and is not said to be the cause of indigestion at each time of day.

original: dpal ldan spyod pa dngos grub rgyur te mtshan ma dur khrod 'khyam pa dag kyang rtsed mo'i don ma yin /
analyzed: dpal ldan spyod pa dngos grub rgyur te mtshan ma dur khrod 'khyam pa dag kyang rtsed mo'i don ma yin /
translated: The glorious conduct is for the sake of spiritual powers, and wandering in the charnel grounds with signs is not for the sake of play.

original: 117 / mi bskyod pa ni cung zad dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed de so yi zug rngu nyid kyi yang //
analyzed: 117 / mi bskyod pa ni cung zad dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed de so yi zug rngu nyid kyi yang //
translated: The â€œunshakeableâ€ is a little warm, and it cures toothache.

original: tho rangs mi bskyod rngubs pa dag ni mgo yi nad 'phrog de bzhin nyid du chu ni rngubs pas so //
analyzed: tho rangs mi bskyod rngubs pa dag ni mgo yi nad 'phrog de bzhin nyid du chu ni rngubs pas so //
translated: At dawn, the â€œunshakeableâ€ inhaled cures headache, and likewise by inhaling water.

original: rna ba dag dang mig tu gcin ni dro dang grang mo rab blugs gnyis ka dag gi nad 'phrog go //
analyzed: rna ba dag dang mig tu gcin ni dro dang grang mo rab blugs gnyis ka dag gi nad 'phrog go //
translated: Warm and cold urine poured into the ears and eyes cures diseases of both.

original: 'byung pos gzir la tsha ba gsum bcas mi bskyod rngubs na bde ba ster te zos pa nyid la yang /
analyzed: 'byung pos gzir la tsha ba gsum bcas mi bskyod rngubs na bde ba ster te zos pa nyid la yang /
translated: Inhaled with the three hot things, the â€œunshakeableâ€ gives relief to one oppressed by spirits, and also by eating it.

original: 118 / bshang ba gcin dang khu ba khrag ni mi yi sha dang bcas pa zos pas tshe ni ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 118 / bshang ba gcin dang khu ba khrag ni mi yi sha dang bcas pa zos pas tshe ni ster bar 'gyur //
translated: By eating feces, urine, semen, blood, and human flesh, one is granted life.

original: bsam gtan bcas par me tog rngubs na skra dkar dang bcas rga ba dang ni lus skyes rnams kyang 'phrog / sgron ma lnga po sbrang bu'i skyugs pa dag dang bsres pa zos pas mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog pa ste //
analyzed: bsam gtan bcas par me tog rngubs na skra dkar dang bcas rga ba dang ni lus skyes rnams kyang 'phrog / sgron ma lnga po sbrang bu'i skyugs pa dag dang bsres pa zos pas mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog pa ste //
translated: By inhaling flowers with concentration, one removes gray hair, old age, and bodily diseases. By eating the five lamps mixed with bee vomit, one removes all diseases.

analyzed: bud med me tog khu ba dag dang bsres pa lo gcig zos na rga ba nges par sel bar byed /
translated: One who eats for one year a compound of the juice of the flower of the woman and salt is freed from old age.

original: 119 / rlung 'joms lan tshva skyur bdag tu rab tu 'gyur te mngar dang bska ba dag ni mkhris pa'i dgra //
analyzed: 119 / rlung 'joms lan tshva skyur bdag tu rab tu 'gyur te mngar dang bska ba dag ni mkhris pa'i dgra //
translated: Salt is the best for destroying wind, and sweet and astringent are the enemies of bile.

original: bad kan 'joms pa kha ba kun dang de bzhin tsha ba dag kyang sman rnams sam ni khu ba'am //ğŸ”½bad kan 'joms pa  ra yi 'o ma tsha ba gsum bcas dag ste ma he'i 'o ma mkhris pa'i dgra //
analyzed: bad kan 'joms pa kha ba kun dang de bzhin tsha ba dag kyang sman rnams sam ni khu ba'am // bad kan 'joms pa  ra yi 'o ma tsha ba gsum bcas dag ste ma he'i 'o ma mkhris pa'i dgra //
translated: All that is bitter destroys phlegm, and likewise all that is hot.ğŸ”½Cowâ€™s milk destroys phlegm, and the milk of a buffalo is the enemy of bile.
