analyzed: rlung 'joms dag @31b kyang rnga mo'i 'o ma rnam gsum nad 'phrog pa yi 'o ma dang ni de bzhin mar /
translated: The milk of a camel destroys wind, and likewise the milk of a three-uddered cow and the oil.

original: 120 / dz'a ti bskol ba'i chu ni dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed de so yi zug rngu nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: 120 / dz'a ti bskol ba'i chu ni dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed de so yi zug rngu nyid kyang ngo //
translated: Warm water in which nutmeg has been boiled allays mouth diseases and toothaches.

original: til mar dngos po'i chu bskol tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva dag gis rna ba yi ni nad dag 'joms //
analyzed: til mar dngos po'i chu bskol tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva dag gis rna ba yi ni nad dag 'joms //
translated: Oil of sesamum boiled with water and the three hot spices and salt destroys ear diseases.

analyzed: mar dang 'o ma bskol bar gyur pa klu dang dmar po dag gis rtag tu sna yi nad dag 'joms //

original: ka rko t'i dang l'a ng+ga li dang ai ndr'i bong bu'i chur bcas byugs pas 'bras kyi phreng ba 'phrog 121 / lag pa dag ni rab 'phyang rkang pa'i padma mnyam pa dag dang srog gi rlung ni 'gog bya ste //
analyzed: ka rko t'i dang l'a ng+ga li dang ai ndr'i bong bu'i chur bcas byugs pas 'bras kyi phreng ba 'phrog 121 / lag pa dag ni rab 'phyang rkang pa'i padma mnyam pa dag dang srog gi rlung ni 'gog bya ste //
translated: Hanging down the hands, the lotuses of the feet are even, and the prÄá¹‡a wind is stopped.

analyzed: ji srid lus ni sa la rab tu lhung bar ma gyur pa dang tsha ba dag ni grol bar yang //
translated: As long as the body does not fall to the ground, and the hot [bile] is released,

original: yang dang yang du ting nge 'dzin la'o 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i tsher ma can ni nges 'joms te //
analyzed: yang dang yang du ting nge 'dzin la'o 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i tsher ma can ni nges 'joms te //
translated: again and again, in samÄdhi, the fear of death, the thorn, is definitely destroyed.

original: snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i gzugs can dri med ri bong can mtshungs sna tshogs yum ni bsgoms pas so /
analyzed: snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i gzugs can dri med ri bong can mtshungs sna tshogs yum ni bsgoms pas so /
translated: Meditating on the mother of variety, the form of the moon in the heart lotus, stainless like the rabbit.

analyzed: 122 / sran chung btags nas 'thungs pas tsha bas rnam par bsnun pa'i mi rnams kyi ni tsher ma 'joms par byed //
translated: Having ground and drunk beans, the thorns of those afflicted by hot [bile] are destroyed.

original: tsha ba'i mthar ni thod pa bdar ba mi bskyod bsres pa yis kyang 'jigs par byed pa 'phrog pa ste //ğŸ”½sngags kyang chu me rlung rnams dag gi sngon du aom yig dang ni ba dzra snga ma dag gi ming //ğŸ”½de nyid kyis ni bsrung bar bya ste mgo mgrin snying ga lte ba gsang ba la sogs rnams su'o /
analyzed: tsha ba'i mthar ni thod pa bdar ba mi bskyod bsres pa yis kyang 'jigs par byed pa 'phrog pa ste // sngags kyang chu me rlung rnams dag gi sngon du aom yig dang ni ba dzra snga ma dag gi ming // de nyid kyis ni bsrung bar bya ste mgo mgrin snying ga lte ba gsang ba la sogs rnams su'o /

original: khrus sam yan lag byug pa dag las myos byed me tog til mar nyid ni smin pa min par 'gyur /
analyzed: khrus sam yan lag byug pa dag las myos byed me tog til mar nyid ni smin pa min par 'gyur /
translated: From the bath or the anointment of the limbs, the intoxicating flower oil will not be ripe.ğŸ”½The earth, the sun, the moon, the eyes of Manu, desire, wealth, Rudra, the king, fire,

original: 139 / sa 'dzin nyi ma zla ba ma nu mig dang 'dod pa nor dang drag po rgyal po me dag dang // phyogs dang 'byung ba bug pa drug dang  tshes dang chu gter dag ni mtha' yi re mig la gzhag bya //
analyzed: 139 / sa 'dzin nyi ma zla ba ma nu mig dang 'dod pa nor dang drag po rgyal po me dag dang // phyogs dang 'byung ba bug pa drug dang  tshes dang chu gter dag ni mtha' yi re mig la gzhag bya //
translated: the directions, the elements, the six orifices, the lunar days, and the oceans are placed in the outer squares.

original: grangs ni re mig bzhi yis chu yi gter dang rtse mo can te dpal ldan 'khor lo mtha' dag ni //
analyzed: grangs ni re mig bzhi yis chu yi gter dang rtse mo can te dpal ldan 'khor lo mtha' dag ni //
translated: The number is four, the ocean, and the peak, the entire glorious wheel.

original: tshad kyi rgyab tu bris nas rab tu btsa' bar 'gyur ba'i dus su sbrum ma rnams la bstan par bya /
analyzed: tshad kyi rgyab tu bris nas rab tu btsa' bar 'gyur ba'i dus su sbrum ma rnams la bstan par bya /
translated: Having written the measure on the back, it should be shown to pregnant women at the time of delivery.

original: 140 / rnal 'byor ma rnams gang dag rab gsal @33b sa gzhi dag la brgyad pa brgyad kyi ma mor rab tu grags //
analyzed: 140 / rnal 'byor ma rnams gang dag rab gsal @33b sa gzhi dag la brgyad pa brgyad kyi ma mor rab tu grags //
translated: Those yoginis are well known as the eight mothers on the well-illuminated ground.

original: mngal zhes bya dang nyin zhag ces bya sum 'gyur dgu dang bcu ste bcu gcig gzhan ni lnga pa gsum //
analyzed: mngal zhes bya dang nyin zhag ces bya sum 'gyur dgu dang bcu ste bcu gcig gzhan ni lnga pa gsum //
translated: The womb, the day, the triple, the nine, the ten, the eleven, the other, the five,

original: zla ba zhes dang lo zhes bya ste mtha' dag sa yi steng du de dag byis pa rab tu 'dzin //
analyzed: zla ba zhes dang lo zhes bya ste mtha' dag sa yi steng du de dag byis pa rab tu 'dzin //
translated: the month, and the year-all of them hold the child on the surface of the earth.

original: mngal du zug rngu dang ni rab tu btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas la yang zug gzer byed pa nyid /
analyzed: mngal du zug rngu dang ni rab tu btsa' ba'i dus su skye gnas la yang zug gzer byed pa nyid /
translated: Pain in the womb, pain at the time of delivery, and pain in the birth canal,

original: 141 / skyes pa rnams la byis pa'i rgyud du 'gyur te nyin zhag dbang dang zla ba lo yi rab dbye las //
analyzed: 141 / skyes pa rnams la byis pa'i rgyud du 'gyur te nyin zhag dbang dang zla ba lo yi rab dbye las //
translated: pain in the newborn, and pain in the continuum of the child arise from the power of the day, the month, and the year.

original: ma rungs gzhon nu lnga rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis tshigs mtshams dag la yang dag gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: ma rungs gzhon nu lnga rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis tshigs mtshams dag la yang dag gnas gyur pa //
translated: The five unruly young men, by the power of their natural qualities, are well-established in the junctions.

original: thams cad rang gi tshes la 'jigs gyur byis pa 'dzin par byed de rgyal po nges par gtong mi byed //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi tshes la 'jigs gyur byis pa 'dzin par byed de rgyal po nges par gtong mi byed //
translated: All of them, frightened of their own lunar days, are seized by the child, and the king certainly does not release them.

original: de dag zhi ba'i don du 'dir ni rnam mang dkyil 'khor khrus dang sbyin sreg dag tu rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag zhi ba'i don du 'dir ni rnam mang dkyil 'khor khrus dang sbyin sreg dag tu rab tu 'gyur /
translated: For their pacification, here there are many maá¹‡á¸alas, ablutions, and homa rites.

original: 142 / ru rta au s'i ra dang ka se ru ste ta ka ra dang autpala 'dam skyes ge sar ni //
analyzed: 142 / ru rta au s'i ra dang ka se ru ste ta ka ra dang autpala 'dam skyes ge sar ni //
translated: Ruru, usirara, kaseru, takara, and the filaments of the utpala lotus

original: bsil ba'i chu yis btags shing rdo rje yis ni bsngags pa dag kyang mngal gyi zug rngu la rab sbyin //
analyzed: bsil ba'i chu yis btags shing rdo rje yis ni bsngags pa dag kyang mngal gyi zug rngu la rab sbyin //
translated: are ground with cool water and consecrated with the vajra, and also given for the pain of the womb.

original: mngal ni rengs na na ku la dang gtsug phud can gyi spu brgyad btags nas rab tu sbyin par bya //
analyzed: mngal ni rengs na na ku la dang gtsug phud can gyi spu brgyad btags nas rab tu sbyin par bya //

original: 'o ma mar dang thug pa zan ni zho dang bu ram bcas pa nyin zhag ma rnams dag la sbyin /
analyzed: 'o ma mar dang thug pa zan ni zho dang bu ram bcas pa nyin zhag ma rnams dag la sbyin /
translated: Milk, ghee, porridge, and rice with curd and sugar are given on the lunar days.

original: 143 / smin pa'i zas lnga tha dad zho dang bu ram dang bcas po li ka dang mo da ka dag dang // dri dang me tog mar me bkru ba dag kyang 'dab ma rnams kyis mtshan mo lnga ni rab tu bya //

original: ba lang so dang lug gi rva dang ri dags sen mo skra dang sbrul gyi shun pa dag gi spos //
analyzed: ba lang so dang lug gi rva dang ri dags sen mo skra dang sbrul gyi shun pa dag gi spos //

analyzed: byis pa zla skyes rnams ni rgyas pa'i don du mtha' dag brjod pa rnams kyang gtor ma dag la'o /
translated: all of these are to be offered in the bali rites for the sake of the growth of the children born in the months.

original: 144 / bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga dang chu la rgyu ba sha dang dri dang me tog mar me dang // chang dang sngar brjod  sbos dang bkru  bdag dang de bzhin phyogs kyi gtor ma dag ni phyogs kyi char //
analyzed: 144 / bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga dang chu la rgyu ba sha dang dri dang me tog mar me dang // chang dang sngar brjod  sbos dang bkru  bdag dang de bzhin phyogs kyi gtor ma dag ni phyogs kyi char //
translated: The five foods, the five kinds of food, the meat of aquatic animals, the five perfumes, flowers, lamps, beer, the powders mentioned above, water, and likewise the bali offerings of the directions, are in the directions.

original: byis pa lor ni skyes pa rnams dag rab tu gsal bar sa la rgyas pa'i slad du mi yi dbang //
analyzed: byis pa lor ni skyes pa rnams dag rab tu gsal bar sa la rgyas pa'i slad du mi yi dbang //
translated: The lord of men should clearly offer these for the growth of the children born in the year on the ground.

original: mngal nas lo ni lnga pa gsum du nges par rnal 'byor ma rnams rab tu mchod pa dag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: mngal nas lo ni lnga pa gsum du nges par rnal 'byor ma rnams rab tu mchod pa dag tu 'gyur /
translated: The yogis and yoginis will certainly worship the one who is born in the fifth year.

original: 145 / yan lag rkyong zhing mig @34a * //
analyzed: 145 / yan lag rkyong zhing mig @34a * //

analyzed: gcin ni kha dog ser po dag dang tsha ba zhes pa dang ni skyug dang skam dang brgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: The urine is yellow, hot, and so forth, and there is vomiting, dryness, and fainting.

analyzed: mtshan ma rnams ni shes par gyur nas de rnams kyi yang mi bdag rgyur ni dkyil 'khor sbyin sreg bya ;
translated: Having understood the signs, the king should perform the mandala and homa for them.

analyzed: / ma byin na ni gtong bar mi 'gyur rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba las skyes ma mos kyang /

analyzed: de la mchod pa bya ba min te sngags pa rmongs pa rnams ni chung ngu nyid du rab tu 'gyur //

analyzed: de ni 'chi bar 'gyur te nges par lha dang mi dang lag 'gro rnams kyis bsrung bar nus pa min /

analyzed: 148 / ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor du 'gyur mi yi bdag po grong gi phyi rol du //
translated: For the sake of worshipping the wicked, the maá¹‡á¸ala should be made outside the town, O Lord of Men.

analyzed: shing gi gnas dang dur khrod dang ni lha mchog khang pa dag gam chu bo 'dus pa rnams su ste //
translated: In a place of trees, a charnel ground, a temple of a great god, or at the confluence of two rivers.

analyzed: khru gang dag gam gnyis dang bzhi ni dgu dang bcu gsum mi bdag lha rnams dag gi tshad kyis so //
translated: One cubit, two, four, nine, or thirteen cubits are the measures of the gods, O King.

original: dbus su rtsibs brgyad 'khor lor 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor dag las phyed kyi cha shas so /
analyzed: dbus su rtsibs brgyad 'khor lor 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor dag las phyed kyi cha shas so /
translated: In the center is an eight-spoked wheel, one-eighth of the maá¹‡á¸ala, according to the family.

original: 149 / sgo ni 'khor lo'i brgyad char 'gyur te nges par de yi phyed kyis kha khyer dag dang do shal lo //
analyzed: 149 / sgo ni 'khor lo'i brgyad char 'gyur te nges par de yi phyed kyis kha khyer dag dang do shal lo //
translated: The door is one-eighth of the wheel; the ledge and garland are definitely half of that.

original: ra ba dag ni kha khyer phyed de rta babs dag kyang sgo yi tshad las sum 'gyur dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: ra ba dag ni kha khyer phyed de rta babs dag kyang sgo yi tshad las sum 'gyur dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The wall is half of the ledge; the archways are three times the size of the door.

original: zlum po'i thab ni cha gsum padma dkar po'i rang bzhin dkar ba'i tshon rnams dag gis bkang ba ste //
analyzed: zlum po'i thab ni cha gsum padma dkar po'i rang bzhin dkar ba'i tshon rnams dag gis bkang ba ste //
translated: The round hearth is one-third, filled with white sand, the nature of white lotus.

original: @34b dpal ldan tshon lnga dag gis lha rnams kyi ni rang phyogs rigs kyi dbang gis rang gi mtshan ma bya /
analyzed: @34b dpal ldan tshon lnga dag gis lha rnams kyi ni rang phyogs rigs kyi dbang gis rang gi mtshan ma bya /
translated: The glorious ones, the deities, are marked with their own symbols, according to their own family and direction, with the five colors.

original: 150 / rdo rje dbus dang ral gri dbang por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lhor ni rin chen dmar po'o //
analyzed: 150 / rdo rje dbus dang ral gri dbang por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lhor ni rin chen dmar po'o //
translated: The vajra is in the center, the sword is in the east, and by the power of the family, the jewel is in the south.

original: g-yon du 'dab ma brgya dang bcas pa'i padma dkar po dag dang nub tu 'khor lo'i mtshan ma dang // mer ni gri gug nges par padma'i 'dab ma la gnas lha min zur du lcags kyu dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yon du 'dab ma brgya dang bcas pa'i padma dkar po dag dang nub tu 'khor lo'i mtshan ma dang // mer ni gri gug nges par padma'i 'dab ma la gnas lha min zur du lcags kyu dag tu 'gyur //
translated: In the west is the sign of the wheel, and in the southeast is the curved knife definitely on a lotus petal.

original: rlung du rdo rje zhags par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po drag po'i 'dab ma dag la rtse gsum mo /ğŸ”½151 / shar gyi sgor ni ral gri nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pa dag ste lhor ni rdo rje'i dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: rlung du rdo rje zhags par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po drag po'i 'dab ma dag la rtse gsum mo / 151 / shar gyi sgor ni ral gri nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pa dag ste lhor ni rdo rje'i dbyug pa'o //
translated: In the southwest is the goad, in the northwest the vajra, and in the northeast the trident, O lord of men, on the petals of Indra.ğŸ”½At the eastern door is the sword, like a black cloud, and at the southern door is the vajra club.

original: chu ru dpal ldan be con dag tu rab tu 'gyur te nges par byang du tho ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: chu ru dpal ldan be con dag tu rab tu 'gyur te nges par byang du tho ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: At the western door is the glorious club, and at the northern door is the hammer.

original: sems kyi rjes 'brang shes nas shin tu rnam pa mang po dus kyi 'khor lo dag ni ji srid par //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'brang shes nas shin tu rnam pa mang po dus kyi 'khor lo dag ni ji srid par //
translated: Having understood the mind and its followers, one should know the many forms of the wheel of time for as long as one lives.

original: mo gsham rnams kyi bu yi don dang gdon gyis bcom pa'i mi rnams zhi rgyas don du 'di dag mdzod /
analyzed: mo gsham rnams kyi bu yi don dang gdon gyis bcom pa'i mi rnams zhi rgyas don du 'di dag mdzod /
translated: For the sake of the sons of barren women and for the sake of those people who are overcome by demons, perform these [rites] for the sake of pacification and increase.

original: 152 / bum pa brgyad ni rin chen dang bcas 'dab ma padma'i kha dang so ma btang ba'i kham phor ni //
analyzed: 152 / bum pa brgyad ni rin chen dang bcas 'dab ma padma'i kha dang so ma btang ba'i kham phor ni //
translated: The eight vases, together with the jewels, the lotus leaves, and the unbaked clay bowls,

original: bdun gyis chu dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas bkrus te slar yang nyungs kar sogs kyis nges par brab //ğŸ”½dri dang bdug pa mar me rnam mang 'bras bu ro dang me tog dkar po dag dang gos rnams kyis //
analyzed: bdun gyis chu dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas bkrus te slar yang nyungs kar sogs kyis nges par brab // dri dang bdug pa mar me rnam mang 'bras bu ro dang me tog dkar po dag dang gos rnams kyis //
translated: are washed with water and the five nectars, and so forth, and again are definitely struck with white mustard seeds, and so forth.

original: rnam par bkra ba'i mchod pa byas te slar yang de nas zhi ba'i bsreg bya dag ni sbyin sreg bya /
analyzed: rnam par bkra ba'i mchod pa byas te slar yang de nas zhi ba'i bsreg bya dag ni sbyin sreg bya /
translated: Having performed the variegated worship with scents, incense, lamps, various fruits, food, white flowers, and cloths, again then the pacifying burnt offerings are to be offered.ğŸ”½The kindling woods of milk, barley, sesame, and so forth, and the five milk products, the hundred-petaled lotus,

original: 153 /'o ma so ba til la sogs dang 'o ma'i rkang 'thung lnga rnams dag gi yam shing 'dab brgya dang // mchod yon dag dang spyan drang zhal bsil dang ni de bzhin nyid du rjed dang mchod pa 'di dag ni //
analyzed: 153 /'o ma so ba til la sogs dang 'o ma'i rkang 'thung lnga rnams dag gi yam shing 'dab brgya dang // mchod yon dag dang spyan drang zhal bsil dang ni de bzhin nyid du rjed dang mchod pa 'di dag ni //
translated: the libation water, the water for welcoming, the water for sprinkling, and likewise the water for rinsing, and the worshipâ€”

original: rab mchog sa yi steng du ma mo rnams kyis gzir ba rnams dag zhi ba'i don du bya ba ste //
analyzed: rab mchog sa yi steng du ma mo rnams kyis gzir ba rnams dag zhi ba'i don du bya ba ste //
translated: For the sake of pacifying those who are oppressed by the mÄtá¹›kÄ on the most excellent earth,

original: sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams mi yi bdag po dus kun tu ni mchod pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams mi yi bdag po dus kun tu ni mchod pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: the thirty-six yoginÄ«s are always to be worshipped by the lord of men.

original: 154 / bdag med las kyi rnam smin srid pa gsum dang dus kyi 'gro ba yan lag bcu gnyis rten 'brel las //
analyzed: 154 / bdag med las kyi rnam smin srid pa gsum dang dus kyi 'gro ba yan lag bcu gnyis rten 'brel las //
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination arise from the ripening of karma, which is devoid of a self, and from the three existences and the passage of time.

original: yang dag byung dang rig byed bden pa gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i dgu ni ma 'dres sangs rgyas chos rnams te //
analyzed: yang dag byung dang rig byed bden pa gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i dgu ni ma 'dres sangs rgyas chos rnams te //
translated: The nine transformations of the two truths of the Vedas are the unmixed qualities of the Buddha.

original: phung po lnga dang sku gsum lhan skyes shes dang de @35a * //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang sku gsum lhan skyes shes dang de @35a * //
translated: The five aggregates, the three kÄyas, and connate cognition

original: bzhin nyid du blun pa ma yin stong pa nyid //
analyzed: bzhin nyid du blun pa ma yin stong pa nyid //
translated: are not the emptiness that is not the reality of the foolish.

original: 'di dag gang du brjod pa de ni nges par rdo rje can gyi bstan pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag gang du brjod pa de ni nges par rdo rje can gyi bstan pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur /
translated: Wherever these are described, there the teachings of the Vajra Holder will certainly be.

original: 155 / gang du rig byed rang byung kha dang lag pa rkang pa la sogs dag kyang skye bo'i skye gnas te //
analyzed: 155 / gang du rig byed rang byung kha dang lag pa rkang pa la sogs dag kyang skye bo'i skye gnas te //
translated: Wherever the Vedas, the self-arisen, the mouth, the hands, the feet, and so on, are the birthplace of beings,

original: aa shva me dha dag las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med ces pa de ni tshangs pa'i bstan par 'gyur //
analyzed: aa shva me dha dag las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med ces pa de ni tshangs pa'i bstan par 'gyur //
translated: The statement There is no supreme Dharma other than the Ashva-medha is the teaching of Brahma.

original: byed po bdag dang las dang dus dang rang bzhin dang ni yon tan stong pa nyid ni nyams pa'i chos //
analyzed: byed po bdag dang las dang dus dang rang bzhin dang ni yon tan stong pa nyid ni nyams pa'i chos //
translated: The self, action, time, nature, and the emptiness of qualities are the Dharma of decline.

original: byed po 'bras bu'i rgyu ste rab tu gsal zhing nges par bstan pa de 'dir khyab 'jug dag gi'o /
analyzed: byed po 'bras bu'i rgyu ste rab tu gsal zhing nges par bstan pa de 'dir khyab 'jug dag gi'o /
translated: The agent is the cause of the result, clearly and definitively taught, and here it belongs to Vishnu.

original: 156 / lam drug rnams dang de nyid lnga dang mchog gi go 'phang ma lus pa yang gzhan ni sngags kyi lus //
analyzed: 156 / lam drug rnams dang de nyid lnga dang mchog gi go 'phang ma lus pa yang gzhan ni sngags kyi lus //
translated: The six paths, the five realities, and the entire supreme state are the body of mantra.

original: rig bdag dam pa'i zhi ba nyid dang rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa dag gi sbyor dang gtong ba'i dngos //
analyzed: rig bdag dam pa'i zhi ba nyid dang rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa dag gi sbyor dang gtong ba'i dngos //
translated: The self-awareness, the supreme peace, and the three abodes are the essence of union and renunciation.

original: thig le'i dbye ba zhi ba nyid dang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa bcu gnyis mdud pa'i dbye ba ste //
analyzed: thig le'i dbye ba zhi ba nyid dang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa bcu gnyis mdud pa'i dbye ba ste //
translated: The divisions of the bindu, peace, and the twelve abodes in the entire body are the divisions of the knots.

original: 'di dag thams cad gang du rab tu gyur pa de ni nges par zhi ba pa yi bstan pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gang du rab tu gyur pa de ni nges par zhi ba pa yi bstan pa'o /
translated: Wherever all of this is fully present, that is the teaching of the peace-dwellers.

original: 157 / dbang phyug med cing las kyi rnam smin dag kyang yon tan yul rnams 'byung ba'i tshogs ni longs spyod pa //
analyzed: 157 / dbang phyug med cing las kyi rnam smin dag kyang yon tan yul rnams 'byung ba'i tshogs ni longs spyod pa //
translated: The absence of a Lord, the ripening of actions, the collection of the objects of the senses, the enjoyment of wealth,

original: de med pa na 'bras bu med pa gsal bar lha yi bla ma dag gis bstan par rig par bya //
analyzed: de med pa na 'bras bu med pa gsal bar lha yi bla ma dag gis bstan par rig par bya //
translated: the absence of these, the absence of fruit, are clearly taught by the godsâ€™ teacher.

original: byed pos rgyu dang mi rgyu las skyes mtha' dag bskyed cing stag gzig rnams kyi thar pa dag gi rgyu //
analyzed: byed pos rgyu dang mi rgyu las skyes mtha' dag bskyed cing stag gzig rnams kyi thar pa dag gi rgyu //
translated: The creator produces all that is born from the moving and unmoving, and is the cause of the liberation of the tigers and leopards.

original: de mnyes pa las nges par mi rnams mtho ris su 'gyur de ni ra hma na yi bstan pa'o /
analyzed: de mnyes pa las nges par mi rnams mtho ris su 'gyur de ni ra hma na yi bstan pa'o /
translated: By pleasing him, one certainly goes to heaven; this is the teaching of Rahmana.

original: 158 / dus gsum nyid dang rdzas ni drug ste tshig dgus bsgrubs dang srog ni drug gi lus la cha shas so //
analyzed: 158 / dus gsum nyid dang rdzas ni drug ste tshig dgus bsgrubs dang srog ni drug gi lus la cha shas so //
translated: The three times, the six substances, the nine letters, the six life-breaths, the parts of the body,

original: gzhan ni yod pa'i lus lnga brtul zhugs sdom pa 'gro dang ye shes spyod pa dag gi dbye ba rnams //
analyzed: gzhan ni yod pa'i lus lnga brtul zhugs sdom pa 'gro dang ye shes spyod pa dag gi dbye ba rnams //
translated: the other, the five existent bodies, the vows of the observances, the divisions of the conduct of the life-breath, and of wisdom,

original: srog ni lus kyi tshad de dpag tu med pa'i srid pa dag gis rtag pa'i srog gis thar pa'o //
analyzed: srog ni lus kyi tshad de dpag tu med pa'i srid pa dag gis rtag pa'i srog gis thar pa'o //
translated: the life-breath, the measure of the body, the liberation by the eternal life-breath of immeasurable existence.

original: gang du thar pa'i tshad ni steng du nges par brjod pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyis bstan pa'o /
analyzed: gang du thar pa'i tshad ni steng du nges par brjod pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyis bstan pa'o /
translated: The measure of liberation is the upward bound, which is taught by the Victorious Ones.

original: 159 / rig byed 'di ni rang byung min te srid pa gsum gyi gnas su rig byed sgra ni don rjod byed //
analyzed: 159 / rig byed 'di ni rang byung min te srid pa gsum gyi gnas su rig byed sgra ni don rjod byed //
translated: This Veda is not self-arisen, for in the three worlds the sound of the Veda expresses meaning.

original: tshangs pa'i gdong bzhi dag gis sngon ni rig byed sgra dag gis kyang don ni rab tu gsal bar byas //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gdong bzhi dag gis sngon ni rig byed sgra dag gis kyang don ni rab tu gsal bar byas //
translated: The four-faced BrahmÄ previously clarified the meaning with the sounds of the Veda.ğŸ”½If sound and meaning were not different, why wouldn't the mouth be burned by the utterance of the sound of fire?

original: ci ste @35b sgra dang don ni tha dad min na me sgra brjod pa dag gis kha ni cis mi sreg / de phyir nges par ston pa po yod rig pa'i yul dang ma 'ongs don dang 'das pa dag la yang /
analyzed: ci ste @35b sgra dang don ni tha dad min na me sgra brjod pa dag gis kha ni cis mi sreg / de phyir nges par ston pa po yod rig pa'i yul dang ma 'ongs don dang 'das pa dag la yang /
translated: Therefore, the existence of a teacher is certain. The object of knowledge is the future and the past.

original: 160 / rig byed nam mkha' mtshungs min 'dir ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag las kha yis rab brjod byas pa'o //
analyzed: 160 / rig byed nam mkha' mtshungs min 'dir ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag las kha yis rab brjod byas pa'o //
translated: This Veda is not equal to space, for it is declared by the mouth in terms of the divisions of the abodes.

original: rigs pas gnyis skyes kha yis bklags pas nyi tsho ba ste kun tu 'gro ba gzhan rnams klog pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas gnyis skyes kha yis bklags pas nyi tsho ba ste kun tu 'gro ba gzhan rnams klog pa'o //
translated: The twice-born read it with the mouth, the rest read it in the manner of the all-pervading.

original: gang phyir dmangs la sogs pa'i rigs ni kun 'gro min pa'i rig byed 'di dag klog dang 'dri ba min //
analyzed: gang phyir dmangs la sogs pa'i rigs ni kun 'gro min pa'i rig byed 'di dag klog dang 'dri ba min //
translated: The Vedas are not read and written by the all-pervading castes, the Brahmin and so on.

original: de phyir shes ldan mkhas par gyur pa'i mi rnams dag la rig byed dag ni tshang mar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de phyir shes ldan mkhas par gyur pa'i mi rnams dag la rig byed dag ni tshang mar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Therefore, the Vedas are not complete in the wise and learned.

original: 161 / gal te thams cad byed po dbang phyug yod na de yang 'gro ba'i las longs spyod po gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: 161 / gal te thams cad byed po dbang phyug yod na de yang 'gro ba'i las longs spyod po gzhan ma yin //
translated: If the creator is God, He is not a different enjoyer of the actions of the world.

original: gal te dbang phyug las kyi byed po min na de yang kun nas thams cad byed por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug las kyi byed po min na de yang kun nas thams cad byed por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If God is not the agent of action, He is not the creator of all.

original: 'di ni gal te byed po gzhan dag bskul na 'di ni byed po dag gi mchog tu gzhan dbang nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni gal te byed po gzhan dag bskul na 'di ni byed po dag gi mchog tu gzhan dbang nyid //
translated: If He is the creator of other agents, He is dependent on others, the worst of agents.

original: de phyir dge dang mi dge'i 'bras ster byed po dbang phyug med de srog chags las ni dor nas so /
analyzed: de phyir dge dang mi dge'i 'bras ster byed po dbang phyug med de srog chags las ni dor nas so /
translated: Therefore, God, the giver of the fruits of virtue and vice, does not exist, having been discarded by the living beings.

original: 162 / sa dang chu me rlung gi rdul phran 'dir ni gal te mkha' la byed po'i dang por yod pa min //
analyzed: 162 / sa dang chu me rlung gi rdul phran 'dir ni gal te mkha' la byed po'i dang por yod pa min //
translated: If the atoms of earth, water, fire and air do not exist here in space, the creator does not exist as the first.

original: rdzas dag med pa la ni yul dang rnam par bral ba'i thams cad byed po sna tshogs mi byed do //
analyzed: rdzas dag med pa la ni yul dang rnam par bral ba'i thams cad byed po sna tshogs mi byed do //
translated: But when there is no substance, the all-creating agent, devoid of object and form, does not create the variety.

original: yul dang rnam par bral ba byed po 'di yi tshad ma mngon sum dang ni lkog tu gyur pa med //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par bral ba byed po 'di yi tshad ma mngon sum dang ni lkog tu gyur pa med //
translated: This agent, devoid of object and form, has no valid cognition, neither direct perception nor inference.

original: yang dag sbyor ba nyid las thams cad du 'gyur mi yi bdag po 'dod pas ma yin las kyi gzugs /
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba nyid las thams cad du 'gyur mi yi bdag po 'dod pas ma yin las kyi gzugs /
translated: From the right application of the cause, everything comes to be, O King, not from desire, not from the form of action.

original: 163 / yang dag sbyor ba las ni chu shel las kyang chu ru 'gyur te me long dag las dngos po'i gzugs //
analyzed: 163 / yang dag sbyor ba las ni chu shel las kyang chu ru 'gyur te me long dag las dngos po'i gzugs //
translated: From the right application of the cause, water comes from the water crystal, the form of the object from the mirrors.

original: sgyur ba'i rgyu las lce 'dzag rang gi sgra las cig shos dag pa'i sa bon las ni myu gur 'gyur //
analyzed: sgyur ba'i rgyu las lce 'dzag rang gi sgra las cig shos dag pa'i sa bon las ni myu gur 'gyur //
translated: From the cause of transformation, the juice flows from the sugarcane, the sprout from the seed of the plant.

original: khab len las kyang lcags kyi thur ma dag ni g-yo bar 'gyur te 'dod pas 'di la ci yang min ;
analyzed: khab len las kyang lcags kyi thur ma dag ni g-yo bar 'gyur te 'dod pas 'di la ci yang min ;
translated: From the magnet, the iron filings move; but desire has nothing to do with it.

original: / dngos po rnams kyi nus pa 'di ni srid pa gsum gyi gnas su su zhig gis kyang  sprul pa min /
analyzed: / dngos po rnams kyi nus pa 'di ni srid pa gsum gyi gnas su su zhig gis kyang  sprul pa min /
translated: This power of things is not created by anyone in the three worlds.

original: 164 / gal te bdag ni kun tu 'gro na gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 164 / gal te bdag ni kun tu 'gro na gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur //
translated: If the self is all-pervading, how can it experience the pain of separation from a loved one?

original: gal te 'di ni rtag par gyur na 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun @36a * //ğŸ”½pa'i gnas skabs nyid du cis rab 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni rtag par gyur na 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun @36a * // pa'i gnas skabs nyid du cis rab 'gyur //
translated: If it is permanent, how can it be pierced by the arrow of desire?

original: gal te bya ba dang bcas gyur na gnyid log dus su 'di ni rmongs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gro //
analyzed: gal te bya ba dang bcas gyur na gnyid log dus su 'di ni rmongs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gro //
translated: If it is active, how can it be deluded when one is asleep?

original: de ltar nges par bdag 'di kun 'gro khyab bdag dang ni sngon gyi bya ba dag dang bcas pa min /
analyzed: de ltar nges par bdag 'di kun 'gro khyab bdag dang ni sngon gyi bya ba dag dang bcas pa min /
translated: Thus the self is not all-pervading, nor is it the universal lord, nor is it associated with past actions.

original: 165 / bdag med 'byung ba yod cing dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu yod de byed pa po yis rnam par dman //
analyzed: 165 / bdag med 'byung ba yod cing dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu yod de byed pa po yis rnam par dman //
translated: There is no self, but there is karma, and there is the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, and there is the doer who is diminished.

original: 'gro ba po med ma lus thar pa'i slad du 'gro ba yod cing 'ching ba yod de bcings pa med //
analyzed: 'gro ba po med ma lus thar pa'i slad du 'gro ba yod cing 'ching ba yod de bcings pa med //
translated: There is no goer, but there is going for the sake of the complete liberation of beings, and there is bondage, but there is no one who is bound.

original: dngos po dngos med dag kyang yod de skad cig rnam bral rang bzhin med pa dag gi srid pa yod //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med dag kyang yod de skad cig rnam bral rang bzhin med pa dag gi srid pa yod //
translated: There are things and nonthings, but they are devoid of moments and have no intrinsic existence, and there is existence.

original: 'di dag bdag gi bden pa'i tshig ste lha dang gdengs can rnams kyi don bcas tshig gis 'joms mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag bdag gi bden pa'i tshig ste lha dang gdengs can rnams kyi don bcas tshig gis 'joms mi 'gyur /
translated: These are the words of my truth, the words of the gods and the Nagas, the words of the meaning.

original: 166 / gang zhig de nyid gang zag ces bya lus la gnas par smra ba de ni rang bzhin dag gis nyams //
analyzed: 166 / gang zhig de nyid gang zag ces bya lus la gnas par smra ba de ni rang bzhin dag gis nyams //
translated: He who says that the self is a person, that it resides in the body, is ruined by his own nature.

original: kun rdzob dag gis don ni smra ba po yang don dam ma rig med pa dag tu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dag gis don ni smra ba po yang don dam ma rig med pa dag tu 'dod pa'o //
translated: He who says that the meaning is relative, that the speaker is not ignorant of the absolute, is ruined by his own nature.

original: srid gsum mtha' dag rnam par shes pa nyid du smra ba po yang rnam par shes pa 'dod par byed //
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' dag rnam par shes pa nyid du smra ba po yang rnam par shes pa 'dod par byed //
translated: He who says that the three worlds are consciousness, that the speaker is consciousness, is ruined by his own nature.

original: gang zhig snying rje stong nyid gnyis su med pa smra bo phyogs nyams de ni ma nyams par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gang zhig snying rje stong nyid gnyis su med pa smra bo phyogs nyams de ni ma nyams par 'gyur ro /
translated: He who says that compassion and emptiness are not two, he who says that the side of appearance is not ruined, is not ruined.

original: 167 / skye bo sngon gyi las rnams nyams su myong 'gyur 'di la byas pa rnams ni skye ba gzhan la'o //
analyzed: 167 / skye bo sngon gyi las rnams nyams su myong 'gyur 'di la byas pa rnams ni skye ba gzhan la'o //
translated: The people experience the karma of their past lives, and what they do in this life they will experience in another life.

original: gal te de lta yin na lus ni 'jig par mi 'gyur mi rnams skye dang skye ba gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na lus ni 'jig par mi 'gyur mi rnams skye dang skye ba gzhan dag gis //
translated: If that is so, the body will not be destroyed, and people will be born again and again.

original: dpag med srid pa dag gis 'khor ba las ni 'byung bar 'gyur dang thar par 'jug pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: dpag med srid pa dag gis 'khor ba las ni 'byung bar 'gyur dang thar par 'jug pa med pa nyid //
translated: And there is no escape from the endless round of birth and death, no entry into the state of peace.

original: 'di dag stag gzig rnams kyang nges par 'dod par 'gyur te gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa'o /
analyzed: 'di dag stag gzig rnams kyang nges par 'dod par 'gyur te gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa'o /
translated: The CÄrvÄkas, too, will certainly assert this, for their position is inferior to that of the tÄ«rthikas.

original: 168 / gal te 'byung ba gcig tu gyur pas chang gi nus pa bzhin du dbang bcas sems su rab 'gyur na //
analyzed: 168 / gal te 'byung ba gcig tu gyur pas chang gi nus pa bzhin du dbang bcas sems su rab 'gyur na //
translated: If the sense faculties were to become mind through the transformation of a single element, as in the case of the potency of alcohol,

original: shing rnams dag la ci phyir mir 'gyur sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: shing rnams dag la ci phyir mir 'gyur sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' sbyor phyir ro //
translated: why would trees not become human, since they are composed of earth, water, fire, wind, and space?

original: 'di dag rnams la skye bo'i nus pa med na 'byung ba yang dag sbyor ba'i nus pa mchog tu brdzun //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams la skye bo'i nus pa med na 'byung ba yang dag sbyor ba'i nus pa mchog tu brdzun //
translated: If people have no capacity for this, the capacity of the elements to combine is false.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa'i tshig 'di dag ni mi rnams dag la bde ba'i 'bras bu ster min lam nyams so /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa'i tshig 'di dag ni mi rnams dag la bde ba'i 'bras bu ster min lam nyams so /
translated: These beautiful words of the CÄrvÄkas are not the path that bestows the fruit of happiness for humans.

original: 169 / srog ni lus kyi tshad dag yin na gal te lag pa rkang pa bcad pas nyams par 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: 169 / srog ni lus kyi tshad dag yin na gal te lag pa rkang pa bcad pas nyams par 'gyur ram ci //
translated: If life is the measure of the body, will it be damaged if the hands and feet are cut off?

original: rtag bdag ni lus kyi mthu las @36b phra mor 'gyur zhing sbom por yang ni rab tu 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: rtag bdag ni lus kyi mthu las @36b phra mor 'gyur zhing sbom por yang ni rab tu 'gyur ram ci //
translated: Does the eternal self become smaller through the power of the body or does it become larger?

original: 'khor ba'i las las grol ba gang zhig 'jig rten steng na gnas pa bde ba dag gi gnas su 'gro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i las las grol ba gang zhig 'jig rten steng na gnas pa bde ba dag gi gnas su 'gro //
translated: Who is liberated from the actions of saá¹ƒsÄra and goes to the abode of the gods in the world?

original: 'jig rten gsum gang phra rab dag gis gang zhig bkod pa de ni dus kyis rtag tu rtag pa min /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gang phra rab dag gis gang zhig bkod pa de ni dus kyis rtag tu rtag pa min /
translated: The one who is filled with the subtle particles of the three worlds is not permanent, always permanent, by time.

original: 170 / zhes pa la sogs ye shes slad du dus kyi 'khor los sa la bstan pa rab tu gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: 170 / zhes pa la sogs ye shes slad du dus kyi 'khor los sa la bstan pa rab tu gsal mdzad pa //
translated: The one who is clear, the teacher of the earth, for the sake of wisdom, by the wheel of time,

original: 'jam dang sra dang gzhan pa'i bag chags stobs kyis skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste //
analyzed: 'jam dang sra dang gzhan pa'i bag chags stobs kyis skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste //
translated: is followed by the minds of people through the power of the latent tendencies of softness, hardness, and others.

original: sems ni nges par dngos po'i tshon gyis nye bar bzhag pa dag las shel bzhin chan ldan nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sems ni nges par dngos po'i tshon gyis nye bar bzhag pa dag las shel bzhin chan ldan nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: The mind, which is definitely placed by the colors of entities, becomes like a crystal.

original: gang yin de phyir rang gzhan rigs su gyur pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang rnal 'byor ba yis sun mi dbyung /
analyzed: gang yin de phyir rang gzhan rigs su gyur pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang rnal 'byor ba yis sun mi dbyung /
translated: Therefore, the yogÄ« should not criticize any dharma that belongs to his own or anotherâ€™s class.

original: 171 / chos ni sems can phan pa yul dang rnam par bral ba dag ste chos min dag kyang gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 171 / chos ni sems can phan pa yul dang rnam par bral ba dag ste chos min dag kyang gnod pa'o //
translated: Dharma is that which is beneficial to sentient beings, and non-Dharma is that which is harmful.

original: 'tshe ba rig byed tshad ma can ni bde ba'i 'bras bu mi ster dus kun du ni sdug bsngal ster //
analyzed: 'tshe ba rig byed tshad ma can ni bde ba'i 'bras bu mi ster dus kun du ni sdug bsngal ster //
translated: The Vedic injunctions, which are the source of violence, do not lead to happiness, but to suffering.

original: dam pa'i byams ldan rmongs pa'i tshig las mchog gi bde ba byed cing sems can bde la rjes su chags //
analyzed: dam pa'i byams ldan rmongs pa'i tshig las mchog gi bde ba byed cing sems can bde la rjes su chags //
translated: The love of the virtuous, on the other hand, which is the opposite of the words of the ignorant, brings about the highest happiness and is the cause of the happiness of sentient beings.

original: de phyir sems can don ni gcig pu dag dang mi bdag yid kyis rang bzhin med pa bsgom par gyis /ğŸ”½172 / lha mi'i bla ma nga ni mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu dbang po sa steng du ni 'khor los sgyur //
analyzed: de phyir sems can don ni gcig pu dag dang mi bdag yid kyis rang bzhin med pa bsgom par gyis / 172 / lha mi'i bla ma nga ni mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu dbang po sa steng du ni 'khor los sgyur //
translated: Therefore, the king should meditate on the absence of intrinsic existence of the only object, namely, the welfare of sentient beings.ğŸ”½I, the lord of gods, men, and demigods, am the lord of the gods in the heavens, a universal monarch on earth,

original: sa 'og dag tu klu yi rgyal po gdengs can rigs kyis btud dang kun tu 'gro dang mchog nga ste //
analyzed: sa 'og dag tu klu yi rgyal po gdengs can rigs kyis btud dang kun tu 'gro dang mchog nga ste //
translated: and the king of the nagas in the underworld. I am the one who is bowed to by the naga kings and the one who is all-pervading and supreme.

original: ye shes sangs rgyas thub dbang 'gyur med mchog dang khyab bdag rnal 'byor rnams kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor dang // rig byed aom gyi yi ge gtsang ma dag ste rgyal po dngos po kun gyis bdag la skyabs su song /
analyzed: ye shes sangs rgyas thub dbang 'gyur med mchog dang khyab bdag rnal 'byor rnams kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor dang // rig byed aom gyi yi ge gtsang ma dag ste rgyal po dngos po kun gyis bdag la skyabs su song /
translated: The pure syllable Om of the Vedas, the king, I go for refuge to you, the embodiment of all.

original: 173 / khyod ni ma dang khyod ni pha ste khyod ni 'gro ba'i bla ma khyod ni gnyen dang grogs bzang yang //
analyzed: 173 / khyod ni ma dang khyod ni pha ste khyod ni 'gro ba'i bla ma khyod ni gnyen dang grogs bzang yang //
translated: You are the mother, you are the father, you are the guru of beings, you are the relative, the good friend.

original: khyod ni mgon po khyod ni byed po phan dang sdig 'phrog khyod ni go 'phang phun sum tshogs pa yang //
analyzed: khyod ni mgon po khyod ni byed po phan dang sdig 'phrog khyod ni go 'phang phun sum tshogs pa yang //
translated: You are the protector, you are the creator, you take away benefit and harm, you are the perfect state.

original: khyod ni 'ba' zhig gnas dang khyod ni yon tan mchog gi gnas te skyon rnams bcom pa khyod nyid do //
analyzed: khyod ni 'ba' zhig gnas dang khyod ni yon tan mchog gi gnas te skyon rnams bcom pa khyod nyid do //
translated: You alone are the abode, you are the abode of supreme qualities, you are the conqueror of faults.

original: khyod ni dman pa rnams kyi mgon dang yid bzhin nor bu rgyal ba'i dbang po khyod la bdag skyabs mchi /
analyzed: khyod ni dman pa rnams kyi mgon dang yid bzhin nor bu rgyal ba'i dbang po khyod la bdag skyabs mchi /
translated: I go for refuge to you, the protector of the lowly, the wish-fulfilling jewel, the lord of conquerors.

original: 174 / dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas las @37a * //
analyzed: 174 / dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas las @37a * //
translated: From the glorious primordial Buddha,

original: phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo chen po las /
analyzed: phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo chen po las /
translated: Arisen is the glorious great KÄlacakra,

original: nang nges pa zhes bya ba ste le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: nang nges pa zhes bya ba ste le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: The second chapter is called The Inner Ascertainment.

original: // / lus la sna tshogs tshad dang nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus dang zla ba 'pho ba'i dbye ba rnams dang ni //
analyzed: // / lus la sna tshogs tshad dang nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus dang zla ba 'pho ba'i dbye ba rnams dang ni //
translated: The various measurements of the body, the divisions of day and night, and the transits of the moon,ğŸ”½the subtle enumeration and natures of the channels, the assertions of the non-Buddhist ascetics,

original: rtsa rnams kyi ni phra mo'i grangs dang rang bzhin dag la skyes bu mu stegs rnams kyi 'dod pa dang // rig byed dang ni byed po la sogs dbye ba bdag gis thos pas dkyil 'khor dag ni bstan du gsol //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi ni phra mo'i grangs dang rang bzhin dag la skyes bu mu stegs rnams kyi 'dod pa dang // rig byed dang ni byed po la sogs dbye ba bdag gis thos pas dkyil 'khor dag ni bstan du gsol //
translated: the divisions of the Vedas, the creator, and so forth, I have heard. Please teach the maá¹‡á¸alas.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rab tu gsungs /
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rab tu gsungs /
translated: Having heard Sucandra's words, the Sugata fully taught the maá¹‡á¸ala of the KÄlacakra.

original: 1 / dang por yang dag bsten bya bla ma dag kyang dam tshig ldan zhing rdo rje theg par lhag par gnas //
analyzed: 1 / dang por yang dag bsten bya bla ma dag kyang dam tshig ldan zhing rdo rje theg par lhag par gnas //
translated: First, one should rely upon a guru who is endowed with samaya and is well-established in the VajrayÄna.

original: de nyid bsgoms shing ma chags dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing bzod pa'i ngang tshul lam la zhugs //
analyzed: de nyid bsgoms shing ma chags dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing bzod pa'i ngang tshul lam la zhugs //
translated: Meditating on reality, free from attachment and impurities, one should enter the path of patience.

original: slob ma rnams la lam ni sbyin byed dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog cing de nyid las ni tshangs spyod ldan //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la lam ni sbyin byed dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog cing de nyid las ni tshangs spyod ldan //
translated: The path is given to the disciples, the fear of hell is removed, and they are endowed with pure conduct.

original: bdud rnams la ni rdo rje dbyug pa de yang 'dzin ma'i gzhi la rdo rje sems dpar rab grags pa'o /
analyzed: bdud rnams la ni rdo rje dbyug pa de yang 'dzin ma'i gzhi la rdo rje sems dpar rab grags pa'o /
translated: The vajra club is for the demons, and the vajra is well known on the surface of the earth.

original: 2 / nga rgyal dang ldan khro bas zil mnan dam tshig rnam bral rdzas la brkam zhing thos pa dag kyang med //
analyzed: 2 / nga rgyal dang ldan khro bas zil mnan dam tshig rnam bral rdzas la brkam zhing thos pa dag kyang med //
translated: Arrogant, overcome by anger, divorced from samaya, greedy for substances, and lacking learning,

original: slob ma rnams ni slu ba don du gnyer zhing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas las sems nyams dbang ma bskur //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni slu ba don du gnyer zhing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas las sems nyams dbang ma bskur //
translated: seeking to deceive the disciples, their minds degenerate from the state of supreme bliss, and they are not consecrated.

original: longs spyod dag la kun chags bag med rtsub mo'i tshig dang bcas shing dbang po'i don du 'dod ldan pa //
analyzed: longs spyod dag la kun chags bag med rtsub mo'i tshig dang bcas shing dbang po'i don du 'dod ldan pa //
translated: Attached to enjoyments, careless, with harsh words, and desirous for the sake of the senses,

original: de nyid dmyal ba bzhin du slob ma mkhas pa rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyur ni spang bar bya /
analyzed: de nyid dmyal ba bzhin du slob ma mkhas pa rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyur ni spang bar bya /
translated: the wise disciples should abandon them as a cause of perfect enlightenment, just as they would hell.

original: 3 / zab cing rgya che la sems bla ma'i nges pa la dga' gtong ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan yon tan shes //
analyzed: 3 / zab cing rgya che la sems bla ma'i nges pa la dga' gtong ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan yon tan shes //
translated: 3. He is endowed with the attitude of delight in the profound and the magnificent, and in the certainty of the Guru.

original: thar pa don gnyer rgyud la gus shing g-yo ba min pa'i sems ldan de nyid thob pa shin tu sbed //
analyzed: thar pa don gnyer rgyud la gus shing g-yo ba min pa'i sems ldan de nyid thob pa shin tu sbed //
translated: He is devoted to the lineage of the desire for liberation, and has a mind that is unmoving. He is very secret, and has attained that.

original: gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams slob ma de nyid bla ma shin tu mkhas pa rnams kyis bsdu bya ba //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams slob ma de nyid bla ma shin tu mkhas pa rnams kyis bsdu bya ba //
translated: He is to be gathered by the very wise Gurus, who are the friends of the wicked, and who are the disciples of that.

original: shes rab dbang la sogs pa'i rgyur te gzhan zhes bya ba slar yang 'bring po bsod nams dag gi rgyur /
analyzed: shes rab dbang la sogs pa'i rgyur te gzhan zhes bya ba slar yang 'bring po bsod nams dag gi rgyur /
translated: He is the cause of the consecration of wisdom, etc., and of the other, which is the cause of the middling merit.

original: 4 / nag po'i mthar ni dkar po'i tshigs la gzhan la phan pa'i bla mas dkyil 'khor dag ni bzhengs byas nas //
analyzed: 4 / nag po'i mthar ni dkar po'i tshigs la gzhan la phan pa'i bla mas dkyil 'khor dag ni bzhengs byas nas //
translated: At the end of the dark, the Guru who is the benefactor of others, having erected the mandala,

original: sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bdun rnams ni bsod nams @37b don du bu rnams dag la sbyin par bya //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bdun rnams ni bsod nams @37b don du bu rnams dag la sbyin par bya //
translated: gives the seven consecrations to the sons for the sake of merit, which steal away the stains of sin.

original: yang na mtha' dag yon tan gter ni bstan pa'i slad du rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la mchod pa bya //
analyzed: yang na mtha' dag yon tan gter ni bstan pa'i slad du rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la mchod pa bya //
translated: Or else, he should make offerings to the yoginis for the sake of teaching the treasure of all good qualities.

original: mchod pa med na lo gcig tu ni rgyud kyi rgyal po dag las bla mas bstan par mi bya'o /
analyzed: mchod pa med na lo gcig tu ni rgyud kyi rgyal po dag las bla mas bstan par mi bya'o /
translated: If there is no worship, the king of tantras should not be taught by the guru for a year.ğŸ”½Having examined the ground for the purpose of empowerment, the forest, city, town, and village areas, the characteristics of the hearth, together with the vase, colored powders, fire sacrifice, ritual daggers, and so on,

original: 5 / dbang gi don du sa ni yongs brtag nags dang grong khyer grong rdal grong gi phyogs kyi cha dag dang // thab khung rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang ni bum pa dang bcas rdul tshon sbyin sreg phur bu la sogs dang // slob ma rnams ni bsdu ba dag dang gang yang rgyal ba'i bdag po mchog gi dkyil 'khor bri ba dag / shes nas slob dpon gyis ni dge dang mi dge'i 'bras slad zhi ba la sogs mtha' dag rab tu bya /
analyzed: 5 / dbang gi don du sa ni yongs brtag nags dang grong khyer grong rdal grong gi phyogs kyi cha dag dang // thab khung rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang ni bum pa dang bcas rdul tshon sbyin sreg phur bu la sogs dang // slob ma rnams ni bsdu ba dag dang gang yang rgyal ba'i bdag po mchog gi dkyil 'khor bri ba dag / shes nas slob dpon gyis ni dge dang mi dge'i 'bras slad zhi ba la sogs mtha' dag rab tu bya /
translated: gathering the disciples, and also having drawn the mandala of the supreme lord of victors, the master should perform all the rites of pacifying and so on for the sake of virtuous and nonvirtuous results.

original: 6 / sa yi rigs ni yon tan dbang gis rnam bzhir 'gyur ba dmangs rigs rje'u rgyal po bram ze ste //
analyzed: 6 / sa yi rigs ni yon tan dbang gis rnam bzhir 'gyur ba dmangs rigs rje'u rgyal po bram ze ste //
translated: The types of ground become four due to the power of the qualities, Å›Å«dra, vaiÅ›ya, ká¹£atriya, and brahmin.

original: gnag dang ser dang dmar ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa dkar ba'i kha dog rnams kyis rig par bya //
analyzed: gnag dang ser dang dmar ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa dkar ba'i kha dog rnams kyis rig par bya //
translated: They are to be known by the colors black, yellow, red, and white, like a rabbitâ€™s fur.

original: rul pa chu skyes padma'i dri dang mchog gi dri rnams rim pas nor gyi blo gros dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rul pa chu skyes padma'i dri dang mchog gi dri rnams rim pas nor gyi blo gros dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The smells of a corpse, a lotus, and the best smell are, respectively, the smells of wealth,

original: skyur dang lan tshva dmangs rigs mngar dang tshva ba rje dang mi bdag gzhan pa dag ni gnyis skyes so /
analyzed: skyur dang lan tshva dmangs rigs mngar dang tshva ba rje dang mi bdag gzhan pa dag ni gnyis skyes so /
translated: sourness, saltiness, the smell of a Å›Å«dra, sweetness, and saltiness are for the lord and the king, and the other is for a hermaphrodite.

original: 7 / dkar po dag ni zhi dang rgyas pa la ste sprin nag dang mtshungs gsad dang bskrad pa dag la yang //
analyzed: 7 / dkar po dag ni zhi dang rgyas pa la ste sprin nag dang mtshungs gsad dang bskrad pa dag la yang //
translated: White is for pacifying and increasing, and black is for killing and expelling.

original: dmar po dbang dang dgug pa la ste mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa rengs dang rmongs pa la yang 'gyur //
analyzed: dmar po dbang dang dgug pa la ste mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa rengs dang rmongs pa la yang 'gyur //
translated: Red is for controlling and summoning, and the color of the best gold is for paralyzing and confusing.

original: las kyi cha ni thams cad dag la ljang gur 'gyur te lnga pa dang ni mtha' ma dag gi rigs //
analyzed: las kyi cha ni thams cad dag la ljang gur 'gyur te lnga pa dang ni mtha' ma dag gi rigs //
translated: Green is for all types of activities, and the fifth and last are the families.

original: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya /
analyzed: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya /
translated: The yogi/nÄ« should know that all tastes and smells are the treasure of good qualities.ğŸ”½The base in the northeast is for pacifying and increasing,

original: 8 / dbang ldan dang ni byang gis gzhi dag la zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa dag tu 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: 8 / dbang ldan dang ni byang gis gzhi dag la zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa dag tu 'gyur ba ste //
translated: and the base in the northwest is for killing and expelling.

original: me yi mtshams dang shar gyi char ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par gsad pa dag dang bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: me yi mtshams dang shar gyi char ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par gsad pa dag dang bskrad pa'o //
translated: In the southeast, one should always perform the rites of illumination, killing, and expelling.

original: bden bral dang ni lho phyogs su yang gsal bar rtag tu dbang du bya dang dgug pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: bden bral dang ni lho phyogs su yang gsal bar rtag tu dbang du bya dang dgug pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: In the southwest, one should always perform the rites of subjugation and summoning.

original: rlung gi mtshams dang nub kyi phyogs su nges par mchog gi me bdag rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa'o /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshams dang nub kyi phyogs su nges par mchog gi me bdag rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa'o /
translated: In the northwest, one should perform the rites of paralyzing and stupefying the supreme fire god.ğŸ”½In the northeast, one should perform the rites of pacifying and nourishing.

original: 9 / thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad dag tu nges par rab tu 'gyur te zlum po dang ni chu gter zur //
analyzed: 9 / thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad dag tu nges par rab tu 'gyur te zlum po dang ni chu gter zur //
translated: The hearth is in the eight directions of the village: round and with a water-pot mouth,

original: zla kham zur lnga pa dang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zur bdun @38a * //
analyzed: zla kham zur lnga pa dang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zur bdun @38a * //
translated: half-moon, five-cornered, seven-cornered by the power of natural qualities,

original: pa dang zur ni gsum pa dang // zur drug pa dang zur brgyad par 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis de dag rnams kyi snying po'i mtshan ma ni //
analyzed: pa dang zur ni gsum pa dang // zur drug pa dang zur brgyad par 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis de dag rnams kyi snying po'i mtshan ma ni //
translated: three-cornered, six-cornered, and eight-cornered. By the power of the family, their essential signs are

original: padma 'khor lo gri gug ral gri mda' zhes bya dang rdo rje lcags kyu lcags sgrog dag dang sbrul /
analyzed: padma 'khor lo gri gug ral gri mda' zhes bya dang rdo rje lcags kyu lcags sgrog dag dang sbrul /
translated: lotus, wheel, flaying knife, sword, arrow, vajra, iron hook, iron chain, and snake.

original: 10 / gcig gnyis phyed dang gcig na khru ste mkha' dus mkha' mig mkha' me mkha' dus dag ni sor du 'gyur //
analyzed: 10 / gcig gnyis phyed dang gcig na khru ste mkha' dus mkha' mig mkha' me mkha' dus dag ni sor du 'gyur //
translated: One, two, half, and one is a cubit. Space, time, space, eye, space, fire, and space, time are fingers.

original: phyed kyi yan lag drug gi cha shas nyi ma nyi ma'i cha shas dag gis zabs dang kha khyer dang // mchu dang mtshan ma'i phreng bar 'gyur ti kha khyer dag gi steng du rigs kyi dbang gis kun nas so //
analyzed: phyed kyi yan lag drug gi cha shas nyi ma nyi ma'i cha shas dag gis zabs dang kha khyer dang // mchu dang mtshan ma'i phreng bar 'gyur ti kha khyer dag gi steng du rigs kyi dbang gis kun nas so //
translated: The depth and the rim are by the parts of the six limbs of half, and by the parts of the sun and the sun. The lips and the garland of signs are by the parts of the sun and the sun.

original: kha khyer phyi rol du yang chu skyes 'dab ma rnams mdzod mi bdag zhi rgyas la ste gzhan la min /
analyzed: kha khyer phyi rol du yang chu skyes 'dab ma rnams mdzod mi bdag zhi rgyas la ste gzhan la min /
translated: The petals of the lotus are on the rim outside, for the lord of men who is peaceful and enriching, not for others.

original: 11 / yang na las ni thams cad la yang rdo rjer 'gyur te sa la phur pa dag gi dbye ba brgyad //
analyzed: 11 / yang na las ni thams cad la yang rdo rjer 'gyur te sa la phur pa dag gi dbye ba brgyad //
translated: Or, for all actions, it is a vajra. In the ground, there are eight divisions of stakes.

original: nya gro dha dang aa shva dtha ka rus lcags seng ldeng las skyes ts'u ta bil ba aa rka skyes //
analyzed: nya gro dha dang aa shva dtha ka rus lcags seng ldeng las skyes ts'u ta bil ba aa rka skyes //
translated: Born from a nyagrodha, an ashvattha, a karu, iron, and a sÄl tree, a cÄtaka, a bilva, and an arka.

original: de bzhin shel gyi bum pa dang ni dngul mchog rang bzhin dpal ldan thod pa dag dang lcags kyi dang // zangs zhes bya dang gser gyi bum pa rab gsal nges par shing las skyes dang sa yi rang bzhin no /
analyzed: de bzhin shel gyi bum pa dang ni dngul mchog rang bzhin dpal ldan thod pa dag dang lcags kyi dang // zangs zhes bya dang gser gyi bum pa rab gsal nges par shing las skyes dang sa yi rang bzhin no /
translated: Likewise, a crystal, a silver, a glorious skull of the nature of the best silver, an iron, a copper, a golden, a very clear pot, and one definitely born of wood and of the nature of earth.

original: 12 / zlum po brgyad gnyis sor du brjod de gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i bcu yis dpangs dang sor gnyis dag gi mchu //
analyzed: 12 / zlum po brgyad gnyis sor du brjod de gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i bcu yis dpangs dang sor gnyis dag gi mchu //
translated: The two circles are said to be twelve finger breadths, and the height is ten finger breadths, with two finger breadths for the lip.

original: drug gi mgrin pa sor brgyad kha ste ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar zhi rgyas dag la'o gzhan la min //
analyzed: drug gi mgrin pa sor brgyad kha ste ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar zhi rgyas dag la'o gzhan la min //
translated: The neck is six finger breadths, the mouth eight finger breadths, and it is white like the moon for pacifying and enriching, not for others.

original: snga dro nas ni thun brgyad po rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su zhi dang rgyas pa sogs la 'gyur //
analyzed: snga dro nas ni thun brgyad po rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su zhi dang rgyas pa sogs la 'gyur //
translated: The eight periods from morning are for the times of each day and night for pacifying, enriching, and so on.

original: de bzhin de yi thun phyed dag la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su las brgyad dag ni rab tu bya /
analyzed: de bzhin de yi thun phyed dag la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su las brgyad dag ni rab tu bya /
translated: Likewise, one should perform the eight activities at the times of day and night in the half periods of that.

original: 13 / nyi ma gung dang mtshan phyed dag ni nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su zhi ba dag la spang bar bya //
analyzed: 13 / nyi ma gung dang mtshan phyed dag ni nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su zhi ba dag la spang bar bya //
translated: At midday and midnight, one should avoid pacifying at the times of day and night.

original: dus sbyor gdug pa'i gza' rnams gnas pa dag ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed de bzhin nyid du rab tu grags //
analyzed: dus sbyor gdug pa'i gza' rnams gnas pa dag ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed de bzhin nyid du rab tu grags //
translated: The malefic planets in their periods are known to be the destroyers of life.

original: 'o ma dang bcas yam shing mnga' brgya zhi dang rgyas pa dag la gsad pa la ni mi rus so //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bcas yam shing mnga' brgya zhi dang rgyas pa dag la gsad pa la ni mi rus so //
translated: For pacification and increase, one should offer one hundred and eight oblations of kindling with milk; for killing, with human bone.

original: dbye ba la ni bya rog mjug ma seng ldeng las skyes king  shu ka ni dgug dang dbang la'o /
analyzed: dbye ba la ni bya rog mjug ma seng ldeng las skyes king  shu ka ni dgug dang dbang la'o /
translated: For the rite of separation, one should offer oblations of crow feathers and wood from the acacia tree; for summoning and enthralling, of castor beans.

original: 14 / bil ba smyo byed dag ni khru phyed mda' brgya'i grangs rnams rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa dag la ste //
analyzed: 14 / bil ba smyo byed dag ni khru phyed mda' brgya'i grangs rnams rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa dag la ste //
translated: For paralyzing and bewitching, one should offer oblations of bilva fruit, one cubit long, in the number of one hundred and eight.

original: 'o ma mar dang khrag dang zhag dang rngul @38b dang rdo rje'i chu dang mchil ma chang rnams bsreg bya ste //
analyzed: 'o ma mar dang khrag dang zhag dang rngul @38b dang rdo rje'i chu dang mchil ma chang rnams bsreg bya ste //
translated: One should offer oblations of milk, clarified butter, blood, marrow, sweat, semen, saliva, and wine.

original: d'ur ba 'bru dang sha dang dug dang bcas pa dag dang de bzhin skye tshe me tog dmar po dang // bil ba rnyings pa'i phreng ba dang ni gser bzang me tog rnams nyid zhi ba la sogs rnams la'o /
analyzed: d'ur ba 'bru dang sha dang dug dang bcas pa dag dang de bzhin skye tshe me tog dmar po dang // bil ba rnyings pa'i phreng ba dang ni gser bzang me tog rnams nyid zhi ba la sogs rnams la'o /
translated: One should offer oblations of barley, meat, poison, and mustard seeds, as well as red flowers, a garland of withered bilva fruit, and excellent golden flowers, for pacification and so forth.

original: 15 / gshin rje bden bral zur dang chur bcas rlung dang gnod sbyin drag po dbang po dag dang me ru ni //
analyzed: 15 / gshin rje bden bral zur dang chur bcas rlung dang gnod sbyin drag po dbang po dag dang me ru ni //
translated: Yama, Nairá¹›ti, Varuna, VÄyu, Kubera, and Agni are the seats of the masters.

original: slob dpon dag gi gdan du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po zhi ba la sogs las rnams dag la'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dag gi gdan du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po zhi ba la sogs las rnams dag la'o //
translated: For the rites of peace, etc., the king should place the colors in the directions, beginning with the east, in order.

original: tshon ni las gnyis dag la 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma la yang dkar nag nyi ma ser po'o //
analyzed: tshon ni las gnyis dag la 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma la yang dkar nag nyi ma ser po'o //
translated: The colors are for the two rites: on the principal lotus, white and black, the sun is yellow.

original: phyi rol tu ni sangs rgyas dbye bas lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang rnams dag tu tshon gyis /
analyzed: phyi rol tu ni sangs rgyas dbye bas lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang rnams dag tu tshon gyis /
translated: Outside, in the directions of the gods, Yama, Varuna, and the north, the colors are placed in the directions according to the divisions of the Buddhas.

original: 16 / thab khung dag gam dkyil 'khor la ni rigs kyi dbang gis phyogs rnams su yang tshon ni gdab par 'gyur //
analyzed: 16 / thab khung dag gam dkyil 'khor la ni rigs kyi dbang gis phyogs rnams su yang tshon ni gdab par 'gyur //
translated: In the hearth or in the maá¹‡á¸ala, the colors are also placed in the directions according to the families.

original: dgod pa la sogs bsad gtor la sogs rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje dag las lha rnams spro ba'o //
analyzed: dgod pa la sogs bsad gtor la sogs rang gi snying ga'i rdo rje dag las lha rnams spro ba'o //
translated: The emission, etc., and the killing, the hurling, etc., are the emanation of the deities from oneâ€™s own vajra at the heart.

original: shel la sogs pa'i mchod yon snod la padma nor gyi 'dab ma mthe bo dag ni bcu gnyis kyang //
analyzed: shel la sogs pa'i mchod yon snod la padma nor gyi 'dab ma mthe bo dag ni bcu gnyis kyang //
translated: The offering vessels of crystal, etc., are the lotus and the leaf of wealth, and the thumb is the twelve.

original: yu ba'i rtse mor snyim pa'i snod de khyor ba dag kyang bsregs blugs sbyin sreg bya ba dag la'o /
analyzed: yu ba'i rtse mor snyim pa'i snod de khyor ba dag kyang bsregs blugs sbyin sreg bya ba dag la'o /
translated: The handle is at the top, and the hollow bowl is for the oblations.

original: 17 / zhi dang drag po chags dang bcas par 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lha ni rengs pa dag gi sku //
analyzed: 17 / zhi dang drag po chags dang bcas par 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lha ni rengs pa dag gi sku //
translated: The gods are in the form of the stiff limbs, according to the family, in the peaceful, violent, and passionate rites.

original: de bzhin las gnyis dag la rab tu gsal zhing nges par dkyil 'khor la yang lhag pa'i lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin las gnyis dag la rab tu gsal zhing nges par dkyil 'khor la yang lhag pa'i lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the two actions are clearly manifest in the mandala, and the special deity is in the mandala.

original: rnam pa lnga ni rgyal ba'i dbang po gang phyir rnam gsum srid pa la gnas phung po khams sogs kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni rgyal ba'i dbang po gang phyir rnam gsum srid pa la gnas phung po khams sogs kyi //
translated: The five aspects are the five families of the victorious ones, because of the three abodes, the aggregates, elements, and so on.

original: dbye ba yis te de las kyang ni lha rnams dkyil 'khor dag la rdul tshon rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur /
analyzed: dbye ba yis te de las kyang ni lha rnams dkyil 'khor dag la rdul tshon rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur /
translated: From that, the deities are in the mandalas, and the colored powders are the five aspects.

original: 18 / thig skud khru ni brgyad par 'gyur te sum sgril slob dpon gyi ni lag pa'i mthe bo'i nas gcig gis //
analyzed: 18 / thig skud khru ni brgyad par 'gyur te sum sgril slob dpon gyi ni lag pa'i mthe bo'i nas gcig gis //
translated: The thread for the lines is eight cubits long, tripled, and one cubit thick, with the thumb of the master.

original: sboms su 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum gyi lam na gnas pa'i thig skud gcig ste gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sboms su 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum gyi lam na gnas pa'i thig skud gcig ste gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: The thickness is threefold, and the thread for the lines is single, not another, in the path of the three abodes.

original: zhi ba la sogs dag la rim par yongs su bkod pa skyil krung rdo rje lha min tsog pu dang // skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba gnyis dang bshang lam rkang par gnas pa dag kyang las kyi dbye bas gdan /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs dag la rim par yongs su bkod pa skyil krung rdo rje lha min tsog pu dang // skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba gnyis dang bshang lam rkang par gnas pa dag kyang las kyi dbye bas gdan /
translated: The postures are cross-legged, etc.ğŸ”½The seats are of various kinds, according to the rite, of crystal, pearl, human, ass, or elephant bone, or of the first bone, or of lotus.

original: 19 / shel dang mu tig dang ni mi dang bong bu'i so 'am rus pa dag dang po de tse dang ni //ğŸ”½padma zhes bya dbang @39a * //ğŸ”½mig lung tang bde gshegs rigs kyi dbang gis sngags bzlas pa la phreng bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 19 / shel dang mu tig dang ni mi dang bong bu'i so 'am rus pa dag dang po de tse dang ni // padma zhes bya dbang @39a * // mig lung tang bde gshegs rigs kyi dbang gis sngags bzlas pa la phreng bar 'gyur //
translated: The rosaries are of crystal, pearl, human, ass, or elephant bone, or of the first bone, or of lotus.

original: dri zhim me tog dkar po dang ni tsha ba dang bcas nag po dag dang dmar dang ser pos mchod //
analyzed: dri zhim me tog dkar po dang ni tsha ba dang bcas nag po dag dang dmar dang ser pos mchod //
translated: The flowers are white, fragrant, hot, black, red, or yellow.

original: bsil dang bshang ba sha yi spos ni sbrang rtsi khrag ldan dag dang drag po'i spos dang bska ba'o /
analyzed: bsil dang bshang ba sha yi spos ni sbrang rtsi khrag ldan dag dang drag po'i spos dang bska ba'o /
translated: The incense is cool, fecal, meat, honey, blood, fierce, or astringent.

original: 20 /'khrul 'khor n+ya gro dha 'dab dur khrod ro yi ras dang gro ga'i 'dab dang aa rka'i 'dab ma la //
analyzed: 20 /'khrul 'khor n+ya gro dha 'dab dur khrod ro yi ras dang gro ga'i 'dab dang aa rka'i 'dab ma la //
translated: The wheels are of banyan leaves, charnel ground cloth, birch bark, or arjaka leaves.

original: shi ri kha nda s'a li btags pa dag dang dur khrod sar gnas sol pa khrag dang dug dang ni //
analyzed: shi ri kha nda s'a li btags pa dag dang dur khrod sar gnas sol pa khrag dang dug dang ni //
translated: The pen is made of the bone of a dead person, of a woman who has died in childbirth, or of a charnel ground dweller, and is dipped in blood and poison.

original: kha che tsandan dmar dang 'bras bu gsum gyi khu ba yud  bab blas bris par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: kha che tsandan dmar dang 'bras bu gsum gyi khu ba yud  bab blas bris par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The ink is made of red sandalwood from Kashmir, the three fruits, and human blood, and is written with a pen made of durva grass,

original: d'ur ba bsil rus mjug sgro gser dang seng ldeng las skyes bil ba skyes dang aa rka smyu gu'o /
analyzed: d'ur ba bsil rus mjug sgro gser dang seng ldeng las skyes bil ba skyes dang aa rka smyu gu'o /
translated: bone, tail feather, gold, or khadira wood, or with a pen made of bilva or arka wood.

original: 21 / kham phor dpal ldan thod par mngar gsum khrag dang spra tshil gong bu so phag dag gi dbus su ni //
analyzed: 21 / kham phor dpal ldan thod par mngar gsum khrag dang spra tshil gong bu so phag dag gi dbus su ni //
translated: In a glorious skull cup, or in a clay pot, the pill is made of the three sweet substances, blood, and beeswax, and is placed in the center of a brick.

original: rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas ni gtsang ba dag dang ro khang sa gzhi me yis gdung dang sa dag la //
analyzed: rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas ni gtsang ba dag dang ro khang sa gzhi me yis gdung dang sa dag la //
translated: In a moist place, a clean place, a charnel ground, on a heated surface, or on the ground,

original: 'khrul 'khor gzhag par bya bar 'gyur te dge dang mi dge'i dbang gis sngags pa yis ni rig par bya //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gzhag par bya bar 'gyur te dge dang mi dge'i dbang gis sngags pa yis ni rig par bya //
translated: the machine is to be set up, and the mantra practitioner should know it by the power of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: zla ba glang chen yi dags rnga mo ri dags rta dang phyugs dang rus sbal lus la rim pas so /
analyzed: zla ba glang chen yi dags rnga mo ri dags rta dang phyugs dang rus sbal lus la rim pas so /
translated: The moon, elephant, ghost, camel, deer, horse, cow, and tortoise are the bodies in order.

original: 25 / dpal ldan rdo rje rnams kyis phyogs kun du gnas mtha' dag bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg bya ste //
analyzed: 25 / dpal ldan rdo rje rnams kyis phyogs kun du gnas mtha' dag bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg bya ste //
translated: The glorious Vajras, dwelling in all directions, should burn up the hosts of demons.

original: phyi nas 'khor lo rtsibs bcu dag la phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas khro bo'i tshogs ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas 'khor lo rtsibs bcu dag la phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas khro bo'i tshogs ni bsgom par bya //
translated: Then, on the ten-spoked wheel, in the directions and quarters, one should visualize the hosts of wrathful deities.

original: 'khor lo'i dbus su gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang  das kyi zhal ldan khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbus su gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang  das kyi zhal ldan khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs //
translated: In the center of the wheel, the lord of wrath, Vajravega, has two arms and four faces, with the faces of a Buddha and a Kalki.

original: de nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan gang zhig cung zad 'dod ba sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: de nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan gang zhig cung zad 'dod ba sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya /
translated: Then, the adept, the practitioner, who is endowed with the certainty of the guru, should accomplish whatever is desired.

original: 23 / rdo rje gsum gyis sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas rab gsum ni ring du mthong ba'i mtha' ru ste //
analyzed: 23 / rdo rje gsum gyis sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas rab gsum ni ring du mthong ba'i mtha' ru ste //
translated: The three supreme ones, dwelling on the earth mandala, are seen in the distance by the three eyes.

original: tho rangs nas ni grib ma'i mtha' rus gzhi'i gnas las nam mkha' dag la rdo rje brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: tho rangs nas ni grib ma'i mtha' rus gzhi'i gnas las nam mkha' dag la rdo rje brtsegs pa'o //
translated: From dawn until the end of the shadow, in the sky above the earth mandala, is the vajra peak.

original: dbus su chu skyes nyi ma'i khru ste lte ba gdan dang bcas pa dag kyang dus kyi khrur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus su chu skyes nyi ma'i khru ste lte ba gdan dang bcas pa dag kyang dus kyi khrur 'gyur ro //
translated: In the center, the lotus and sun are one cubit, with the navel and seat also one cubit.

original: de yi steng du bdag nyid nyes pa dag dang rnam par bral ba rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: de yi steng du bdag nyid nyes pa dag dang rnam par bral ba rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya /
translated: On top of that, the yogi who is free of faults should meditate.

original: 24 / sa yi phyogs rnams @39b su 'dir dang po rdo rje gsum gyis zhing skyong rnams la gtor ma sbyin bya ste //
analyzed: 24 / sa yi phyogs rnams @39b su 'dir dang po rdo rje gsum gyis zhing skyong rnams la gtor ma sbyin bya ste //
translated: Here, in the directions of the ground, first the protector of the field should be offered a torma with the three vajra syllables.

original: phyi nas rdo rje bzhi yis phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas rdo rje bzhi yis phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg par bya //
translated: Then, with the four vajras, the hosts of maras residing in the directions and quarters are definitely burned.

original: sa yi lha mo spyan drangs chu dang bcas pa'i me tog dag gis 'di la mchod yon tan tu sbyin //
analyzed: sa yi lha mo spyan drangs chu dang bcas pa'i me tog dag gis 'di la mchod yon tan tu sbyin //
translated: The goddess of the ground is invited and is offered a welcome water with flowers.

original: de la gsol ba btab ste phyi nas sa yi gnas la dag pa dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa mdzod /
analyzed: de la gsol ba btab ste phyi nas sa yi gnas la dag pa dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa mdzod /
translated: Having supplicated her, then make the ground pure as desired.

original: 25 / rgyal bas lha yi bdag po dang bcas bdud ni bcom pa dag la lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //
analyzed: 25 / rgyal bas lha yi bdag po dang bcas bdud ni bcom pa dag la lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //
translated: The Victorious One, together with the lord of gods, defeated Mara, and you, goddess, became the witness.

original: de phyir khyod ni mchod par bya zhing lha mchog gis btud bzhes shig bzhes shig bdag gi mchod yon no //
analyzed: de phyir khyod ni mchod par bya zhing lha mchog gis btud bzhes shig bzhes shig bdag gi mchod yon no //
translated: Therefore, you are to be worshipped and bowed to by the supreme gods. Accept, accept my welcome water.

original: ji ltar rgyal bas byang chub slad du bdud kyi sde ni stobs ldan dag kyang rab tu bcom gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal bas byang chub slad du bdud kyi sde ni stobs ldan dag kyang rab tu bcom gyur pa //
translated: Just as the Victorious One completely defeated the powerful army of demons for the sake of enlightenment,

original: de bzhin bdag gis kyang ni slob ma rnams la dbang bskur slad du bdud rnams nyams pa dag tu bya /
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis kyang ni slob ma rnams la dbang bskur slad du bdud rnams nyams pa dag tu bya /
translated: in the same way, I will also destroy the demons for the sake of conferring empowerment upon my disciples.

original: 26 / gang dag phyogs rnams kun na sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnam bral btsun mo dang bcas pa //
analyzed: 26 / gang dag phyogs rnams kun na sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnam bral btsun mo dang bcas pa //
