analyzed: phyag rgya dar dpyangs cod pan dag dang rdo rje mchod phyir thogs ni bla ma mchog gis sbyin par bya //
translated: The master should give the mudra, the hanging silk, the diadem, and the vajra and bell for worship.

original: de dag slob dpon slad du rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis phyag rgya rnam par dag pa nyid /
analyzed: de dag slob dpon slad du rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis phyag rgya rnam par dag pa nyid /
translated: For the sake of the master, the pure mudra of oneâ€™s own buddha family

original: 105 / steng du bla re bkod cing sa yi mthil gyi gnas dag tu yang ri mo gsum ni kun nas so //
analyzed: 105 / steng du bla re bkod cing sa yi mthil gyi gnas dag tu yang ri mo gsum ni kun nas so //
translated: is arranged above, and on the ground of the site, three lines all around.

original: de rnams thur du nor bu gser gyi bum pa chur bcas skud pa dang ldan padma'i kha rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams thur du nor bu gser gyi bum pa chur bcas skud pa dang ldan padma'i kha rnams so //
translated: Those are turned downward, with a jeweled golden vase filled with water and a thread, and lotus mouths.

original: dung sogs gser gyi snod dang yang na @47b dngul gyi rang bzhin dag tu dri yi chu ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: dung sogs gser gyi snod dang yang na @47b dngul gyi rang bzhin dag tu dri yi chu ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: In a golden vessel such as a conch, or one made of silver, one should prepare scented water.

original: snying por gser gyi rang bzhin gsal ba'i gdan dag rab tu bkod de de la khrus ni brtsam par bya /
analyzed: snying por gser gyi rang bzhin gsal ba'i gdan dag rab tu bkod de de la khrus ni brtsam par bya /
translated: Having arranged a clear seat made of gold in the center, one should begin the bathing ritual there.

original: 106 / me tog sogs dang dri yi til mar nyi ma me yis smin pa dag gis lha la byug par bya //
analyzed: 106 / me tog sogs dang dri yi til mar nyi ma me yis smin pa dag gis lha la byug par bya //
translated: With flowers and scented oil ripened by the sun and fire, one should anoint the deity.

original: phye ma rnams kyis dril phyis byas nas sbrang rtsi mar dang zho dang 'o ma chu yis bkru bar bya //
analyzed: phye ma rnams kyis dril phyis byas nas sbrang rtsi mar dang zho dang 'o ma chu yis bkru bar bya //
translated: Having wiped it with the powders, one should wash it with honey, clarified butter, curd, milk, and water.

original: don grub rnams dang mar me dag dang rnam mang 'bras bu mchog gis 'di la nges par bya bas nas ni //
analyzed: don grub rnams dang mar me dag dang rnam mang 'bras bu mchog gis 'di la nges par bya bas nas ni //
translated: Having certainly done this with the fruits of the wish-fulfilling tree, lamps, and many excellent fruits,

original: de yi gnas nas bskyod par bya ste sku yang dmar po'i gos dag gis ni yang dag g-yogs pa'o /
analyzed: de yi gnas nas bskyod par bya ste sku yang dmar po'i gos dag gis ni yang dag g-yogs pa'o /
translated: one should move it from that place, and the image should be completely covered with red garments.

original: 107 / dpal ldan dkyil 'khor mthar ni mnyam pa'i sa yi gnas la rgyal ba'i cha yis re kh'a lnga byas te //
analyzed: 107 / dpal ldan dkyil 'khor mthar ni mnyam pa'i sa yi gnas la rgyal ba'i cha yis re kh'a lnga byas te //
translated: At the end of the glorious maá¹‡á¸ala, on the level ground, one should draw five lines with the victorâ€™s part.

original: dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa'i mtshan ma lnga yis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa'i mtshan ma lnga yis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In the center, one should draw an eight-petaled lotus adorned with the five signs of oneâ€™s own family, located in the cardinal and intermediate directions.

original: de yi dbus su gzhag par bya ba zhal gyi padma nub tu phyogs pa'i lha dang lha mo 'am //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gzhag par bya ba zhal gyi padma nub tu phyogs pa'i lha dang lha mo 'am //
translated: In its center, one should place the face of the lotus facing west, the deity or goddess,

original: mchod rten sogs dang glegs bam dag gam thang sku zhes pa'ang de bzhin de la mngon phyogs sngags pa'o /
analyzed: mchod rten sogs dang glegs bam dag gam thang sku zhes pa'ang de bzhin de la mngon phyogs sngags pa'o /
translated: or the stÅ«pa, etc., or the book, or the painting, likewise facing it, the mantrin.

original: 108 / rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje stong pa'i rang bzhin dag tu byas nas ni //
analyzed: 108 / rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje stong pa'i rang bzhin dag tu byas nas ni //
translated: Having made the supreme Victor, together with the Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind, pure in their nature of emptiness,

original: phyi nas sngar brjod sbyor ba dag gis zla nyi rdo rje las skyes dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas sngar brjod sbyor ba dag gis zla nyi rdo rje las skyes dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: then, by the previously mentioned process, one should meditate on the Wheel of Time born from the moon, sun, and vajra.

original: rig pa'i lha mo sogs dang sangs rgyas a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes rang rang sa bon gyis bskyed rnams //
analyzed: rig pa'i lha mo sogs dang sangs rgyas a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes rang rang sa bon gyis bskyed rnams //
translated: The goddesses of awareness and so forth, born of the Buddhaâ€™s lineage of Ä€likÄli, are generated from their respective seed syllables.

original: snying mgrin lte ba gsang ba mgo dang gtsug tor 'khor lo dag la rigs kyi dbang gis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: snying mgrin lte ba gsang ba mgo dang gtsug tor 'khor lo dag la rigs kyi dbang gis bsgom par bya /
translated: They should be meditated on in the wheels of the heart, throat, navel, secret place, head, and crown, according to the family.

original: 109 / de ltar nges pa nyid du bsgom par bya ste slar yang mtha' dag lha rnams dag gi lus la yang //
analyzed: 109 / de ltar nges pa nyid du bsgom par bya ste slar yang mtha' dag lha rnams dag gi lus la yang //
translated: In this way, one should meditate with certainty, and then again, in the bodies of all the deities,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po dag gis srid med srid mnyam ye shes sems dpa' bkug ste gzhug pa dag dang ni //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po dag gis srid med srid mnyam ye shes sems dpa' bkug ste gzhug pa dag dang ni //
translated: the kings of wrathful ones summon the wisdom beings, who are not existent and equal to existence, and cause them to enter.

original: bcing dang mnyes pa dang ni ro mnyam byed pa dag kyang lha rnams kyi ni rang gi lus la bya //
analyzed: bcing dang mnyes pa dang ni ro mnyam byed pa dag kyang lha rnams kyi ni rang gi lus la bya //
translated: They bind, delight, and make them of one taste with the deitiesâ€™ own bodies.

original: de nas slob dpon nyid kyis zhal ni rab tu gsal bar byas pa'i lha la phyag dag 'tshal bar bya /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon nyid kyis zhal ni rab tu gsal bar byas pa'i lha la phyag dag 'tshal bar bya /
translated: Then, the master himself should pay homage to the deities, with his face turned toward them.

original: 110 / aa sogs ka sogs dag las lha dang lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs yon tan la gnas sa bon gang //
analyzed: 110 / aa sogs ka sogs dag las lha dang lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs yon tan la gnas sa bon gang //
translated: The seed-syllable of each deity and goddess is located in the throat,

original: rang gi sa bon de ni snying gi dbus su zla ni kha sbyor la gnas sku gsung thugs ldan par //ğŸ”½mtha' dag lus la gnas pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan @48a * //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon de ni snying gi dbus su zla ni kha sbyor la gnas sku gsung thugs ldan par // mtha' dag lus la gnas pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan @48a * //
translated: and the seed-syllable of each god and goddess is located in the heart, in the middle of a pair of conjoined moons, endowed with body, speech, and mind.

original: gyi yan lag dpe byad mkha' dang brgyad kyis te //
analyzed: gyi yan lag dpe byad mkha' dang brgyad kyis te //
translated: The thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks of excellence, located in the entire body,

analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis phye ba de nyid rab gsal 'dab ma 'dab mar glegs bam rnams la bsgom par bya /
translated: are opened by the syllables, and that very [body] is clearly visualized, with the scriptures on each petal.

original: 111 / mchod rten snying por dpal ldan 'khor lo rdo rje nor bu padma dag dang byang du ral gri nyid //
analyzed: 111 / mchod rten snying por dpal ldan 'khor lo rdo rje nor bu padma dag dang byang du ral gri nyid //
translated: In the center of the stÅ«pa, one should visualize the glorious wheel, vajra, jewel, and lotus, and in the north, the sword.

original: bgrang phreng la ni h'um gi yi ge nor bu yongs su bgrang ba rnams ni mtshan dang dpe byad rnams //
analyzed: bgrang phreng la ni h'um gi yi ge nor bu yongs su bgrang ba rnams ni mtshan dang dpe byad rnams //
translated: The syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ in the rosary, the jewel, and the counting of the recitations are the marks and minor marks of excellence.

original: dril bu'i sku la dbyangs ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu rnams dag dang ka sogs sde rnams rdo rje la //
analyzed: dril bu'i sku la dbyangs ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu rnams dag dang ka sogs sde rnams rdo rje la //
translated: The ten vowels and the groups of consonants ka and so forth are on the bell, transformed by the three melodies.

original: de dag kho na mchod phyir thogs la bcu yis bsgyur ba nor gyi dpe byad rnams ni stod g-yogs la /
analyzed: de dag kho na mchod phyir thogs la bcu yis bsgyur ba nor gyi dpe byad rnams ni stod g-yogs la /
translated: Those very [vowels and consonants] are on the necklace, transformed by the ten, the signs of the body, and so forth.

original: 112 / ka sogs sde pa dbyangs dang bcas pa mkha' ro yon tan rnams ni pus 'khyud dag la bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 112 / ka sogs sde pa dbyangs dang bcas pa mkha' ro yon tan rnams ni pus 'khyud dag la bsgom par bya //
translated: The groups of consonants ka and so forth with the vowels are on the earrings, and the qualities of the sky-lotus are on the bracelets.

original: ham ha: dpal ldan rna cha la ste aam aa: zhes pa zung ni mgul rgyan ska rags dag la'o //
analyzed: ham ha: dpal ldan rna cha la ste aam aa: zhes pa zung ni mgul rgyan ska rags dag la'o //
translated: Haá¹ƒ and haá¸¥ are on the glorious earrings, and aá¹ƒ and aá¸¥ are on the necklace and belt.

original: de bzhin du yang aa yig zung ni gdu bu dag la 'gyur te rkang gdub dag la ha h'a yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang aa yig zung ni gdu bu dag la 'gyur te rkang gdub dag la ha h'a yang //
translated: Likewise, the pair of a-s are on the bracelets, and ha and hÄ are on the anklets.

original: mtha' dag lus la gnas pa stong pa'i rnam pa lnga po dag ni thal bdag la bsgom par bya /
analyzed: mtha' dag lus la gnas pa stong pa'i rnam pa lnga po dag ni thal bdag la bsgom par bya /
translated: The five aspects of emptiness that exist in the entire body are meditated on as the ashes.

original: 113 / rang lus ye shes rnam pa dag las rdo rje gsum dang bcas pa'i phung po khams la sogs pa kun //
analyzed: 113 / rang lus ye shes rnam pa dag las rdo rje gsum dang bcas pa'i phung po khams la sogs pa kun //
translated: The body is the five gnoses, and the aggregates, constituents, and so forth are the three vajras.

original: lha rnams kyi ni rang gi snying ga'i padmar rang rang sa bon dag gi rim pas dgod par bya //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni rang gi snying ga'i padmar rang rang sa bon dag gi rim pas dgod par bya //
translated: For the deities, one should arrange the individual seed syllables in the heart lotuses of the deities in their respective places.

original: sa bon bkod na rab tu gnas par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mchod rten sku gzugs sogs la'o //
analyzed: sa bon bkod na rab tu gnas par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mchod rten sku gzugs sogs la'o //
translated: When the seed syllables are arranged, they become firmly established, O Lord of Men, in the stÅ«pas, images, and so forth.

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i dus su lag pa'i rdo rje dag gis rang gi lus la sa bon gzhug par bya /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i dus su lag pa'i rdo rje dag gis rang gi lus la sa bon gzhug par bya /
translated: At the time of the concluding ritual, one should cause the seed syllables to enter oneâ€™s body with the vajra palms.

original: 114 /'di dang dang po ru yang ri mor bris pa'i thang sku rnams kyi me long la ni khrus su 'gyur //ğŸ”½phyi nas dri dang spos dang shin tu dri bzang me tog rnams dang glu dang rol mo dag dang ni //
analyzed: 114 /'di dang dang po ru yang ri mor bris pa'i thang sku rnams kyi me long la ni khrus su 'gyur // phyi nas dri dang spos dang shin tu dri bzang me tog rnams dang glu dang rol mo dag dang ni //
translated: At the beginning and at the end, the painted scrolls are bathed in a mirror.ğŸ”½Afterwards, one should worship the deities with perfumes, incense, very fragrant flowers, songs, music,

original: gar dang rnam mang mchog gi gos dang rnga yab dang ni gdugs rnams dag gis lha la mchod par bya //
analyzed: gar dang rnam mang mchog gi gos dang rnga yab dang ni gdugs rnams dag gis lha la mchod par bya //
translated: dance, many excellent garments, yak-tail fans, and parasols.

original: de ltar rab gnas byas nas rnam mang mchog gi ro rnams dag gis dge 'dun mchod ston rab tu sbyin /
analyzed: de ltar rab gnas byas nas rnam mang mchog gi ro rnams dag gis dge 'dun mchod ston rab tu sbyin /
translated: Having thus performed the consecration, one should offer a feast to the Saá¹…gha with many excellent foods.

original: 115 / khron pa rdzing dang mtshe 'ur phyogs dang phyogs bral du ni klu yi rgyal po nor rnams dgod par bya //
analyzed: 115 / khron pa rdzing dang mtshe 'ur phyogs dang phyogs bral du ni klu yi rgyal po nor rnams dgod par bya //
translated: In the directions and the intermediate directions, he should place the kings of the nÄgas,

original: chu gter bdun po rang gi sa bon gyis te sbrang rtsi chu dang ldan pa'i dri lnga gzhug par bya //
analyzed: chu gter bdun po rang gi sa bon gyis te sbrang rtsi chu dang ldan pa'i dri lnga gzhug par bya //
translated: with their seed syllables, in the seven oceans, and insert the five fragrances, along with honey and water.

original: sbyin sreg mthar ni rdzing bu la sogs dag la chu lha dkar po phyag na zhags pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sbyin sreg mthar ni rdzing bu la sogs dag la chu lha dkar po phyag na zhags pa bsgom par bya //
translated: At the end of the fire sacrifice, he should visualize the white god of the waters, holding a noose, in the ponds and so forth.

original: skyed mos @48b tshal du shing gcig dpag bsam ljon pa mtha' dag shing la gnas par dbang ni bskur nas so /
analyzed: skyed mos @48b tshal du shing gcig dpag bsam ljon pa mtha' dag shing la gnas par dbang ni bskur nas so /
translated: In the pleasure groves, he should consecrate the wish-fulfilling trees, the single trees, and all the trees.

original: 116 / cod pan dar dpyangs dag dang do shal gdu bu dang ni de bzhin rna cha ska rags la sogs pa //
analyzed: 116 / cod pan dar dpyangs dag dang do shal gdu bu dang ni de bzhin rna cha ska rags la sogs pa //
translated: The master should be given a turban, a long necklace, bracelets, earrings, a belt, and so forth.

original: slob dpon la ni rab tu sbyin byar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po yon yang bdag nyid nus pas so //
analyzed: slob dpon la ni rab tu sbyin byar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po yon yang bdag nyid nus pas so //
translated: The king should give a gift to the master, according to his ability.

original: sbyin bdag gis ni bsod nams slad du mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs la gzhan don don du gnyer bya ste //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis ni bsod nams slad du mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs la gzhan don don du gnyer bya ste //
translated: The patron should strive for the sake of the merit of the entire assembly, for the sake of the welfare of others.

original: bsod nams 'di yis rnam gsum srid pa la gnas sems can rnams ni bla med byang chub thob par shog /
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis rnam gsum srid pa la gnas sems can rnams ni bla med byang chub thob par shog /
translated: By this merit, may all beings dwelling in the three worlds attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 117 / ji srid phyogs kyi lo ni gcig pu rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur te blta ba dang na rig par bya //
analyzed: 117 / ji srid phyogs kyi lo ni gcig pu rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur te blta ba dang na rig par bya //
translated: As long as the single year of the directions becomes tenfold, one should look and know.

original: de nas 'khyud par bya ste ro dang bcas pa'i chu gter g-yo ba la sogs rnams ni bsten par bya //
analyzed: de nas 'khyud par bya ste ro dang bcas pa'i chu gter g-yo ba la sogs rnams ni bsten par bya //
translated: Then one should embrace, relying on the moving and unmoving waters with their taste of nectar.

original: lo ni nyi shu yan chad phyag rgya mchog tu 'jigs byed ma ste khro bo 'byung po lha min cha //
analyzed: lo ni nyi shu yan chad phyag rgya mchog tu 'jigs byed ma ste khro bo 'byung po lha min cha //
translated: The twenty-year-old consort is the supreme BhairavÄ«, the wrathful one, the demigod.

original: dbang gi don du drug dang bzhi ste bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba gzhan ni bsgom pa'i don du'o /
analyzed: dbang gi don du drug dang bzhi ste bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba gzhan ni bsgom pa'i don du'o /
translated: For the sake of empowerment, there are six and four, bestowing the fruit of the bliss of equality, the other for the sake of meditation.

original: 118 / dpal ldan shes rab nu ma la yang dang por reg pa gang yin bum pa'i dbang ni de nyid do //
analyzed: 118 / dpal ldan shes rab nu ma la yang dang por reg pa gang yin bum pa'i dbang ni de nyid do //
translated: The one who first touches the breast of glorious wisdom is the vase empowerment.

translated: The one, the sole, the various, the chief, the pervader of the three worlds, is the glorious family.

analyzed: rab tu khros pa'i zhal rnams sna tshogs yang dag sdud byed dgyes pa rnams ni skyong bar byed pa nyid /
translated: The various faces of the one who is very wrathful, the one who is the perfect collector, the one who is the protector of the passionate,

original: mtha' dag byang chub rgyu ru shes rab thabs kyis mchod par bya ste rgyal po slob dpon snying rje dang // bcas pa'i thugs ldan dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su zhon pas so /
analyzed: mtha' dag byang chub rgyu ru shes rab thabs kyis mchod par bya ste rgyal po slob dpon snying rje dang // bcas pa'i thugs ldan dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su zhon pas so /
translated: the one with a pure mind, the one who is free from stains, and the one who is mounted on the conduct of enlightenment.

original: 138 / dang por bud med gsang ba'i phyag rgyar 'gyur te dam tshig la ni dpal ldan skyes pa mchog phyag rgya //
analyzed: 138 / dang por bud med gsang ba'i phyag rgyar 'gyur te dam tshig la ni dpal ldan skyes pa mchog phyag rgya //
translated: First, a woman becomes the secret seal, and on the pledge, the glorious supreme man becomes the seal.

original: rtsed mo'i yan lag las kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur te dbang po gnyis kyi bde mnyam dag gis chos phyag rgya //
analyzed: rtsed mo'i yan lag las kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur te dbang po gnyis kyi bde mnyam dag gis chos phyag rgya //
translated: In the branches of play, she becomes the action seal, and by the equality of bliss of the two organs, she is the dharma seal.

original: pho nya mo rnams dag gi dri lnga lus dang padma la gnas de dag rnams kyi rigs lnga ste //
analyzed: pho nya mo rnams dag gi dri lnga lus dang padma la gnas de dag rnams kyi rigs lnga ste //
translated: The five smells of the messengers, located in the body and lotus, are the five families of them.

original: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis gla rtsi dang ni padma gcin dang sha dang rul pa'i dri rnams so /
analyzed: rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis gla rtsi dang ni padma gcin dang sha dang rul pa'i dri rnams so /
translated: By the power of natural qualities, they are musk, lotus, urine, flesh, and rotten smell.

original: 139 / dpal ldan bzang mo padma can du nges 'gyur chu la rgyu ma sna tshogs ma dang glang chen ma //
analyzed: 139 / dpal ldan bzang mo padma can du nges 'gyur chu la rgyu ma sna tshogs ma dang glang chen ma //
translated: The glorious Bhadra is definitely the padmini, and the jalini is the various intestines, and the hasti is the elephant.

original: dpal ldan sgrol ma gos dkar zhes byar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis m'a ma k'i dang spyan ma yang //
analyzed: dpal ldan sgrol ma gos dkar zhes byar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis m'a ma k'i dang spyan ma yang //
translated: The glorious Tara is called White-Clad, and by the power of the family, she is Mamaki and Locana.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni seng ge ri dags rta ru 'gyur te khyu mchog glang po rigs kyi dbye ba las //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni seng ge ri dags rta ru 'gyur te khyu mchog glang po rigs kyi dbye ba las //
translated: The yogi is a lion, a deer, and a horse, and by the division of the family, he is a bull, an elephant, and a peacock.

original: mi bskyod pa dang don yod grub pa dri med nor bu'i phyag dang phyag na padma 'khor lo can /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang don yod grub pa dri med nor bu'i phyag dang phyag na padma 'khor lo can /
translated: Akshobhya, Amoghasiddhi, Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, and Amitabha,ğŸ”½the jewel-handed, the lotus-handed, and the wheel-holding, are the five families.

original: 140 / yan lag phra ldan skra rnams phra zhing rkang lag 'jam la mnyes gshin dpal ldan shin tu bzang mo'o //
analyzed: 140 / yan lag phra ldan skra rnams phra zhing rkang lag 'jam la mnyes gshin dpal ldan shin tu bzang mo'o //
translated: The one with slender limbs, fine hair, soft hands and feet, and very beautiful, is the glorious and excellent Tara.

original: cung zad phra ba dang ldan ring zhing mig ni g-yo ba med la skra ni 'khyog pa padma can //
analyzed: cung zad phra ba dang ldan ring zhing mig ni g-yo ba med la skra ni 'khyog pa padma can //
translated: The one with slightly slender limbs, long, unmoving eyes, and curly hair, is the lotus-holding.

original: ngo tsha med cing 'dod pa drag la rtsod mang la dga' skra ni shin tu chung ba dung can ma //
analyzed: ngo tsha med cing 'dod pa drag la rtsod mang la dga' skra ni shin tu chung ba dung can ma //
translated: The shameless one with intense desire, fond of much quarreling, and very fine hair, is the conch-holding.

original: ring zhing yan lag thams cad rdzogs la nges par yang ba'i yul dang skra ni ring ba sna tshogs ma /
analyzed: ring zhing yan lag thams cad rdzogs la nges par yang ba'i yul dang skra ni ring ba sna tshogs ma /
translated: The tall one with all limbs complete, definitely light, and long hair, is the variegated.

original: 141 / sbom zhing thung la yan lag @51a * //
analyzed: 141 / sbom zhing thung la yan lag @51a * //
translated: 141.The elephant is thickset, short, with thick limbs,

original: brtan ldan shin tu sra ba'i yul dang skra ni sbom pa glang chen ma //
analyzed: brtan ldan shin tu sra ba'i yul dang skra ni sbom pa glang chen ma //
translated: with thick hair, and with a thick country.ğŸ”½The messenger is of mixed caste, belonging to some pure caste,

original: pho nya mo rnams dag pa'i rigs ni 'ga' zhig dag tu 'dir 'gyur dus kun tu ni 'dres pa'i rigs //
analyzed: pho nya mo rnams dag pa'i rigs ni 'ga' zhig dag tu 'dir 'gyur dus kun tu ni 'dres pa'i rigs //
translated: in all the castes.

original: seng ge dag kyang 'brog na gnas shing yul dang rnam bral 'jigs pa med la gtong ba'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: seng ge dag kyang 'brog na gnas shing yul dang rnam bral 'jigs pa med la gtong ba'i ngang tshul can //
translated: The lion is in the forest, in a country, without fear, and of a generous nature.

original: ri dags mgyogs 'gro dang ldan 'gyur zhing yang pa'i yul dang skrag pa'i sems te shin tu 'jigs pa'o /
analyzed: ri dags mgyogs 'gro dang ldan 'gyur zhing yang pa'i yul dang skrag pa'i sems te shin tu 'jigs pa'o /
translated: The deer is swift-footed, in a light country, with a frightened mind, and very fearful.

original: 142 / rta ni nges par 'dod la sred par 'gyur te gzhan dbang gcin gyi dri dang gzhan don gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: 142 / rta ni nges par 'dod la sred par 'gyur te gzhan dbang gcin gyi dri dang gzhan don gnyer ba'o //
translated: The horse is certainly greedy for sex, with a smell of urine, and intent on the welfare of others.

original: khyu mchog rengs pa'i mig dang dman par 'gro ldan rang bzhin yon tan blun po nya yi dri ru 'gyur //
analyzed: khyu mchog rengs pa'i mig dang dman par 'gro ldan rang bzhin yon tan blun po nya yi dri ru 'gyur //
translated: The bull is with a stiff eye, of low gait, stupid in nature, and with the smell of fish.

original: glang chen 'dod ldan nges par dal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te rul pa'i dri dang shin tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: glang chen 'dod ldan nges par dal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te rul pa'i dri dang shin tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: The elephant, being lustful, moves slowly, and is stinking and very confused.

original: sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba sa yi steng gi gnas su rigs kyi dri yi rang bzhin no /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba sa yi steng gi gnas su rigs kyi dri yi rang bzhin no /
translated: The thirty-six divisions are divided by the nature of the smell of the family in the place on the earth.

original: 143 / mchod pa'i don du 'dod pa'i bstan bcos yon tan mang po'i gnas ni rnal 'byor ba yis rig par bya //
analyzed: 143 / mchod pa'i don du 'dod pa'i bstan bcos yon tan mang po'i gnas ni rnal 'byor ba yis rig par bya //
translated: The treatise on desire for the sake of worship, the abode of many qualities, should be known by the yogi.

original: shin tu dga' ba byas kyang rnal 'byor pa la rnal 'byor ma yis ma tshim dngos grub sbyin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba byas kyang rnal 'byor pa la rnal 'byor ma yis ma tshim dngos grub sbyin mi 'gyur //
translated: Even though one has done much delighting, the yoginÄ« is not satisfied with the yogi, and does not bestow spiritual power.

original: mdzes ma lha mo dang ni sha za mo dang mi mo dang ni srin mo klu mo dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mdzes ma lha mo dang ni sha za mo dang mi mo dang ni srin mo klu mo dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The beautiful woman becomes a goddess, a piÅ›ÄcÄ«, a human woman, a rÄká¹£asÄ«, or a nÄginÄ«.

original: mdzes ma dpal ldan chos kyi dbyings su 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis lha mo sgra yi rdo rje ma /
analyzed: mdzes ma dpal ldan chos kyi dbyings su 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis lha mo sgra yi rdo rje ma /
translated: The beautiful woman is glorious, the realm of phenomena, and by the power of qualities, the goddess is ÅšabdavajrÄ.

analyzed: 144 / sha za mo ni dri yi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi mo dag kyang gzugs kyi rdo rje mi yi dbang //
translated: The piÅ›ÄcÄ« is GandhavajrÄ, and the human woman is RÅ«pavajrÄ, the lord of men.

analyzed: gdug pa srin mo gang yin de ni nges par ro yi rdo rje klu mo reg bya rdo rje ma //
translated: The rakshasa woman is indeed Vajravetali, SparshavajrÄ.

original: mdzes ma sems can phan pa byed ma brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' sdom dang bsam gtan ngang tshul can ;
analyzed: mdzes ma sems can phan pa byed ma brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' sdom dang bsam gtan ngang tshul can ;
translated: The beautiful one who benefits beings, who is devoted to the observance of vows, who is of the nature of restraint and meditation,

original: / lha mo longs spyod la ni rjes chags 'gyur te dri ma ldan zhing lhag ma la chags sha za mo /
analyzed: / lha mo longs spyod la ni rjes chags 'gyur te dri ma ldan zhing lhag ma la chags sha za mo /

analyzed: 145 / mi mo 'dod la rjes su chags ma srin mo mi yi khrag la dga' zhing gsod pa'i sems ma ste //

analyzed: klu mo dag kyang 'o ma'i zas can rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor pa yis mchod par bya //

analyzed: de bzhin gzhan du rang bzhin rnams ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
translated: In the same way, the natures should be known by the yogi by the power of their natural qualities.

analyzed: sa yi steng gi gnas su mkha' spyod sa spyod rnams ni sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba'o /
translated: The sky-goers and earth-goers on the surface of the earth are divided by the thirty-six divisions.

analyzed: 146 / chang ni shes rab rang bzhin sbrang rtsi dang bcas bu ram las skyes 'bras las skyes sam shing @51b skyes te //
translated: Wine, which is the essence of wisdom, is produced from molasses, or from rice, or from trees, together with honey.

analyzed: phyag rgya dang bral gang zhig 'thung byed de ni yul can du 'gyur bdud kyi tshogs kyis bskor ba'o //

analyzed: de phyir shes rab lhag ldan sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing sngags pa rnams la dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it is the possession of wisdom which takes away the stain of sin and bestows success on the magicians.

analyzed: phyag rgya gang su rung ba 'dir ni dam tshig rnam par bral ba btung ba'i slad du rab tu bya /
translated: Any seal whatsoever here is to be used for drinking, in order to be free from the commitment.

analyzed: 147 / rgyal po ri bong mtshan ma gcig pu thams cad dus su bsten pa 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog byed na //
translated: If the king, the hare-marked moon, attended at all times by the single sign, takes away the fear of death,

analyzed: shes rab chos 'byung la gnas nyin mor byed pa dang bcas rnal 'byor ldan pa dag ni smos ci dgos //

analyzed: mi bskyod don yod grub pa rgyal ba mchog bcas khyi dang rta dang ba lang glang po dang ldan pa //

analyzed: khu ba gcin dang rkang dang bshang ba dag dang sha dang mchin pa dag dang mkhris pa khrag dang ni //

analyzed: rgyu ma pags pa rnams ni rgyal po rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur te 'khor lo 'dus pa dag la yang /
translated: The intestines and skin are the ten kings.

original: 155 / rdo rje dang ni ral gri mda' dang padma 'dab ma brgya pa lnga pa 'khor lo'i mtshan ma ste //
analyzed: 155 / rdo rje dang ni ral gri mda' dang padma 'dab ma brgya pa lnga pa 'khor lo'i mtshan ma ste //
translated: The vajra, sword, arrow, and lotus with a hundred petals are the five signs of the cakra.

original: rgyud mangs dang ni me long snod du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po me tog phreng ba dag dang gos //
analyzed: rgyud mangs dang ni me long snod du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po me tog phreng ba dag dang gos //
translated: The lute and mirror are the vessel. The lord of men has the garland and cloth.

original: drug pa chos 'byung nges par lag pa'i mthil du 'gyur te sgra yi rdo rje la sogs mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: drug pa chos 'byung nges par lag pa'i mthil du 'gyur te sgra yi rdo rje la sogs mtshan ma'o //
translated: The sixth is the dharma source, which is definitely on the palm of the hand. The sign is the sound-vajra, and so on.ğŸ”½Likewise, the flaying knife, and so on, are the vase. Likewise, the ten-spoked wheel is the yellow cloth.

analyzed: dpal mo'i mtshan ma brgyad pa rdo bar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi'o //
translated: The eighth sign of ÅšrÄ«matÄ« is a stone, which is of the lords of men born from bhÅ«tas.

original: 157 / tog tse dang ni 'od ma'i dbyug pa khro skyes rnams kyi rang gi mtshan ma bcu ru rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 157 / tog tse dang ni 'od ma'i dbyug pa khro skyes rnams kyi rang gi mtshan ma bcu ru rab tu 'gyur //
translated: the small table, the bamboo stick, and the penis are the ten signs of the angry ones.

original: ba lang rva dang kham phor rgyud ldan 'phang dang sha yi gsal shing lag pa'i mthil du 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: ba lang rva dang kham phor rgyud ldan 'phang dang sha yi gsal shing lag pa'i mthil du 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The signs of the bullâ€™s horn, the connected potsherd, the spear, the meat skewer, and the palm of the hand

original: rgyud mangs nye ba'i yan lag dang ni mda' dang gtsug phud can gyi mjug ma 'dir ni brgyad par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyud mangs nye ba'i yan lag dang ni mda' dang gtsug phud can gyi mjug ma 'dir ni brgyad par 'gyur //
translated: are the eight signs of the one with the stringed instrument, the arrow, and the crest.

original: sum cu rtsa drug mtshan ma'i dbye ba rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor pa yis mchod par bya /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug mtshan ma'i dbye ba rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor pa yis mchod par bya /
translated: The yogin should worship the thirty-six supreme signs on the surface of the earth.

original: 158 / slar yang dmangs rigs la sogs mtshan mar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis autpala'am thong gshol lo //
analyzed: 158 / slar yang dmangs rigs la sogs mtshan mar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis autpala'am thong gshol lo //
translated: Again, the signs of the Shudra and so on are the lotus, the plow, and the banner, by the power of their qualities.

original: rgyal rigs ma yi rin chen dar dpyangs su 'gyur mi yi bdag po smyu gu rin chen phreng ba ni //
analyzed: rgyal rigs ma yi rin chen dar dpyangs su 'gyur mi yi bdag po smyu gu rin chen phreng ba ni //
translated: The sign of the Kshatriya woman is a jewel pendant, the lord of men, a jewel pen, and a jewel garland.

original: rje rigs ma yi de bzhin du ste de bzhin chu na rgyu ba dang bcas zangs snod gnyis skyes ma'i //
analyzed: rje rigs ma yi de bzhin du ste de bzhin chu na rgyu ba dang bcas zangs snod gnyis skyes ma'i //
translated: The sign of the Vaishya woman is the same, and likewise, the two copper vessels with the water-born.

original: yum gyi mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi ste da ma ru dang rnga chen cod pan nyid dang bgrang phreng ngo /
analyzed: yum gyi mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi ste da ma ru dang rnga chen cod pan nyid dang bgrang phreng ngo /
translated: The four signs of the mother are the damaru, the great drum, the diadem, and the rosary.

original: 159 / bshang ba gci ba dang ni khrag dang sha dang bcas pa lha mo rnams ni bzhi por 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: 159 / bshang ba gci ba dang ni khrag dang sha dang bcas pa lha mo rnams ni bzhi por 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The four goddesses are feces, urine, blood, and flesh.

original: rna ba sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dang ni bha ga sgra yi rdo rje la sogs drug / rnag dang bad kan dang ni shig dang srin bu chu ser zhag dang ba spu skra dang brgyad po yang //
analyzed: rna ba sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dang ni bha ga sgra yi rdo rje la sogs drug / rnag dang bad kan dang ni shig dang srin bu chu ser zhag dang ba spu skra dang brgyad po yang //
translated: The six are the ear, nose, eye, tongue, anus, and vagina, the sound-vajra, and so on. The eight are pus, phlegm, dandruff, worms, lymph, serum, body hair, and head hair.

original: rgyu ma mkhris pa rus pa rkang dang sna tshogs lus la gnas pa mchin pa dang ni glo ba dang / 160 / rtsa dang pags pa rnams dang snying dang tshil bu ldan pa dag ni bcu ru 'gyur ro mi yi dbang //
analyzed: rgyu ma mkhris pa rus pa rkang dang sna tshogs lus la gnas pa mchin pa dang ni glo ba dang / 160 / rtsa dang pags pa rnams dang snying dang tshil bu ldan pa dag ni bcu ru 'gyur ro mi yi dbang //
translated: The bile, phlegm, bones, marrow, and various [substances] in the body, the liver and lungs, the channels, skin, heart, and fat, are the ten.

original: rna ba dang ni sna dang mig dang kha dang bshang lam dbus dang bha ga dag dang mchan khung sogs //
analyzed: rna ba dang ni sna dang mig dang kha dang bshang lam dbus dang bha ga dag dang mchan khung sogs //
translated: The ears, nose, eyes, mouth, anus, middle of the bhaga, and the armpits, etc.

original: lus kyi yan lag brgyad la gnas pa'i dri ma mi yi bdag po lha min mo rnams brgyad du 'gyur //
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag brgyad la gnas pa'i dri ma mi yi bdag po lha min mo rnams brgyad du 'gyur //
translated: The impurities located in the eight limbs of the body are the eight demonesses of the lord of men.

original: sen mo dang bcas so dang yan lag bcu gnyis thod pa rnal 'byor ma rnams brgyad pa brgyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: sen mo dang bcas so dang yan lag bcu gnyis thod pa rnal 'byor ma rnams brgyad pa brgyad du 'gyur /
translated: The nails, teeth, and twelve limbs, the skull, and the eight yoginis are the eight groups of eight.

original: 161 / bshang ba gci ba khrag dang sha ni sna tshogs lus la gnas pa gnas kyi dbye ba dag la bzhi //
analyzed: 161 / bshang ba gci ba khrag dang sha ni sna tshogs lus la gnas pa gnas kyi dbye ba dag la bzhi //
translated: Feces, urine, blood, and flesh, various [substances] in the body, are the four divisions of the locations.

original: rna ba sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dag dang bha ga zhing gi dbye ba la yang drug / rnag la sogs pa skra yi bar ni sa yi steng gi gnas su tshan do ha yi dbye ba brgyad //ğŸ”½rgyu ma la sogs @53a * //
analyzed: rna ba sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dag dang bha ga zhing gi dbye ba la yang drug / rnag la sogs pa skra yi bar ni sa yi steng gi gnas su tshan do ha yi dbye ba brgyad // rgyu ma la sogs @53a * //
translated: The ear, etc., are the eight divisions of the chan do ha on the surface of the earth, from pus, etc., up to hair.

original: tshil gyi bar ni phyogs zhes bya ba mi bdag 'dus pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnams /
analyzed: tshil gyi bar ni phyogs zhes bya ba mi bdag 'dus pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnams /
translated: The intestines, etc., up to the fat are the four divisions of the directions, the divisions of the assembly of lords of men.

original: 162 / rna ba la sogs yan lag brgyad kyi lus la nges par rnam mang dri ma dur khrod rab dbye rnams //
analyzed: 162 / rna ba la sogs yan lag brgyad kyi lus la nges par rnam mang dri ma dur khrod rab dbye rnams //
translated: The body with the eight limbs, the ear, etc., is definitely the division of the many stains, the charnel grounds.

original: dus me zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan rab tu gsal zhing nges par gnas kyi dbye ba dag la bzhi //
analyzed: dus me zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan rab tu gsal zhing nges par gnas kyi dbye ba dag la bzhi //
translated: The sun, moon, RÄhu, and KÄlÄgni are the four divisions of the definite abodes, the very clear.ğŸ”½Earth, moon, mantra, BrahmÄ, Åšukra, and RÄhu are the six divisions of the field.

original: sa skyes zla skyes sngags pa pa sangs spen pa gdengs can rnams ni zhing gi dbye ba la yang drug / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams dang ni sa skyes chu skyes me skyes rlung las skyes pa dag 163 / brgyad ni tshan do ha yi
analyzed: sa skyes zla skyes sngags pa pa sangs spen pa gdengs can rnams ni zhing gi dbye ba la yang drug / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams dang ni sa skyes chu skyes me skyes rlung las skyes pa dag 163 / brgyad ni tshan do ha yi
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind, and those born from earth, water, fire, and wind are the eight divisions of the chan do ha.

original: dbye ba rnams te slar yang de bzhin ro drug dri dang kha dog dang // reg bya sgra ni de bzhin nyid du rab tu gsal bar 'dus pa bcu yi rab tu dbye ba rnams //
analyzed: dbye ba rnams te slar yang de bzhin ro drug dri dang kha dog dang // reg bya sgra ni de bzhin nyid du rab tu gsal bar 'dus pa bcu yi rab tu dbye ba rnams //
translated: The divisions are again the six tastes, smell, color, touch, and sound, which are clearly the tenfold divisions of the same.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ni zad pa dag kyang mdun dang g-yon dang g-yas dang rgyab tu ste //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ni zad pa dag kyang mdun dang g-yon dang g-yas dang rgyab tu ste //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind, even in their exhaustion, are in front, left, right, and back.

original: kha dog la sogs bzhi po rnams ni phyogs bral dag tu thim pa dur khrod brgyad kyi dbye ba rnams /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs bzhi po rnams ni phyogs bral dag tu thim pa dur khrod brgyad kyi dbye ba rnams /
translated: The four, color, etc., dissolve in the directions, the divisions of the eight charnel grounds.

original: 164 / gnas ni sgrol ma la sogs khyim ste gsal bar sgra yi rdo rje la sogs de bzhin zhing du brjod //
analyzed: 164 / gnas ni sgrol ma la sogs khyim ste gsal bar sgra yi rdo rje la sogs de bzhin zhing du brjod //
translated: The abodes are the houses of Tara, etc., and the clear sound vajra, etc., are said to be the same as the fields.

original: tshan do ha ni tsa rtsi k'a la sogs par rab tu 'gyur te mi bdag 'dus pa rmugs byed sogs //
analyzed: tshan do ha ni tsa rtsi k'a la sogs par rab tu 'gyur te mi bdag 'dus pa rmugs byed sogs //
translated: The Chandorhas are fully transformed into Cauris, etc., and the assemblies of lords are stupefiers, etc.

original: dur khrod khyi gdong ma la sogs pa mchog gi sar gnas rtsa ba'i gnas dang gsang bar bcas pa ni //
analyzed: dur khrod khyi gdong ma la sogs pa mchog gi sar gnas rtsa ba'i gnas dang gsang bar bcas pa ni //
translated: The charnel grounds are the supreme grounds, with the abode of the root and the secret, such as the dog-faced one, etc.

original: yum gyi khyim rnams gnyis te de dag rab tu gsal bar sa la mthar skyes ma dang mthar skyes ma /
analyzed: yum gyi khyim rnams gnyis te de dag rab tu gsal bar sa la mthar skyes ma dang mthar skyes ma /
translated: The mother's houses are two, and they are clearly manifest on the earth as the final-born and the final-born.

original: 165 / gnas ni bud med gsang ba'i padmar rab 'gyur dam tshig dag la rdo rje nyid ni nye ba'i gnas //
analyzed: 165 / gnas ni bud med gsang ba'i padmar rab 'gyur dam tshig dag la rdo rje nyid ni nye ba'i gnas //
translated: The place is the vajra in the lotus of the secret of the woman, and the pledge is the proximate place.

original: zhing dang tshan do ha dang 'dus pa dag dang dur khrod sa gzhi de bzhin de ltar mtha' dag go //
analyzed: zhing dang tshan do ha dang 'dus pa dag dang dur khrod sa gzhi de bzhin de ltar mtha' dag go //
translated: The field, the cremation ground, the assembly, and the ground are the same, and so are all the rest.

original: gnas ni g-yon gyi yan lag dag dang mdun te gzhan dang de bzhin g-yas pa dag kyang nye ba'i gnas //
analyzed: gnas ni g-yon gyi yan lag dag dang mdun te gzhan dang de bzhin g-yas pa dag kyang nye ba'i gnas //
translated: The place is the left limb, the front, the other, and the right, and the proximate place.

original: de ltar zhing la sogs pa thams cad lag pa rkang pa la gnas sor mo'i mtha' yi mtshams su'o /
analyzed: de ltar zhing la sogs pa thams cad lag pa rkang pa la gnas sor mo'i mtha' yi mtshams su'o /
translated: Thus, the field and so forth are all on the hands and feet, at the tips of the fingers and toes.

original: 166 / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang lha mo chu gter du 'gyur dus kyi 'khor lor rab tu grags //
analyzed: 166 / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang lha mo chu gter du 'gyur dus kyi 'khor lor rab tu grags //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are the goddesses, and the time is the wheel of time, well known.

original: shes rab byang chub yan lag yum ste gzhan pa dag kyang sgra yi rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug / chu gter yang dag spong ba rnams dang gzhan pa chu gter rdzu 'phrul rkang pa rnams te brgyad du 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab byang chub yan lag yum ste gzhan pa dag kyang sgra yi rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug / chu gter yang dag spong ba rnams dang gzhan pa chu gter rdzu 'phrul rkang pa rnams te brgyad du 'gyur //
translated: The eight perfections are the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the eight liberations.

original: khro bo lnga ni stobs rnams dag ste rab tu gsal zhing @53b nges par dbang po rnams ni lnga nyid do /
analyzed: khro bo lnga ni stobs rnams dag ste rab tu gsal zhing @53b nges par dbang po rnams ni lnga nyid do /
translated: The five wrathful ones are the five powers, and the five certainties are the five faculties.

original: 167 / yang dag yan lag brgyad kyi lam ni mi yi bdag po lha min dag las skyes pa brgyad du 'gyur //
analyzed: 167 / yang dag yan lag brgyad kyi lam ni mi yi bdag po lha min dag las skyes pa brgyad du 'gyur //
translated: The eight branches of the noble path are the eight lords of the demigods.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun rab tu dbye bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su byang chub phyogs kyi chos rnams te //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun rab tu dbye bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su byang chub phyogs kyi chos rnams te //
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening are in the three realms, divided into thirty-seven.

original: de dag mtha' dag rnal 'byor ma rnams sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
analyzed: de dag mtha' dag rnal 'byor ma rnams sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
translated: The yogin should know all of them in the places on the earth of the yoginÄ«s.

original: de ltar gnas la sogs pa thams cad mi yi bdag po phyi dang lus la yang ni de bzhin 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gnas la sogs pa thams cad mi yi bdag po phyi dang lus la yang ni de bzhin 'gyur /

original: 169 / mthe bo dang ni mdzub mo dag dang slar yang de bzhin du ni gung mo dang ni ming med dang // de yi mthar ni nges par mthe'u chung mtha' dag yon tan gter du rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //

translated: At the end of it, certainly, all the little fingersâ€”the yogi should know them as the treasure of virtues.

original: phyag rgya'i don du ming gi dbye bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis sor mo rnams kyi rim pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i don du ming gi dbye bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis sor mo rnams kyi rim pas so //
translated: For the sake of the seal, there is the division of the names, by the order of the fingers, by the power of the virtues.

original: bcing ba brjod na rdo rje bcing bar 'gyur te nges par khu tshur bcing ba la yang de bzhin no /
analyzed: bcing ba brjod na rdo rje bcing bar 'gyur te nges par khu tshur bcing ba la yang de bzhin no /
translated: The vajra-bond is formed by the vajra-bond. The same is true of the clenched fist.

original: 170 / khu tshur brla yi steng du rdo rje gdan la gnas pa rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje'i phyag rgyar 'gyur //
analyzed: 170 / khu tshur brla yi steng du rdo rje gdan la gnas pa rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje'i phyag rgyar 'gyur //
translated: The vajra-fist on the thigh, on the vajra-seat, is the vajra-gesture of the Lord of Conquerors.

original: skyil krung la ni lag pa g-yon par 'gyur te g-yas pa pus mo'i phyogs nas sa la son gyur pa //
analyzed: skyil krung la ni lag pa g-yon par 'gyur te g-yas pa pus mo'i phyogs nas sa la son gyur pa //
translated: The left hand is in the gesture of equipoise, and the right hand touches the ground at the knee.

translated: The earth-touching gesture of Akshobhya. Again, the right hand is in the gesture of boon-granting. The Ratnasaá¹ƒbhava gesture.ğŸ”½The right hand is placed face down on the left hand, which is in the gesture of equipoise. The Padma-nÄtha gesture.

The right hand is in the gesture of boon-granting, and the left hand is in the gesture of equipoise.

original: gsal bar snying gar son pa rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya gzhan pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: gsal bar snying gar son pa rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya gzhan pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ni //
translated: The mudra of the other Vairocana, the Dharmacakra, is clear and reaches the heart.

original: mdzub mo mthe bo sbyar @54a * //
analyzed: mdzub mo mthe bo sbyar @54a * //
translated: The index finger and thumb are joined

original: ba gdu bu bzhin du gyur pa dang ni gung mo la sogs brkyang pa'o /
analyzed: ba gdu bu bzhin du gyur pa dang ni gung mo la sogs brkyang pa'o /
translated: like a bracelet, and the middle finger, etc., are extended.

original: 172 / lag pa g-yon la shin tu gang ba'i dri med ri bong 'dzin pa g-yas la rdo rje nyi ma ste //
analyzed: 172 / lag pa g-yon la shin tu gang ba'i dri med ri bong 'dzin pa g-yas la rdo rje nyi ma ste //
translated: The stainless moon, which is completely full, is in the left hand, and the vajra sun is in the right.

original: nyi ma zla ba sbyar ba la gnas 'jigs byed rdo rje khro bo las skyes rtse mo lnga pa ni //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba sbyar ba la gnas 'jigs byed rdo rje khro bo las skyes rtse mo lnga pa ni //
translated: The five-pointed vajra, which is born from the fierce Vajrakrodha, is located in the union of sun and moon.

original: bsgoms nas yan lag la ni reg bya cod pa na dang bcas mgo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mtha' nyid du'o //
analyzed: bsgoms nas yan lag la ni reg bya cod pa na dang bcas mgo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mtha' nyid du'o //
translated: Having meditated on it, one should touch the limbs, beginning with the head and ending with the feet, with the crown.

original: 'di ni rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i dpal ldan mchog gi phyag rgya sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i dpal ldan mchog gi phyag rgya sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'o /
translated: This is the glorious supreme mudra of King Kalacakra, which steals the stains of sin.

original: 173 / gang zhig cung zad gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po sa skyes chu skyes mngal skyes drod gsher skyes sogs dang // bza' ba btung ba brtson 'grus dang bcas bla ma dang ni zhabs dag la yang phyag rgyas reg par bya //
analyzed: 173 / gang zhig cung zad gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po sa skyes chu skyes mngal skyes drod gsher skyes sogs dang // bza' ba btung ba brtson 'grus dang bcas bla ma dang ni zhabs dag la yang phyag rgyas reg par bya //
translated: food, drink, and even the feet of the guru, are to be touched with the seal.

original: gang gang bya ba nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ba yon tan dbang gis de la de ni sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: gang gang bya ba nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ba yon tan dbang gis de la de ni sbyar bar bya //
translated: Whatever is to be done, whatever is to be applied, by the power of the qualities, that is to be applied.

original: sa la sogs la dkyil 'khor don dang rkang pa bgrod pa la yang rnal 'byor pa yis bsnun par bya ;
analyzed: sa la sogs la dkyil 'khor don dang rkang pa bgrod pa la yang rnal 'byor pa yis bsnun par bya ;
translated: The yogin should strike the maá¹‡á¸ala on the earth, and so on, and also the feet.

original: 174 / lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings pa yis ni nges par khro bo'i mgon bo chen po'i phyag rgyar 'gyur //
analyzed: 174 / lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings pa yis ni nges par khro bo'i mgon bo chen po'i phyag rgyar 'gyur //
translated: By binding the vajra with the hands, one will certainly have the mudra of the great lord of wrath.

original: mdzub mo thog mtha' bcings shing khu tshur bcings pas gtso bo srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba yi //
analyzed: mdzub mo thog mtha' bcings shing khu tshur bcings pas gtso bo srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba yi //
translated: Binding the beginning and end of the index fingers and making a fist, [one forms] the mudra of the principal one, Victorious in the Three Worlds.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam pa dag kyang lhag ma rnams te rab gsal nges par lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam pa dag kyang lhag ma rnams te rab gsal nges par lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The remaining forms of the signs are certainly the clear ones of the gods and goddesses.

original: lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings la g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa gdengs can rnams kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur /
analyzed: lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings la g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa gdengs can rnams kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur /
translated: With oneâ€™s hands, form the vajra fist and extend the index finger in the form of a hood. This is the mudra of the nagas.
